text:
Located in Miracle Mile Shops at the Planet Hollywood. They do have outdoor seating, but it's in a mall so you'll be people watching. Lots of tvs, audio is on the bigger game that night. Some of the seating have beer taps which is awesome. Wings were great. I haven't tried the other food, it's quite expensive.

If you just wanna watch a game and drink, just go to a sports book with personal tvs and you'll save more money that way unless you're under 21.

Went here with a few friends and the management turned what could have been a bad experience into a good one. We (party of seven) were seated promptly, but there was a disconnect between hostess and waitstaff, so we didn't get a server right away. We decided to leave, and on the way out, one of my friends mentioned why we were leaving. The manager found us about to be seated at another restaurant and asked us to come back. He more than made it up to us. The food was good and the servers were lovely.

I was skeptical when I saw their sign that advertised breakfast for $2.99 on weekdays, but I gave it a try. The breakfast came with 2 eggs, sausage, bacon, and hash browns! The wait was 1/3 of Dennys on the strip and this was a much nicer atmosphere! Definitely try it if you're in town on a weekday!

Came here only to find out that my two favorite bartenders were gone. And since the current bartenders are catty bitchy females who obviously didn't want my money (as shown by their eye rolling) I happily took my money and my tendency to tip 50% elsewhere. The food here sucks, anyway.

We were visiting Vegas for the weekend and picked up a couple of groupons before we went so a groupon brought us into Blondies. 

We started with the nachos, they were huge and very good. We probably could have just gone with the nachos for lunch the serving was that big. 

We each had a burger, bacon and avocado on mine and bacon and bleu cheese for my bf. The burgers were very tasty and cooked to perfection. Add a pitcher of shock top and we were quite happy. 

The server was nice, attentive enough but not always bothering us. Would go back next time in town.

So this bar is the meeting place of The Show from San Diego State University if they are in Las Vegas. 

They have lots of beer pong tables, decent looking waitresses in cheerleader outfits, and ice cold Fireball shots. 

Lots of TVs and big tables to handle our big groups for watching any sporting event.

Worst service, we get there and ask for seating outside but she said we can't put 5 people in front. (Tons of empty tables). Then we ask for the wooden booth towards front and there are drinks on it and we would have waited but she led us back upfront and said she can put a 5 th chair at a 4 top, I asked if she can put two tables together she said no, here's your 5 th chair, and she walked away. 
Terrible so-called fettuccine Alfredo. Our server Jessica seemed to be annoyed at the fact that my family sat in her section. She rushed to hear our drink order then she came back and I had to rattle everyone's order off as if I was an auctioneer because she had no patience. So when she cut me off as I was trying to ask her a question I stopped and asked if she was in a rush because I felt rushed. We had just walked 4 miles to get to the place because my 8 year old daughter wanted pasta with butter. So we trekked to find it. When we did find it we were relieved,and didn't know what we were in for. We are on a family vacation or I would have spent 1.29 to boil my own spaghetti to feed three kids at home instead of wasting $58. My veggie burger was ok except for the ton of seasoning salt that she probably told the cook to pour on it because I asked her if she was in a rush. Good thing I caught it before I ate it and I had to wipe it off with my napkin. I should have asked for a manager but I decided to be quiet and not get my girls upset because they were starving. Again , waste of money and never been treated so horribly before at a sports bar! Oh and drinks were filled right before she gave us the check I had to drink from my kids drink. The one star was for the sweet potato fries. 
Deeply regret going there. Actually am upset my kids were present to see it. I have terrible heartburn also.

WORST SERVICE EVER!!!! Like other yelpers nothing but excuses!!!! Took half hour for drinks messed up on our order then proceeded to argue with us about it! I am a server and they should know better!!!!!!! I highly reccomend avoiding this place do not waste your time!

I'm sharing my personal experience because I appreciate reviews, good or bad.
I ordered a side Caesar Salad and a Baked Potato. The salad was very tasty,  the baked potato was undercooked and unedible. The people working were kind; however, the service was VERY slow. Even though they only had like 5 tables with customers, it took about 10 minutes before they took our drinks order and 10 more minutes to bring it to us. Personally I wouldn't go back there.
Fun sports bar. We sat at a table on their 'patio', which was still inside of the Planet Hollywood hotel. Great area to sit and people watch while eating.

Sadly, ESPN zone doesn't exist anymore (I LOVE ESPN Zone very, very much) at the New York New York, so we went here. 

It did fine, but it buried deep in Planet Hollywood, and not close to the outside. People watching was on the low and the waitress wasn't too alert to us. I had wings and a Coors, he had a chicken sandwich and long islands. Remember, it was barely noon. I'd probably find a place that was closer to the outside. I wanted sunshine and warmth.

We went here for the 15 dollar all you can drink but it was miller lite.  We drank our normal bud light and jager bomb.  Had a steak and salad, not the best but with the pre dinner shots it was just fine.  Our server was cute and blond.  We sat outside or 'outside the bar, but in the mall'. The people watching was great. I would go back to this place as a starter bar.  Booze in the middle of a mall ....perfect.

Returned back to Blondies after not so good past experience. Due to bad review regarding one of their crappy cracked out severs we were asked to come back on owner vonns behalf for complimentary drinks. I decided to take my brothers into blondies for some drinks and appetizers. This time I chose to sit at the bar/ table  with 5 of my buddies. We ordered tap beers and some appetizers. Chicken wings, potato skins, nachos and some fried pickles. Bartender was excessively slow for how dead the restaurant was for a Friday. Food was just blah , bland bar food which was  under cooked and overly fried which hid the frozen flavor I assume. Waited around for this Vonn guy who claimed to be the owner but no one was able to get ahold of him. 

All the of the staff were sitting in the back booth on their phones, and eating. I asked multiple times for side of napkins and ranches ( almost walked into the kitchen myself). Place is trash needless to say, restrooms were gross, next time use Mother Nature it will be a lot cleaner. 

I just can't get with this place and I'm not sure why the health department continues to allow this place to run. Chicken bones on the tables and floors. Staff was less than helpful everyone was "busy" like my last experience. Trash was scattered all around the restaurant while everyone just walked over it. I wanted to throw up my blondies me

They need a HUGE makeover!!
This is for Dirty Blondies...Nice place just NO one in there...Very dead
Loud. Below average wait staff. Food OK. Poor beer selection unless you like bud light, etc. There are better places. In the same mall, see PBR Rock Bar.

Quick summary: poor and disrespectful bar management. Everything else (food) etc cannot comment on, but having a manager disrespect our whole group was enough to think this place is not worth it. Please read to avoid a similar horrible experience. 

Had a beyond horrible experience here. Came to watch an NCAA game this past Saturday with a group of 5. We got there and the service was horrible. We basically served ourselves by going to the bar to get drinks. The waitress didn't start paying attention to us until she realized we were ordering a lot of drinks and would have a big bill. 
Here comes the fun part! Someone on my team got hurt and was on the floor. The opposing team's fans at the bar yelled stay down to a kid! So of course I said that's rude and they proceeded to start a chant calling me an "ahole". Fine I let that one go. Towards the end of the game when the other team clearly was about to win the same fans started the "ahole" chant again for no reason. So I asked the manager if he was going to let that happen at his bar and he said "this is a sports game, get over it." I said ok I understand that but are you still going to accept this kind of behavior and bad environment at your bar? And he said yes. So I left the bar. My friends went to go talk to him and he said rudely "you don't talk, I'm talking." Who says that as a manager? His demeanor in handling this situation was rude and demeaning.  I get that it's a sports game, but he should not one that kind of environment at his bar or treated customers that way. I don't know what his problem is but I did complain to upper management and I hope they will handle the situation accordingly. 
Upper management was very gracious when I told them my situation and I appreciated that. As for bar management HORRIBLE! I don't know how he got this gig as a manager.  As an FYI it was an older man that was the manager on duty for this instance. He could care less about customers and only cared about himself.  No respect for other human beings what so ever. 
So if you want to watch sports somewhere where they actually care and respect you as a customer, do not go here. I'm sorry to say this after speaking to upper management but other customers deserve to know what a bad environment this is.
Dont waste your time or money.  Poor service, food quality horrible..but gave it a star for very cold beer and clear flat screens.

Good deal for the Breakfast special. $2.99 and that includes eggs, choice of sausage or bacon. The only disappointment I had was when the girl took a picture of us and came back trying to sell it. I told her NO & she kept bothering us. I lost my appetite!!!

Terrible service and overpriced meals. 
'nough said.

I've been here before but this time I felt the need to write a review seeing as there are so many negative reviews. My experience was great. Aside from the food being fast and delicious, the price was reasonable for a meal and drink on the strip. The best part however was the service. We were welcomed warmly by the host Joanna and as soon as we were sat, we were quickly greeted by our server Savannah. The service was excellent and was made even better by her warm cheerful attitude. Although it seemed a bit busy and she was running around a lot, she answered any questions we had and gave her suggestions and gave thorough service. Great place to grab a bite and a drink and watch the games. Highly recommended

Arrived at this establishment looking for a place to get some wings and watch a Blackhawks game. I got both of those items but it was a pretty painful road to get there. Had to wait about 3 minutes for the hostess to come out front and get us to a table. The floors here are bare concrete and the chairs have metal legs so anytime you move one it sounds like very loud nails on a chalkboard, starting off on the right foot. Get inside and the place is basically empty and the hockey game is on a big screen right in front of us which is nice. The waitress comes around maybe five minutes after we sit down. We order water and guess what they only serve bottled water! Can't imagine how much bottle waste they must have to deal with on a day to day basis but I'm sure they love that extra $1+ they get to charge everyone. And its not like were talking Perrier here you are just getting a generic plastic bottle with their "brand" on it. We ordered some wings they didn't come out  for a decent amount of time. When they did come out they were pretty far past  "Meh" on the universal-wing-scale.  Wait staff didn't come by the rest of the meal to offer us more bottles of water. Had to flag them down to get the bill and get out of there. Basically, if this place is this slow and painful on a slow Sunday I can't imagine what it is like when it is busy. Also, any place that charges you to buy bottled water rather than serve you tap better be amazing and serving you water synthesized from hydrogen gas and oxygen in their custom reaction chamber.

I went to Blondies for the first time for a Packers game. I looked up the ratings and noticed that it didn't have the best, but was only looking for a cold beer and a game that wasn't available on my TV.

I was blown away by the service and food, not to mention the TVs with every game showing. 

I had a sweet blonde girl, Maria that recommended the ceasar salad. Cold beer, wings and the salad was awesome and so was the service..Maybe in the past, the service was poor but, I'm happy to say that I didn't experience anything like that. I will definitely be going there again for my football and their professional service, sports atmosphere and all the smiles in on the girls.. 

Thanks ladies!

Sincerely,

Stacey  (New Customer and won't be the last)

When visiting Blondies always ask for a table near a waitress!  We had high hopes for this bar but the service and quality of food was disappointing.  If the staff didn't spend so much time gossipping behind the bar then imagine how much more food and beer they could sell...I do miss their fish and chips though (as often as I can)

So here visiting Vegas for the 2nd time with a group of friends. We attended a show at the theatre the previous day and happened to catch this place out of the corner of our eye and had to try it. We all had great food, I personally ordered the sweet habanero wings which were the perfect mix of sweet and spicy. We all had ordered some other things including wings and the garlic fries, as well as chili cheese fries which were all great. However, the problem lies on the service. Our servers name was Jessica. She arrived at the table shortly after we were sat and we waited roughly 10 minutes just for our waters while she was busy talking and charging her phone. After our food order was put in (which was before our drinks had even arrived) we did not see her again for another 15-20mins. I had to get my water refilled at the bar because she was no where to be found, which was odd because there were only a few other tables sat and multiple servers around. Once she finally came back we asked for our checks, which she printed then stood talking to a non ordering table for an extended period of time when we were waiting to leave. Overall, the food was delicious, but the service is exactly what will never bring us back.
I ordered a patty melt and side salad.  The meal was pretty good for a sports bar. Definitely would visit again.

Food was very mediocre, and even for Vegas the price:quality ratio was offensive. The service was also very poor, leaving several from our normally carefree group a bit irritated. We showed up as a party of 8 split in half for ease of seating while it was busy but not packed - many tables were empty, no line, between lunch and game time. I had a $15 pulled pork sandwich, fries were a few bucks extra. The bun was stale and the pulled pork was the mass produced overly tangy bbq goop you get in a tub at the grocery store. I ordered a can of Guinness which overflowed the glass after a proper pour, so either their pints run small or the glass was dirty. The service was laughably bad, missed and forgotten drink orders throughout, and we waited far too long for the check.
Blondie's is such a fun place to kick it! Pizza is AMAZING! Nick and Niall are hilarious and so fun!

Waitress Heidi super nice. However, the food was just soooo BAD everything.  The ice tea was like water....spoiled milk, buffalo chicken wrap was almost like a dog food!!! Don't know why this restaurant still in business. First ever review so unhappy! Have to be drunk to eat there never again!!!

Came here for breakfast... Had the huevos rancheros which were excellent! Side of pancakes was 2 huge light and fluffy flapjacks. Sat "outside" to avoid the noisy TVs so early in the morning. Definitely worth braving an empty mall early in the morning for the deliciousness!

I have to say that for the semi-bad rating i'm giving this place, I have been here twice.  I don't know why, it just seemed to be the right place at the right time.  There really isn't anything special about this place, it seems like your run of the mill sports bar.  The food was mediocre and the service was even worse.  And when I asked for water (everybody needs water in vegas; dehydration from the heat and excessive drinking) they only offered bottle water that was a $1.  I mean c'mon really?  Charging me for water?  So i opted for the cocktail instead (which also sucked, stick with beer).

I'm glad I read Jeannie L's review because it put me in perspective. I've always written reviews based on "what it is". I was ready to give this place a "1" due to the fact that this place is rated as "One of the Top 5 Sports Bars on the Strip" and it shouldn't be. Based on that, I'd give it a "1". Based on what you should expect from a Sports Bar, it ends up being a "3". Average food, a $20 all you can drink Happy Hour (3 PM - 6 PM) for well drinks and house beers, enough TV's, indifferent service (it feels like they are doing you a favor serving you). You can find hotties anywhere in Las Vegas so what makes their servers different? Found their prices to be higher than your average Las Vegas Bar. I won't be back.

Went here a few weeks ago on a Sunday morning and had a blast with some girlfriends! Shout out to the best waitress Cristen!! She was so attentive and funny! The wings that she suggested were definitely on point. We will be back again for sure thanks to the great food and service!!!

Why call yourself a sports bar if you only have 3 out if 8 NFL games on.  Then have blonde waitresses that truly are blonde!!!  Came and left immediately!!  Told us no problem will get game on for you.....crickets.  don't recommend stepping foot into this place!!  They have no clue!!

We went in for breakfast and it was worst experience at a restaurant that I've had in at least 5 years.

Service- Slow and nobody was in there and they had enough waitress on staff. Our waitress had an annoying high pitched voice. I would suggest she gets out of the restaurant industry and join the circus.

Coffee- Terrible. When it was suggested that the coffee wasnt good the waitress said the coffee is terrible here but she was glad to get a fresh pot of crap coffee going for us....yum. She should have just served up scolding coffee and dump it on my crotch and have the bar tender throw the cream in my face.

Meanwhile it is taking forever just to get water to us.

Food- the food finally comes out except for my friends who had to sit and watch us eat half our meals before he got his. BTW he got the same thing as everyone else. nothing special.

My meal was Chicken fried steak and eggs. Kinda hard to screw that up. First off they successfully failed. The piece of meat was thin and small to begin with (thats fine) but they over fried the steak. And they served it already cut down the middle (as if they were checking if it was done). The gravy came on the side and looked soupy. Almost Man sauce like. 

I almost felt like  the restaurant cook wanted me to get on my knees and dump hot gravy on my face.

Meanwhile we are in a sports bar right? Well my friend was looking at one direction of the bar that was just showing rap videos (he said he wished he was Tupac'd) and I was facing the projection tv that was completely angled wrong. I felt like I was Biggie Small'd.

We wanted to catch a quick bite before the 8:30pm variety show in the miracle mile shops. Such a nice surprise in an overpriced shopping mall!

Food: We sat at the bar. I ordered a side salad, potato skins and hubby ordered 1 dozen of barbecue wings. He said the wings are good. My potato skins are the best I have ever had! because they are super crunchy outside and soft inside, topped with crispy bacon and scallions. They taste like deep-fried baked potato. The best part is that the sour cream came on the side, so the crispy potato skin did not get soggy. Also they put the salad dressing on the side without me asking, so you can decide how much you want. 

Atmosphere: Tons of different large TVs with more channels than I can watch. I am not a sports fan but I was thoroughly entertained. 

Service: The bartender did warn us that the potato skins would take 15 minutes to make, because they are made to order. He is exactly right with the waiting time! Attentive

This was not a pleasant experience.  I went in one afternoon during the NHL Finals and set at the bar.  The bar was completely full, yet there was only one bartender.  He was nice, but obviously not super attentive.  I didn't even attempt to order food because I was afraid I'd end up wasting my whole day there.  And it seemed to me the place wasn't very clean.

Given the theme, I was expecting a more upbeat atmosphere.  If I give them another shot, I'll be particular about when I go.  Overall, I'd recommend walking a little further down to Twin Peaks... it's all-around better.

The service was awful and the food was worse. It took forty minutes to get a wrap and a chicken sandwich. The lettuce on the wrap was hot so it was under the lights and the lettuce was brown and wilted. The dressing was hot, and there was little of it. How hard is it to make a wrap?
July 13, 2016 Had one good night and one not so good. Back to Vegas twice a month. Will give it a go and see if we can break the tie. Sports. Great Location.

regarding fight at blondies,first of all they lied 2 us since we were in line getn ready 2 go inside we were told it would be 60 dollars then it went up to 80 while we were in line it went up to 100dollars we wanted 2 see fight so we paid it we were six of us it was.we were told that it would be all u can drink on some beers after a hr they didint have the beer we were drinking once fight got started the waitresses were taking a long time coming 2 help us when fight got started me and two friends went in to girls restroom and there was guys going in there we were getn harrased in there and there was no security in sight one of the guys that we were with went to tell the manager and he was to busy collecting money from people getn in it is not a safe place to go if ur a girl we contacted the owner when we got back to town and he gave us a big story that there was no complains at all on that day A BIG LIE we will noy go back 2 that place ,and if there was any girls on that day that know what i am talking about you should call that place and complain

We go to Vegas often and eat at high dollar places and low dollar places.  Blondes Sports Bar falls in the middle. It's a fun atmosphere but we were really impressed with our waitress Ariel who treated us better and gave us more attention to detail than we have received at the high dollar places.  We came for their breakfast special that was less than $10.  We will be back.

If I could give zero stars I would. Hands down bar none the worst service I have EVER had. Went there in a Sunday (11-10-2013)night....while it appeared there were plenty of servers there, you sure wouldn't know it by the lack of assistance we received. We were seated by a hostess immediately, yet out waitress didn't show up for 20 minutes despite our attempt the flag one down. Food orders were COMPLETELY messed up and NEVER were gotten right.  Drinks were not refilled (we were there for an hour half) When we attempted to discuss these issues with the hostess and waitress they simply wanted to spar with us. HORRIBLE place to go. Steer clear of this place.

Failed disclose the details of the all you can drink and poor customer service. 
*Fine detail to all you can drink- All you can drink stops when the fights end*

Came here to watch the fights. Didn't mind paying the $40 + all you can drink well drinks and drafts. 

Approximate around 730pm-8pm restaurant/bar was not packed. Meduim flow of customers. Sat in the back room with the two large screens. No was around to take an order. Waited about 5-10 minutes got up to go to the other side.  Looked around saw waitresses folding napkins with silverware on the corner table across from the bar in the back.  Asked the waitresses if we could get someone to take an order and all were courteous when asking.
Approach the bar in the back, asked for two drinks, was informed i can only order one at a time. 
After getting a drink, returned to the table and still waiting for someone.  It was approximate  another 5-7 minutes before someone came.

Waitress was courteous, polite and attentive during the course of ordering, delivering and refilling drinks.  At one point later in the night she informed that there was over 200 customers in the other room. Which was appreciative and helped understand if waiting a little longer.  When paying the bill, asked for a refills thats when being informed the all you can drink stops after the fight. 

Food- was ok; not the greatest.

Please have someone station in the other room if you are promoting an event.  Business seemed to have enough staff to cover all areas.  Because the lack of this and the missing of the fine details of all you can drink as a local and customer, find hard to rate the buisness any better.  

Great disappointment

Don't waste your time trying to watch a fight there. They stuffed everyone in the bar like sardines for the Canelo/Chavez Jr fight. It must have been a huge fire hazard. You can't move around anywhere in that place. You can pay for a table but get zero privacy. They make sure to fill up every free space in that bar. Someone hit our table and knocked beer all over us. The person didn't mean to hit our table but there was literally no room for anyone to move. The owner is an absolute prick. I actually don't know who was worse, the owner or the doorman. 

They both had zero customer service skills. I saw them both cursing at a paying customer. I couldn't see but it also looked like the doorman got into a fight with another customer. All I saw was the doorman leaving with his shirt almost off and video cameras rolling. The owner is disorganized and a lair. He said he didn't know he was getting the fight until two days before the fight yet all of the reservations on his website were sold out Wednesday. If you called ahead of the fight they said standing room only cover was 40 dollars. On the day of the fight they changed the cover to 60 dollars and basically gave you the middle finger if you asked why the cover was changed. I get you can do whatever you want it's your business but at least show some respect to your customers. 

The standing room only place is a night mare. The room they put you in has no air conditioning and they throw in a couple chairs; way to close to these giant projectors. It's worse than watching a movie in the front row of a theater. I felt bad for the waiters trying to get around the place. I will actually say the only good thing about our experience was our waiter. She was working extremely hard to make sure we had everything we needed. We tipped her more than the cost of our bill because we figured she would get stiffed and it wasn't her fault. I believe her name was kymberly. She was the saving grace of that place. 

With that being said, I will still never be back to this place just because of the owner. The all you can drink isn't worth it. You basically get bud light or call Drinks in a tiny cup. You get what you pay for. If you're trying to watch a boxing match I would recommend trying diablos or just paying the fee to get into the MGM closed circuit viewing parties. Yes blondies might be cheaper than most places for boxing but you get what you pay for. For a few dollars more you can go to a bigger place and actually have room to breathe. I believe UFC is different and a lot of other places on the strip show the fights. You're almost SOL for boxing but you can pretty much watch a UFC anywhere. 

Go look at a couple bad reviews written and you can see the owners is sure to fire back. Perfect example of how horrible the customer services is there.

Owners reply below covers it all. No idea what he is talking about. He must be mad because I called him out on a policy he wrote online. He told me he made the website himself and what i was talking about wasn't on the site. When I opened the site and showed him his policy he wasn't too happy. Not even sure what lagasse's is but I would rather go there. Thanks for giving me another option. Believe me I would rather pay the extra money else where to be comfortable. If you pay more money to sit outside and you don't get any sound for a fight I guess the people outside are getting screwed. Most unprofessional business run. His 2 1/2 stars is way too high. Don't chance this place for a fight. You'll have a way better experience paying money some where else.
I was there Saturday May 26th and got what i think was E coli virus from a salad. I would be careful when ordering, staff was nice.
We came here for the happy hour drink special and ended up grabbing a bite to eat as well. I would come back for the beer but not the food.

Went at lunchtime on a Thursday.  The service was okay.  They make you pay for bottled water instead of a glass of water.  Food was just okay.

The bathroom was disgusting.  I can't believe this place gets away with this, being in a mall with upper class stores!  The paint on the flooring in front of the toilet was all worn away and greyish looking.  There was graffiti on the sanitary recepticle and no bag inside it.  Everything was dirty and worn out looking.  Yuck!

I definitely wouldn't recommend to anyone and would not return.  There are much better places to try in Las Vegas!

Waitresses/ hostess were very polite. However, Extremely slow service despite the place being empty. Took about 10-15 mins to get water and quite a while to get our meal. My BF ordered the patty melt which he said was very good and I ordered the spinach artichoke dip. I wouldn't recommend - it tasted like frozen creamed spinach.
The best damn wings ever!!! Went here twice over a week while visiting Vegas. One of the waitresses Veronica even remembered the mrs and myself! Great food and great service!

Don't order the all you can eat pasta. The marinara sauce was watery and had no flavor. Service was okay. If you do like pasta and watery sauce, order one order not the all you can eat. The garlic bread was tasty but that was it. There were six of us and we all ordered the all you an eat. The people who ordered the chicken Alfredo pasta said the chicken had no flavor and was rubbery.
The food is great for the portion size. and price to as well.

Bad service!!!!! Expensive, low quality food!!!! I came in with my wife for teacher appreciation and told the server about the promo they had and the server said " everything on the menu." Bill came and said it excludes pizzas. You just said "everything!!!!" It wasn't only just that.... I watched 4 servers stand around talk about shoes visiting with each other when it was a busy crowded place!!! Are you there to make money or just stand around??? Take your business to hooters, twin peaks, Buffalo Wild Wings, even Denny's! They lack service and quality! Come here if your desperate!

Worst service I have yet to receive. My husband and I came in and order food and less than 30mins mins later they brought us the check. We has to spend more more $100 to not be brought the check every 29 mins. Worst service I have received yet. At planet Hollywood I would much rather go to a different sports bar. They were not busy at all just wanted to get rid of customers because of closing time. Do not come here.
This place should be called beer pong bar because that's all there is.  Well, plus some to small 40 inch tvs so far away they can't easily be seen. Wont go back.

Stopped in because we needed a small snack and wanted to watch the World Series.  If you are only going to drink and watch sports, this is a great spot, but if you want to eat you will be disappointed.  The food was subpar and generic at best.  Wings were small and tasted nothing but red hot sauce. He potato skins had no flavor at all.  I didn't expect a high end meal, but did think there would be some standards inside the PH.

If you're shopping at Planet Hollywood shops on the Strip, don't bother stopping in here. Plenty of TVs but you can't hear anything except the beer pong game going on in the back. Service was terrible too.
No beer can chicken anymore.  Used Entertainment coupon.  Sports bar, watched red wings game.

Nice bar in Planet Hollywood but drink prices are thru the roof. Drink card on table does not post prices. For example 12 ounce bottle Bud Light was $6.00. One of their signature drinks posted on the card was $15.00 and only about 6 ounces in a very small martini glass.

Dirty restrooms, cold, old, frozen food, terrible service, no visible manager to talk about an issue, bartender handle complains. Expensive food 25 dlls for a very small dozen of wings witch it has more bone that meat 35 dlls for a fatty tasteless burn ribeye, 25 dlls for a burn break a part hamburger with hard as a rock hamburger bun plus a 8 dlls side of 8 pieces steak fries don't even mention a overcooked salmon and chicken breast

I went here for lunch on Saturday. The boyfriend and I ordered a burger, cheesesteak sandwich, curly fries and a pitcher of beer. My cheesesteak was very very good. I devoured the whole thing within minutes. Had a bite of the boyfriends burger and that was not very good, he regreted not ordering the cheesesteak. Fries were good, nothing special. The beer, well I have no complaints about that. The place is a little pricey for what it is but hey it's Vegas, everything is pricey.
Love this place. Great atmosphere and drink specials. Love the wraps! They show any and every sports event which is amazing. Plus it's right on the Strip!

Went here w/ 9 friends for March Madness 9am  and their $50 min per person charge. Took 30 mins to get first drink from bar and 90 mins to get basic breakfast food then they missed my hash browns so that was an additional 10 mins. Pancakes were barley edible. Lunch came out quicker but they lost me in first 3hrs. How can service be this bad when we prepaid and they know their counts on # of people coming? Or maybe they knew they already had our $450 and got lazy with their service. Won't be back anytime soon and definitely not for March Madness!

Needed help with a reservation,  sent an email to the Blondies inbox -  the manager Catherine responded right away and went above and beyond to help.  I was surprised with the quick response as it was late at night - but she was there to help me fix the reservation ASAP.   Truly an example of great service!

Blondies has a great "sports bar" ambiance and a laid-back "be yourself" vibe.  I love the pizza and the cute young girls in cheerleader outfits.  I'm not even into sports yet visit Blondies about every 2 months.  The beer specials are good.  My only complaint would be the small and inadequate bathrooms - but, who spends much time in there, right?

Meeting up with friends here who came to watch the fight. I'm a girl with zero interest in sports but still wanted to meet with my group. Knowing this, I was still charged the 40 dollar entrance fee which includes all you can drink well drinks during the fight. Also, not a big drinker and told them I had no intention to drink which could be easily distinguishable with the bracelet they put on you at the entrance. They still said it would be 40 to go in. Once in I asked if I can exchange my "drinks" for an appetizer and was told I could not. To make matters worse, there was no AC and the internet connection was horrible. The wifi does not work. Just an all around bad experience. There are much better places around Vegas.

P.S Received a rude, unprofessional response from management! Suggesting my friends said things that were not said, officially made this place 0 stars.

This is the worst service in Vegas. Sat waited 10 min asked again for service. Ordered wings  got that wrong wings arrived no silver ware . waited another 15 min for bill.  Seems to be no manager in charger.

Think they can't ruin a burger?! Think again.  Plus they have the audacity to charge an automatic 11% for TIP!!!!  Service SUCKED, beer SUCKED, burgers SUCKED - need I say more - don't waste your time - grab anything elsewhere - anywhere!

Definitely our favorite sports bar on the strip. Every thing I have tried on the menu has been awesome, I love their Cobb salad...it's huge! You'll never miss a game since there is a 360Â° view of tvs around you. The staff is always friendly - especially our favorite waitress Amy!

Decent place to watch a game but beware of fraudulently advertised happy hours. Our group showed up on a Friday afternoon at 3pm and were advised about fifteen minutes later they weren't going to honor it as there were "basketball games on". They scrambled at that point to remove all the signage advertising happy hour but the fact is the management chose to be duplicitous with their bait and switch action.
Food was ok but the service was slow. Some servers ran around with their heads cut off while others just stood around.

This place is a joke. We did not even eat there bc the hostess said and I quote' umm Hi yah we don't have any tables and like I don't know when another one will be open' really?!?!? So we walked away naturally and around the corner there were three four seat tables open. SMH  She is lucky we are locals and we might try again another day...

Went here for college football on Saturday morning. Friendly staff and was seated promptly. Food is very mediocre. Did not expect Ruth Chris quality, but for the prices, it is on par with a  Furr's or a Denny's. Much better options are all around so do not come here hungry. People were there mainly to drink anyway, so I doubt they care too much about food quality.

Update:  The money was remedied, so I gave it an extra star for that and just having a great time with my friends.  

Went out to party in Vegas last week for Pre New Year's Eve celebration at Blondies. Somebody had to screw something up. The i***t bartender charged us for another party's bill of $138.00 ON TOP of our own overpriced bill!!!   And it is not like we signed for that bill either.  We didn't notice this until 2 days after when we checked our account. Husband did call the manager said to get back to them as they are sure that bill should be refunded back to our account (of course that bill will first be deducted from our account, good thing we are not poor people).  I guess they have a tendency to do this to their clients...so people beware of this carelessness.

I got a livingsocial for Blondie.  I was skeptical about it at first because of the not so great review, but hey 20 bucks for 40, not bad.  Anyway,  i had a pretty good experience with both the food and customer service.  Our waiter was great, but the host wasn't so much.  The host did not smile or greet, seem like she didn't want to be there, not so cheerleader like.   Our waiter was great.  I got the ribeye with sweet potato fries.  I was glad they put the powder sugar on the fries, it made taste much much better.  The steak was really good, nicely cooked and juicy.  Overall it was a good experience for me.

Worst place in Vegas 

At first glance this place is enticing, luring unsuspecting visitors to the sports bar setting. Don't be fooled: this place is awful. Starting with the service and ending with the bill, Blondies is a waste of everything: time, calories, and money. I only ate there with my family and friends because the line at the renowned Spice Market Buffet was over an hour and a half long. The wait staff is pathetic, everything on the menu is overpriced, and the food was not even mediocre. You will end up paying $23 per person for a soggy burger, limp fries, and a flat drink. If you can't make it to the buffet, eat somewhere else in the Miracle Mile.

Not quite sure why this place gets poor reviews. Other than its proximity (it's basically in a mall within Planet Hollywood), the bar itself is awesome. 

There's plenty of TVs with sports, cute waitresses who are quick to take your order, beer pong tables and relatively cheap beer prices. We had a group of about 20 in Vegas for March Madness and we were all thoroughly impressed (this was our second year in a row coming here).

The only downside (outside of proximity) is seats are limited and it's a bit of a shark feeding frenzy when it comes to finding a table.

The wings were awesome.

It's a young crowd here, so if you're over 40 or so you might get annoyed by the volume and drunkeness of its patrons.

This place had some of the most impersonal service i have ever had.  Standoff-ish waitresses who took forever to recognize i wanted a food menu in addition to a beer.  I worked as a waiter thru school and have never seen such disregard for personal attention.  No conversation, no up sales, & dropped off my change without a receipt after dropping off the bill without a word. The wings and beer, along with the Cowboys/Saints game were great.  I will never come here again. Unless its the only place to see the game in Las Vegas.

may I give the fried garlic dough balls one million stars? don't hesitate, don't bother to read the description, just Trust Me and order them. you will thank me later. perhaps not so much those around you later because did I mention the garlic? there's like a whole field of them in there.

lots of TVs, everywhere, perfect for sports-watching. service, albeit a bit distracted, is super sweet. beer is only $6, which is a screaming deal for vegas. the food is your typical over-priced bar fare, and really if you're eating anything other than the fried dough balls, well, don't say I didn't tell you so.

Wow, worst customer service ever. We went there a while back. We chose to eat there cuz my bro in law had bets on the basketball games, so we figured we would go watch the games and drink some beers. -First problem is he asked for a glass of water to go along with his pint, the waitress said they only sell water for $1. Can you say, Illegal? -Second, all of the tv's were on sports center while the games were on. We asked our server to change a tv that only our table could see to the game. She responded with "all of the tv's  have been requested to be on a certain channel by other guests." The place was practically empty. -Third, we ordered a $7 chips n salsa started and received half a basket of chips and prepackaged salsa. I asked for a refill of chips and she said she would ask about refills, and never came back. 
-Four. They had a special for a gallon (ish) personal table beer dispenser. I asked for that with the "blondies"  brand beer and was told they only fill it with buttwiper products, even though it says nowhere on the menu that it was restricted to that brand.
-Five. the food sucked. I didn't expect much from a sports pub inside the miracle mile.. but this was really bad.
-Six and final. I asked to speak to a manager and I addressed all my concerns list with him. As for the water, he told me it cost money to wash the glass so they can't give free water. I just spent well over $100. I think that can cover the rinsing of a glass. 
As per the TV situation. He told me that it is first come first serve, but he would be happy to put a game on for me. (we're done eating now and don't care)
As per the chips. He said he will get us more chips. Again, we're done eating and don't care.)
As for the beer special, He told me that the menu should say its restricted, but won't do anything about it. I told him it was false advertisement and he compared his restaurant to a STRIP CLUB in saying that just because they say you're buying a lap dance doesn't mean you're not going to get a BJ+. 
He blamed all of our problems on the waitress and told us not to tip her if we weren't happy with her service. I responded with fact that it was his fault because he is in charge and even if I didn't tip her, the company would still tax her for it. 
Overall, I will never go back to this dump.

Absolutely terrible. I came here to watch a game, and legitimately they have a million TVs which is nice. I ordered nachos which were 30 dollars after I added chicken, guac, sour cream, and JalapeÃ±os, all things that should automatically come with nachos. The nachos were a pile of broken store bought chips covered in that terrible liquid cheese you pump onto chips at a movie theater. The chicken was some weird unseasoned ground flavorless stuff. The guac was also store bought, and the jalapeÃ±os came on the side instead of being in the nachos.
Then since it's in the middle of the building there isn't much reception so I try to log onto the WiFi. It says you can do it if you check in on facebook or if you have a password. I asked for the password and they said they wouldn't give it to me, that I had to check in on facebook. I'll be damned if I'm going to advertise for them after such terrible food. I guess the 30 bucks I paid for nachos wasn't enough for a WiFi password. F this place.

We wanted to watch some football and tried to give this place the benefit of the doubt but sadly all is true, everything about this place SUCKED!!! If you're staying @ PH towers or shopping @ the mall save yourself and your wallet! Avoid this place! You would probably get better service and a free cup of water @ McDonald's lol!

They messed up our order twice and refused to correct it, even though we asked them to, pointing out their error. They clearly don't embrace the vision of the owners or this business. Disappointing and flippant. The service sucked. Positive note: the food was delicious.

Recently went to this place.  And need I just say ill stick with Applebee's next time. Food wasn't great for the price.  Service was HORRIBLE.   Waitress was chatting it up w her fellow friends and not friendly. Deffinately won't be going back!!

I guess they don't need customers!  We tried to eat there on 6/19/14 around 10:30 am, I asked the hostess if we could get breakfast and lunch at this time to accommodate our small party of 4 and with attitude I was told "the kitchen staff prefers to only make breakfast that early, and that as the hostess SHE can decide if they can make it, but it's really an inconvenience."  This girl had no manners and was no help at all.

Great food - cheap beer - amazing waitresses - and huge tv's!  This is a great place to watch the game, with lots of cheap beer, and great food. We got the groupon that included a pitcher of beer with burgers and an appy for two for $25 - and it was really good. There is a patio so you can people watch in the miracle mile mall area.. and we all know how fun that is!!

Horrible service. We called ahead to see if they were going to be playing a game we wanted to see, and they confirmed yes. Then we got there, and wouldn't agree to put it on. Not nice people. Then we waited at the table, and we got our water,and she never returned. We left. Not worth it!!!

Was seated by a very confused hostess and sat for 30 minutes with no staff contact. Shortly after, the very rude and obviously inexperienced hostess treated like it was our fault, saying "I told you guys that it would be a minute and you've totally overwhelmed the server. I should have had you wait". Then she told us that we'd have to sit at the bar because the server "is really overwhelmed, stressed, and won't take us".....that was it, we left. How the hell is a party of 3 that has yet to even speak to a server overwhelming?

Not the highlight of my Vegas trip.. The waitresses are dressed in high school cheerleader outfits but their attitudes were shitty.. Like they were pissed that they had to dress in stupid uniforms and serve us.. hello, you applied for the job, no one put a gun to your head. The prices are expensive for normal, boring American fare, the waitresses are not sexy, pretty or charming and the food was just OK.. I like sport bars so it is hard for me to give only 2 stars, but in this case I will.

In town for the Jimmy Buffett concert so we thought we'd  just stop by Blondies and watch a football game have a beer and order dinner...... biggest mistake we made all weekend. Great great server, worst food ever. Pulled pork sandwich had zero sauce, park was cold, dry. Maybe it's a cultural thing but never had powder sugar on sweet potatoes. Draft beer warm. Asked manager to take meal off check as I sent meal back twice and finally said " just take it back. " 
Manager was mad at server (She was great!) and then brought us a new bill..... it wasn't even ours.

This place is pretty good. The mozarella sticks were awesome. The wings were ok. I ordered the turkey wrap. It was more like a burrito!! It was good. I didnt really need to order a side of fries but i thought the wrap would be smaller. It was a good experience except for the tv kept getting jacked. They do not check to see if anyone is watching a game before changing the channel. It happened to us 3 times.

I went to Blondies one night with some friends. There was a beer pong tournament going on. All of the people playing were overly competitive including members of the staff/owners of the bar who were drinking. One of the owners was instigating fights between patrons of the bar. I also heard one of the managers use several racist terms while breaking up a fight that broke out over a game of beer pong. Out of all the bars I've been to in Las Vegas, Blondies is HANDS DOWN THE WORST!!
64$ for wings/salsa/sliders/2 beers.. And on the chips n salsa, they put the salsa on the chips in the basket. It was weird..the staff was nice however.

Get the 'big breakfast burrito'! 

Nice place in the mall and its a reasonably priced reliable place for breakfast. The only thing they're missing is espresso coffee.

I ate at Blondies the other night and enjoyed my meal. I had the grilled salmon and it was delicious, cooked just the way I like it. The white rice wasn't great and a bit hard, but I find many restaurants can't get white rice right. The sweet potato fries were good despite some powdered sugar on them (the waitress warned me that they come with powdered sugar). The service was just OK, and that's why I gave it one less star. The server never checked back with us, and it was really loud, but, hey, it's a sports bar. However, I would go back just for the salmon and perhaps the chicken caesar salad wrap, which my friend had. My friend said it was good, and it looked good.

Pros: 
-Location (for me anyway, staying at Planet Hollywood)
-The waitresses' cheerleader uniforms (it's a sports bar called Blondies, I'm allowed to be a chauvinist pig!)
-Some tables had personal beer taps, unfortunately I didn't get to take advantage of this.
-Menu selection was pretty good, a little something for everyone
-They burnt our first pizza a little (definitely still edible) but still gave us a 2nd pizza for free.

Cons:
-The burnt our pizza, but made up for it.
-I got a wrap that was pretty good, but I've had better.
-Value was just meh, probably decent for Vegas though.

With all the places to go in Vegas, Blondies is likely not a priority destination.  But it was good for a weekday lunch and some beers.

Don't waste your time, or money here.

I bought a groupon (thank goodness I didn't pay full price) to try this "world's best sports bar" out. FALSE ADVERTISEMENT! We both ordered a turkey club ($15.99, extra $2 for avocado), onion rings ($8.99), and curly fries ($6.99). The sandwich was okay, but the price includes ONLY the sandwich. Onion rings, I ate one (saturated in oil, the onion was mushy), and the waitress didn't offer to comp it or anything. Curly fries, no seasoning. 

Our waitress came 3 times. Once to take drink order, then to give us drinks and take food order, last time was to give us our check.

Never, ever visiting this place again.

I'm not sure why all the bad reviews.  I had a pleasant experience.  I would agree they are a little pricey, but what isn't on the strip?  We had chili cheese fries, minus the cheese whiz it comes with and asked for grated cheese.  They were awesome!  And we also got the appetizer sampler with onion rings, 2 chicken strips, 4 jalapeÃ±o poppers and 6 hot wings.  More than enough for 2 people.  And our waitress Ingrid was cute and bubbly and checked in on us multiple times.  I'll be here again next time.  Especially for the chili cheese fries and jalapeÃ±o poppers :-)

I don't get the reviews here; I didn't see anything that reflects all the bad reviews. Basically, it's a Hooters with girls in cheerleader outfits instead of the skimpy Hooters outfits. 

It's a sports bar with sports bar kinda foods. How can the expectations be that high? I don't get it. Huge TVs everywhere, bar, wings, finger foods. 

Came here twice in a weekend. Both times, there was no issue with customer service. Both girls were super friendly and helpful. There wasn't a lag in service at all.

I really enjoyed the sliders here. No high expectations or anything. Wings weren't bad. Sample platter was all fried, what do you expect? They include FRIED mac and cheese balls. Delish! 

Also, if you're a Total Rewards member, you get 20% off! Awesome!
Cheap $3.99 breakfast mon-fri if your on a budget or don't want to spend much. It's inside the mall by the box office.

Horrible experience #1 stuff  chewing gum that's the last thing a personstry who works instthe service industry wants to see that ? #2  ,food was cold stuff replaced the food wich is good manager never came to the table to say sorry or follow up ? Tables around were dirty for a long time before the busser realized tables need to be cleaned I  guess on the side corner station where all the gossip and drama goes on and Facebook is more important.....

To all the servers and busser at this place You guys  enberassed  the service industry .

here for a bachelor party for the weekend, reserved 2 tables....they gave away 1 of our tables and then expected us to pay the 400 dollar reservation fee for the other table when they sat someone else at our table .... totally disrespectful to all of us in the party. Cannot believe the way the server and manager treated us after spending this much money in their establishment. DO NOT GO HERE!

Shopping our way around the Miracle Mile shops this was a likely pit stop to "refuel" since it's the halfway point for the mall.  Seating is available inside or on the "mall patio".  Bartenders were very friendly and service was prompt.  Prices weren't too bad and they have more than enough tv's to cover every game you might want to watch.  I'd stop here again for a drink and maybe an appetizer next time thru.

The food and drinks were fine, pizza was really good. Our server seemed a little flighty. I ask to see the drink menu because I wanted a mixed drink. She handed me the list then walked away. She may have been giving me time to look it over but a little communication that she would be right back would have been nice. Tons of TV but audio for only one game.

This place is great for guys. Tones of TV's with multiple sports on. They have beer pong tables and sell a beer pong pack with cups and balls for $5. 

Happy hour was between 3pm-6pm. Really cheap beer. 

The waitresses were friendly, helpful and very talkative. The barman was also a really nice guy. 

Great for groups.
The hostess was hot, and the food was good. The service was great and the prices were reasonable.

Pro's: Beer pong tournaments! Good happy hour drink special. Cute outfits for the cute waitresses. Nice people watching seats. 

Con: generic hot wings, Pizza tasted like Domino's

This is the place I go to for beer pong! Thursday night tournaments is where it's at! Whether it's a weekend or week night this place has a crowd. It's a great place to pre-game. The staff is great & so much fun! They have improved the look of the place, by adding a ton of tvs. The food is always good, try the chicken strips, & the bar is always full! Beer pong is $5 for setup & the cost of the pitcher. They have about 8-10 beer pong tables depending on the night. It's only a handful places left in Vegas that offer beer pong nightly. I highly recommned Blondie's as your official pre-game place! If you're looking to watch a game/s & NOT be at a sports book, this is one of the top 3 places on the strip you'll want to consider.

The eggs Benedict sliders keeps me coming back! well that and the beautiful ladies... but seriously these sliders are a must try! the patio area you have a nice view of the surrounding area. I have tried a few different things on the menu and most of it is mediocre but i would defiantly give this place a try if you are considering it. every time i have been here they have been super friendly to my 2 year old so thats a huge plus. the servers are very polite and well trained and big shout out to the kitchen for plate presentation.

What's better than a red beer and people watching?
I think locals appreciate this more, because I was entertained four a couple hours watching everyone roaming by.

Good bar food and a few great bartenders.

Being from Chicago this bar reminds me of two from home.  They are a bar.  They have TVs.  They get you drunk.  I have now been here 3 times and will keep coming on every trip.  First trip we were all 21 and they had a $10 bud light and beer pong wristband.  We got drunk.  Second trip i'm 26 with all of my cousins and aunts and uncles they have a $20 wristband we all get wasted.  We sat at a table the waitress never came so we ordered from the bar and got wasted.  We had a great time and the next morning we had to piece together the night.  3rd trip out there during football sat at the bar and had a bartender / barback named g being really cool with us.  He even gave me a jameson bottle opener from a promo they had.  We are planning a trip for the end of September and plan on going there at least once.   EVERYONE LISTEN HERE IF YOU TIP WELL THEY WILL TAKE CARE OF YOU.  YOU WILL NEVER HAVE TO WAIT.

The description of the food is very misleading "the best wings in town " not at all I've had better chicken from a local restaurant by my house. The chicken was very disappointing and wasn't at all what I expected the service is mediocre the servers act like they don't have time to check on you or wipe the tables down before you sit let alone grab the check. The only good thing about this place is the $20 open bar that's it period.

Christen was awesome!! Excellent service and great food!! Will definitely come back. Lots of video screens to watch all different sports. We enjoyed the mozzarella sticks and spaghetti and meatballs. Both were delicious!

Fraud! Don't go here. Went here because of signs saying there's an Oktoberfest with $5 foods and $2 beers and $5 beer mug for participating. It's not even a mug it's like a mini wine glass. Not even close to what all the signs say. The waitresses don't even know what it's all about. And the food isn't what they say. 

It's sad you're spending all this money and you can't get what you want from what they offer on the sign. 

Won't come here again! Waste of money and time. Left hungry and thirsty. I felt bad for the kids too.

We were not impressed after coming to Blondies. We were so hungry, and wanted something that would cost under $20 a person, so we came to blondies. 
When we arrived we were promptly seated, and given menus. We weren't ready the first time the waitress came around, so she left, and we waited for a good 15 minutes for her to come back. Finally she came and we ordered. My mom and were feeling the same thing, grilled cheese and tomato soup. So we ordered, and we waited. We waited at least another 25 minutes, but mind you, when you are super hungry it feels longer. 
During the wait, I needed to use the restroom. Somehow I didn't see the restroom sign, so I went and asked the hostess. She was startled when I approached her because she was in her phone. After seeming annoyed, she showed me where it was. 
The first thing I noticed about the bathroom was that it was very dirty. I actually waited for a different stall, because the only other one available had urine on the toilet. When I went into the other stall, it was of mediocre cleanliness. It wasn't as awful as the last one, but it still smelled awful and there was toilet paper everywhere. I felt dirty after leaving that restroom. 
After leaving the restroom, I go back to our table where our food has finally come. The grilled cheese was luke warm, and I'm not even exaggerating! There was a single slice of cheese, and it was only half melted. My mom brought this to the waitress' attention, and even she agreed this was unacceptable (Especially after waiting SO long..) She took it back, and brought us menus to order something else. 
Again, after this she was gone for another 15+ minutes!!!!! When she finally came to take our order, we just ordered two apps to share. We ordered tacos and chicken strips, and at $12 or $13 for chicken strips, they didn't even come with fries!! OH well, its vegas right? So we ordered and continued to wait. Again, after ordering the second time it was at the VERY least another 25 more minutes until we got our food. I asked for some extra ranch, and that alone took 10 more minutes. Mind you, I didn't mention that they were so slow when we were there so I am not sure what was going on. 
The ONLY good thing about this experience was the food. The chicken strips were hot, and so tasty and the tacos had just the right amount of spice to them. My mom said the tacos were luke warm, but I thought they were fine. I mean the meat inside was hot, can't expect the lettuce and other fixings to be hot. 
I wish I would have remembered our waitress' name, because even though the service was slow, she was super nice and very apologetic toward us, and even took $7 off of our bill so that was a plus. 
After all was said and done, we were there for the better part of two hours. It was kind of ridiculous, but we left full finally. I'm just glad we didn't have plans or anything after cause we surely would have missed them

Also, for what its worth, not that I care, but none of the waitresses on staff were blonde when I was there, not one!

Came here to kill some time one morning and made the mistake of ordering breakfast here.  $2 bloody marys...$3 mimosas...cheap breakfast specials.  It wasn't even worth the couple of bucks- the food was pretty cheap and tasteless and my bloody mary couldn't even pass for tomato juice.  

This place would be better for drinks and bar food but for games there is a $50 minimum.

The service was pretty good however but again...food not really anything special nor is it even worth the cheapness.
Great weekday drink and breakfast specials: $3 breakfast, $2 bud lights, and $4 fireball shots. Good place to drink and watch sports.

Came here starving,got sat down quick,but no one came to take our drinks or food order down.No waitress in sight.very disappointed. Its beyond loud in there also.Screw you blondies and your horrible waitresses. Took our money elsewhere

Came here for the UFC Fight on Saturday night.  Bought tickets for a table for 6 knowing only two were going to come for sure.  $40 to get in and ALL you can drink draft beer is SWEET!  Actually worked out cool finding 4 random people to watch the fight with.  Definitely will be going there for the next UFC Fight, $40 will get you 5 bud light bottles elsewhere.  The staff was cool with how busy it was and I had some Jalapeno poppers that were great!  A fun spot inside Planet Hollywood in the Miracle Miles shops.  Check it out, fun place and good food!

My wife and I went in to have some wings and fries. Let me say our waitress Taylor was absolutely amazing. The food was fast, drinks faster and service was top notch. If you have had a few to drink and want some great food come into Blondies and enjoy a good meal.
Their are tv's in every corner, so you won't miss a second of the action. There are 4 beer pong tables that you can enjoy and possibly get over your buzz. 
The best thing is that the food was fast and the service (waitress) was outstanding. 
So cone by here at the end of the night and enjoy some good food. We will be back mainly because of Taylor.

This bar is a nice place to gather and watch a few games.  Me and my travel amigos met here for the Night Crawl group.  The bartenders and the waitress was awesome and the drinks were on point. We even found out that the manager was from Texas.  That made the fun even more better.  When I go back to Vegas I will definitely be going back here.
Went here as part of club crawl, and its here when I got pretty lit. Cool sports bar.

Great spot to watch a game while in Vegas.  There are TVs everywhere!!!  Bonus is that the salads are humongous.  I couldn't even finish my Cesar salad.  I always appreciate a substantial salad when I am out at a bar - that is unusual to find.

This place was complete crap we got a crappy waitress with an attitude never check once to see if we wanted something more to drink didn't bring no napkins are forks and slammed the glass of water on the table and has the audacity to ask why I didn't leave her a tip dumb blondes I'll never eat here again!!!

Went in with a party of 10 to watch the Warriors game, got a table right away that was the best part.  It was pretty slow, but took the waitress about 10mins to come by and say I'll be right with you. Another 5mins later she came back and took the drink orders.  Couldn't have soda because they soda Fountain wasn't working. We ordered a few appetizers, Buffalo Wings, potato skins, fries, chicken tenders and a chicken Parmesan sandwich. Long story short the wings were cold, the chicken sandwich was dried, fried too long probably.

Summary: This is a great place if you want to watch a game/sports and drink loads of cheap beer while eating some (to my surprise) pretty good bar food. Since I don't drink - sadly the cheap / all you can drink beer was a waste on me. I'd bring a crew here for sure.

I went to Blondies to view the UFC fights (Go John Jones!) - cover was a bit overpriced $40! BUT I forgive that for the cheap beer - again, wasted on me - but I can see how paying $40 cover + $20 = damn good night for some folks. 

Atmosphere: What you'd expect from a sports bar - loads of TVs, etc. If you have a big group you can "buy" a big booth with primo viewing to the screens, if youre a small group or solo - there's plenty of seating available.  The people in this place range wildly - you are in Vegas. I found mostly friendly sports-watching-having-a-good-time people. 

Food: HEARTY portions, and surprisingly pretty good. I had a BLT and shared some onion rings, both of which were not greasy and overdone - but tasted fresh. Even the toasted bread on my sandwich was fresh. 

Service: Decent. I was happy that the girls in cheerleader uniforms weren't so boob-a-licious that it was annoying. They were cute and friendly, and bless them for having to run around with pitchers of beer serving half distracted sports watchers. They were fast, I didn't wait forever, and there was enough of them that i never had to flag one down.

Overall - better than Buffalo Wild Wings for a little in-hotel Vegas sports action.

If I were the owners of this establishment I would be so embarrassed! The servers are more concerned about their outfits than serving food! The waitress was cranky and showed no interest in serving us. She expected us to order the moment we sat down and then once we ordered she was never seen again!  We had to pay at the bar because she literally vanished! We spent most of our meal with angry guests on front of us complaining about how the restaurant overcharged their cards, and the waitress pretended she didn't know how to fix it. The food was greasy and not worth the price paid. And to add insult to injury both people in my party had an allergic reaction to the food! 
There are too many other options to settle for bad food and crappy service! I really wish I knew how to contact the owners because we spoke to the manager and he did nothing! Never again!

I only tried two appetizers when I was there but I liked them and the atmosphere. This is a sports bar, so it's loud and they have TVs everywhere. My brother wanted to watch a game, so I stopped in to say hello. I had some garlic balls and fried Mac & Cheese.....both yummy!! I def want to go back and try more. 

They have beer pong tables set up and have tournaments certain nights of the week. Seems like a fun place!

First time at Blondies, service is my only real complaint, it wasn't terrible but wasn't great. Everything just took a little longer than it should have to get to the table, although when the food did show up I was pleasantly surprised with how good it was. I got the buffalo chicken wrap and it was way better than I expected, would recommend! We got the chips and salsa as an appetizer, they were ok, typical store bought chips and mediocre salsa. Decent but not with the unnecessarily high price.

In the Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile of shops. An okay place for lunch.  We were hungry and stopped in.  Overall a good lunch in a typical sports bar.   Lots of TVs not too loud.  We had Burger for  $16 and Sandwich for $16 and shared an order of curly fries for the table.  A good selection of micro beers including nice Brown ale and the Goose island IPA.   I Agree with the comment posted earlier -- I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here but wouldn't avoid it either.

I love the hot wings. They service a very generous amount of celery and carrots along with it with the wings. I usually have to ask for extras at other hot wing joint. I was a very satisfied customer.

I've been here twice now. Nice sports bar to grab beers, bar food and watch some games. Several TV's and fun atmosphere.  Didn't partake but they had some beer pong tables and other games to add to the mix. Not a great selection of on tap beers for a place like this but I was able to find a couple I liked. Probably come back for a game and beer.

Big game on the hundreds of TVs they had there. Great for the sports fanatics or those of us that like to watch the sports fanatics. Wait staff are friendly, knowledgeable but too few for the crowd that was there Friday night. Food was good, drinks were good too. Would recommend this place if you were staying at the Elara Hilton of close by. A good place to relax for a little while until moving on to the next thing on your list.

Food is okay, got the sampler appetizer...wings weren't well sauced (some completely dry) Mozzeralla stick were amazing, tenders meh, onion rings ok, jalapeÃ±o peppers eh as well. Saw a few pizzas go past and they looked pretty good the small is a decent size it's like a shmedium. Bartender was super sweet, when we saw her. Super understaffed.

This is a place you would want to avoid at all costs!! The service is very lacking, the bathroom is not a place you want to use. The food is mediocre. I should have gone next door to Lombardi's! 
     I blamed this place on the management. They should retrained the staff and clean the bathroom and have better food!! There were 4 of us dining here, we couldn't wait to get the hell out of this restaurant!
The bartender Belle was great!!!! She kept the drinks coming and provided excellent service..... I'll definitely be back again

Pretty cool place! They have countless tvs with all kinds of sporting events on them, and they have a system where you can listen to your game over your smart phone. This way there isn't fighting over who's game should be heard. Downfalls... the people don't know what channel the games are on. Tried watching an LA Kings game there and was told repeatedly that it wasn't available. Luckily my brother know the owner and regulated... Well wouldn't ya know? They were able to find the game... what a shocker... the all you can drink happy hour is pretty cool too. Get it with the Groupon and save yourself $10. The bad part is that it's all Bud products or well drinks made with ass-flavored liquor. What do you expect for $10? 
Food is meh. 
Vibe is cool.
Chicks in cheerleader outfits... effing awesome!

LETS GO KINGS!!!!

Quit deleting my damn review.

FYI this is not based on an "Employment Issue." I was obviously NEVER employed here. I'm not blonde and I'm a fatass.

However, besides the fact that the service sucks and the portions & prices blow, I still think employees deserve respect.

I watched a male manager here berate one of the waitresses and tell her she wouldn't have a job anymore if she didn't wear more makeup, as she was in one of their skimpy little blue cheerleader outfits.

And yes, I can base my opinion/review on the ENVIRONMENT as I see fit.

You shouldn't air your bullshit in front of customers. We will never be back.
Stick that in your juice box and suck it.

19.99 All You Can Drink AYCD! Came here this past weekend got to watch the USMNT vs Jamaica game and it was great. Happy hour was perfect had a ton of beers and a ton of well drinks, the waitress we had was pretty on point brought me drinks before I could even ask for any. 

The only problem was we sat on the outside and the TV wall had the lines through it so I couldn't get a cohesive picture, other than that it was a blast.

What a disappointment!

I was here a couple of years ago and ordered the beer can chicken.  It was moist and delicious.

I returned last weekend with friends and suggested the expensive beer can chicken ($17), remembering how good it was the last time.  Boy, has the quality declined!  Before, they used to fit an entire beer can into the chicken, but now, then chickens are so small, they have to use one of those Texas longneck style aluminum beer cans cuz the normal style could not fit in this stingy, malnourished bird.

Our table ordered two of these lame entrees, and both were undersized, dried out and tasteless.  Nothing like I remember it.  Water was free, but tasted like crap (unfiltered Vegas water, I presume).  My friend ordered a margarita on the rocks and had to send it back because it tasted disgusting and was the worst she ever had.  Veggies were overcooked.

An expensive meal for crap food.  NOT impressed!  Never going back there again.

Walked through the miracle mile shopping center and saw a sports bar with endless pasta bowls...
Games were on, so we stopped...

Food tasted good. The bowl was large and plentiful...
But if you advertise endless pasta, shouldn't you at least check back to see if the customer wants more?
Would have been nice to at least be asked...
I could have used some extra sauce and topping for the giant pile of Fettuccini.

Fun place to watch the game but food isn't so impressive and it is somewhat pricey. I am rating this on food only. Husband ordered a regular hamburger ($13) which does not include fries and I ordered a cheesesteak ($16) no fries either. Fries purchased separate.  Food was just ok tasting. It wasn't bad but nothing to write home about. I would say they do need to improve presentation (refer to pic). So many other options to choose from so if you are there to eat maybe try somewhere else.

It was good. Breakfast special was all week ... Heck yea? So we had the specials Bloody Mary and bud light and $3.99 and the omelet. Someone  asked to take our photo we never got it... Though . Kinda upsetting

I went here like a year ago. Service was great. personally i love being around good looking blondes so that was a plus. I had the Fried Ravioli.. They were Perfectly fried and Im going back this month can't wait to go and try some other things on there menu...

Had a friend come in from out of town that wanted to do some shopping so i took her to Planet Hollywood. After the spree was done we stumbled upon Blondies starving around 6pm yesterday for dinner looking for a quick/tastey bite to eat on our way out. Enjoyed the environment, reminded us a lot of Hooters/Twin Peak and the way their servers and atmosphere is set up. We decided to hang out because we had such an amazing server named Christina, she got our order in quick and kept the cups filled! Im a water buffalo so the fact she kept up was exhausting alone I'm sure and she had many other tables!! She gave us some fun shots to get us started on our what turned out to be amazing night. Thanks again Christina hope you can see this maybe when we come back to see you we can buy you some shots for you!

Terrible service. don't expect them to even try if you have a special food request; I have a dairy allergy and the waitress told me it was hard to communicate with the kitchen and that I pretty much couldn't have anything.  I asked if the wings and chicken were prepared in butter and she told me "they weren't sure". Went to PF Changs where they knew how the food was cooked.

Ugh. Forget being a single women in here and getting any service at all! Sitting at the bar ordered a beer took 10 min...then asked for a menu finally was able to order my "all you can eat pasta" and have been ignored for an hour can't order another bowl. Literally have told guys to go down to the other side of the bar where the bartenders actually pay attention to the MEN! 

So girls. Don't even bother.

Another one bites the dust. 

I fell victim to its convenient location to the V Theater.  We were seeing a show and decided to grab a bite to eat.  We were greeted and seated immediately.  That was the end of the good.  

Service was just ok. I don't think we received a refill on either of our drinks.  A different guy brought our food to the table so the waitress didn't do much. 

It's funny how on their menu it's labeled in a special box ' Famous Cobb Salad'.  I love Cobb salads so I wanted to try it.  What was famous about their salad? I couldn't figure it out.  Just about every other Cobb salad I've eaten, the toppings are diced.  Not this one they served.  It looked like a disaster.  The tomatoes were sliced.  The bacon wasn't in diced pieces.  It just wasn't good and wouldn't order again.  

With a premium location, I'd hope something improves here.

First time here and had Mallory wait on us. She was AMAZING!! Five stars to her... Very refreshing to get an honest upfront server. More  establishments should have servers like Mallory. Hats off to her!!!!!

Too expensive.  So-so service.  The garlic fries were ok.  Their Happy Hour only includes Bud and Coors, which you wouldn't know from their signs.  They no longer have the individual speakers so you can hear the audio from whichever game you choose.

Horrible, just say no.

We were going to Planet Hollywood for a show and I had just looked at groupon and saw Blondies.  So I thought the groupon would make it a decent price for a tourist trap and it was bar food, so we could find something there.  I looked online at menu and prices.  When we got there every item was $2 more than online.

Upon walking in, she went to sit us out on the walkway, but we asked for inside to watch the game.  Then she took us to the back where many tables of rowdy and obnoxious people were playing beer pong beside our table.
