We asked to go back out front, but in the meantime, the odd waitress "yelled" and I do mean yelled snidely at the beer pong people that their food was "taking up her table"....well, they were doing what they were paying a hefty price for... ordering bad bar food at hefty prices as well as wasting and drinking a lot of beer.  However obnoxious, they were the demographic.  That being said, I am not.  So unless you are currently going to "keggers" you need to find another dinner spot.  The food was horribly cheap and generic boxed food.  Three waitresses were having a disagreement behind the bar.  Two business suit pervs were feeling up the waitresses.    And while, the waitress who yelled at the other customers continued to not ever smile, she was actually working hard and efficiently, just minus any smile or happiness.  She did keep us refilled and said thank you when we left.  

Pretty much, this place was a complete cluster f.  (and for me to use that term is the only way to describe it).  The vulgarity is the only way to describe the place.
The worst place we ate at for breakfast. Coffee was terrible, toast was hard and the bacon was terrible. The service was also pretty slow. Keep walking and try the la salsa Cantina for breakfast.

Servers were not at all personable.  Food was OK.  Overpriced!  The server, Maddison, claimed she told us about the added costs NOT on the menu.  After leaving 15% for her average service, she actually followed us out of the place for an additional tip amount!  NEVER had this happen before, EVER!  STRONGLY recommend avoiding this place unless you enjoy paying hidden costs.

Went here to watch some football games and have a few drinks. We were staying in Planet Hollywood so it was convenient and good for a group of people. We got in and got a table right away. The tables are pretty cool because they have taps right in the middle and you can poor your own beer and pay by how much you drink. That would have been awesome for our rather large group except the selection is limited on what beers you can choose and our waitress kept encouraging us to get buckets of beer because she didn't want to deal with the hassle of turning on the taps. We ended up getting buckets of beer because she kept pushing us to even though we really wanted draft beers. It became evident later that she was just lazy and didn't want to come back and serve us. I think she checked on us one time in the several hours we were there. We had to go to the bar to order more beers because she decided to sit in a booth in the back and fold silverware. I know the forks won't roll up in the napkins themselves but come on check on your tables. We had to hand deliver our credit cards to her because the bar couldn't check us out. Overpriced beers even for Vegas and the service is terrible. Go elsewhere.

$2.99 breakfast was not bad, but just for weekdays. Be aware that orange juice is $5 for a small plastic cup whereas mimosa is only $3. I couldn't find any beverage prices on the breakfast menu. It's clearer on the $4.29 breakfast next door where Bloody Mary or coffee is only $.99.
Nice bar. Food is horrible. Had a chicken parmesan hero, meat was all garlic, some of the fries were still frozen.
Great place to hang out at the bar. Fun bar staff! Too bad they have a longhorns flag hanging up. ;-)

My friends and I wanted to grab a cocktail, some lunch and watch the game and happened upon Blondies inside the Miricle Mile Shops at PH. Pretty much your typical sports bar, vast menu, a well stocked bar and waitresses in skimpy cheerleading outfits. A couple us were in the mood for breakfast and a couple of us were in the mood for lunch and the Blondies menu had something for everyone. I opted for a big breakfast sandwich that sounded absolutely delicious on the menu but when it arrived it left a lot to be desired, only at about half of it, not so good. The biggest suprise was one of my buddies ordred a pizza, now being from Chicago I never expect much in the way of pizza when traveling outside Chicago but this pizza was actually outstanding, perfect neopolitan(NY) style crust and generous toppings  and portion. 

All in all Blondies suited it's purpose, feed a group of us that all had a taste for something different, get some booze in our systems and watch the game. Good serve and ok food.

I was hoping for a good (drunk) time but nothing. I like many others got the Groupon deal of an open bar for $10 from the regularly priced $20. Even if you don't have a Groupon, Blondies advertises the best happy your in Vegas: All you can drink (beer or well drinks) from 3-6pm or 10pm-1am, excluding game days. Blondies is located inside the always busy Miracle Mile in Planet Hollywood. It's a great place to catch a game compared to other pricier places on the Vegas strip.

Me and my lady friend went in on Friday, January 17 and we're expecting a wait but it was pretty dead for 10pm on a Friday night. Blondies has some serious square footage and there's a plethora of sports memorabilia and flat-screens littered throughout the bar and grill. We were told to seat ourselves wherever we wanted and we headed towards the back bar. However, we quickly made our way back to the front bar after the bar tender informed us she was closing up.

After seating ourselves, a server was quick to tend to us and we let him know we had the open bar deal. He went on to put a bracelet on us and began serving us well drinks. Simple vodka and juice drinks. The first drink was nothing to brag about. I felt like I was drinking expired cranberry juice while my girlfriend drank orange juice. I knew then and there we were not going to get drunk. Five drinks (each) later we were exploding from a big dinner and tons of cranberry and orange juice. Not even a buzz. We decided to call it quits and take our loss. 

I think my biggest gripe is the inconsistency in drinks. The bartenders were great guys but one was making us real drinks while the other was serving us juice. Regardless I was nice enough to tip every time. The TV at our bar was playing an old UFC fight and my lady was forced to watch some guy get his head and nose bashed in while we drank our watered down drinks. We could have asked to change the channel, but didn't feel like bothering our bartenders. I'm sure this isn't a bad place by any means but I'll have to dispute their claim as the best happy hour in Vegas. 

Ambiance/Decor: 3/5
Food (Drinks): 1/5
Service: 3/5
Price: $$
Overall: 2/5

Pros:
+ Full bar
+ Open 24 hours
+ Drink specials
+ Lunch/dinner menu
+ Cute hostess' and bartenders

Cons:
- Open bar drinks vary in strength

Good place to watch the game but nothing else. Lots of TVs around. The food is whatever's. It is bar food. The garlic fries were super greasy. The chili cheese fries tasted good. And they use cheese whiz. The Philly cheese steak lacked flavor. Burgers/sandwiches are about $16 each and don't even come with fries. It's super expensive here.

If I could, I would give this place an in between 2-3. The food wasn't awful but it wasn't great. My husband and I sat out on the "patio" area at a high top table. The service honestly wasn't bad and our experience was brief. I was actually really excited about this place. I liked the idea of a girly sports bar as a girly sports fan and I dug the waitress and hostess cheerleader uniforms as a former cheerleader. It was cute and seems like a great place to catch a game and a beer. It's a little small but they have a ton of TVs (as one would expect in a sports bar!) I ordered a grilled cheese with tomato for $10 and it didn't come with fries. What kind of restaurant serves sandwiches without fries? For $10!!!!! My cheese wasn't melted all the way so the sandwich was doomed from the second I laid eyes on it! My husband got a turkey club. It was nothing special but again, no fries came with it and it was around $13.

While they weren't the worst sandwiches we have ever had, we feel as though the place is a complete rip off. Though, most places in Vegas are the same way. We were just extremely disappointed.
Just down right bad in all ways.  I could write a book on the experience but simply put - spend your money somewhere else and dont support the sleezy place.
Manny is a great bartender that doesn't forget a face!! The pizza and the wings are awesome! I recommend hanging out here before or after a show.

Eh....

Went to Blondie's for the National Championship game with a group.  I was not impressed. the place wasn't crowed like you might think. I'm sure that was due to the high cover charge for the game though.

The bar food was just that, bar food. The problem is that it wasn't very good. the wings were sub par - very bland and rather small, cheese sticks were nasty, and the meatballs were a gelatinous mass. Yuck!!!

The service was OK, but nothing special. You would have thought that at an event like that they could keep up, but they couldn't. Our waitress only had a couple of other tables and no one was drinking heavily, and folks were still running out. 

This place definitely had a dive feeling to me, but without the charm a good dive should have.

Located in the Planet Hollywood miracle mile mall we checked and couldn't find many better options as far as sports bars to watch the ncaa final four games.  The place had all you can drink beer happy hour and with games on that basically everyone in the bar was interested in, it made for a festive atmosphere.

It seemed hard to flag down a waitress, when i finally did i ordered some nachos that were pretty good.

Would probably go back here if i wanted to watch a sporting event that happened to fall in to their happy hour(s).

After 10pm this place rock's.

There service is great; there food is delicious and you can't go wrong with 10$ all you can drink beer.

Great place to meet new friends and kick there ass at some beer pong.
Diffenetly a place to go on tuesday-thursday nights.

My niece and I stopped in here for dinner in 4/30. We were greeted and seated promptly. Then we sat and sat and sat for 30 minutes while we watched the female servers talk to tables of guys and taking photos of the guys with the helmet on. They never once stopped by our table (two women) for our drink order. I then realized that it was obvious that my money which was cash didn't spend as well as the men's money so we left.

In Vegas with my wife on vacation, Blondies is in Planet Hollywood, sports bar with drinks and fun atmosphere.
Beer wine and fun bar, very fun place. I had BBQ Chicken salad and my wife had Atlantic Salmon. Will come back again. Another plus and how we found out about Blondies, they are ITEX members.

Great location to watch sports.  They do take reservations the day before but don't let that keep you away because you'll still probably get a seat.  Good burger and fries and of course bucket of cheap beers

I wish I could give this place a big fat ZERO star! This place SUCKS! Food was terrible, service was terrible and the manager asked me "so...what do you want from me?" After I complained about the service...or lack thereof. Party of 8 and they came to our table once. BOOO!!! Close this terrible place down! Wish I would've read the reviews before coming here.

Front host pitched the 40 dollar all you can drink UFC fight, only to find out after we paid they shove you in the back room and only have a couple crappy beers offered as part of the special.  To cap it off the beers came in a Dixie cup and not enough servers to make this worth your while.   Slider appetizer was awful.   Don't waste your time here.  Far better sports bars on the strip.

Blondies...where do I begin??? So we started out paying $40 (a person) for the UFC  fights with an "all you can drink" (well drinks but expected) and sat in what seemed to be some large storage rooms with screens. Still cool we we're here to watch the fights, drink and eat. Waited 15 minutes before I stood up to look for a server, another 5 before we got one. Anther 10-15 for the drinks. The entire night there were no designated servers for the area. Now being involved in the industry we tip large from the beginning and keep it going to keep the service up. It's how it goes. Not here. In fact myself and several other on MANY occasions had to get up to find service for just SILVERWARE. Next time I'm just ordering the fights, over cooking my own frozen food and watering down my own drinks. Buffalo Wild Wings here we come. Now we know why it's $40 all you can drink...they don't serve you.

This spot has pretty good Jack In The Box food.

But beer makes it better.

Typical sports bar with lots of TVs displaying all the games. Food was good, plentiful and quick. Traveling all day, it was a quick place to grab a late night meal. A little pricy for a sports bar, but this is Vegas baby. 
The garlic bread knots was a huge helping and reheated very well for the next couple days in the hotel.

Worst place ever! Came in on Friday night. Hostess nowhere to be found. The bartender was touching and grabbing on the other bartender the entire time there. 5 people working and one actually working. The wings were horrible. Just bad. No flavor. The silverware was wrapped but was crusty and not cleaned. I will never ever go back.
2nd time wasn't as great.  greasy as hell.

Meh. It's bad food and crap beer. But it's probably the best spot to grab a drink inside the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood. Service is ok. If you're into drinking a whole bunch of crap beer, they do have unlimited drink wristband specials a couple of times a day. And they do often have $5 shots. So on the upside, while still overpriced, it's not as overpriced as some other places. But this is definitely not the kind of place you seek out. You just pop in for a beer when you're right near it.
Great service! Great food! I think you should check it out!!

We had the potato skins, chicken tenders, and the fries with added cheese and bacon, they put beer cheese on them, as opposed to melted real cheese. Everything was fine, just run of the mill bar food. The beer cheese was not super flavorful, the chicken tenders looked like Tyson, but the potato skins were pretty good. Just good for a quick bite on the way to go to a show or in between shopping. Definitely not a destination to go out of your way for.

Food was so so and slightly over priced but the service was great. It was empty when we arrived but quickly filled up. The music was good and at the right level so I didn't have to yell across the table. They also have beer pong!! Gotta play next time I'm there.

I was at Blondies last night, food was good and our server was awesome but we were there with our kids and there was another server who kept kissing & jumping on a guy in the back. It was very inappropriate and gross to watch when we were trying to enjoy our meal.. I get it, we are eating at a bar on the strip but still, I don't think employees should be acting like that at work. I just hope she washed her hands.

Over priced drinks (unless you enjoy the cheap stuff). Under par food that my kids couldn't even eat.  This all resulted in an expensive dinner that couldn't even be eaten.  I guess this place would be fine if you wanted to watch a game with just drinking beer, but plan on spending more than necessary.

Look elsewhere, should be no stars.  When you are like any other place you better stand out on service, but this place falls below any other.
It took 30min between waitress visits to table.  
Drinks were empty for at least 15min.  
She never brought water even when asked.  'Accidently' added a cheese whiz side and then when asked she didn't know why.  
Didn't immediately check the bill and had it had to be pointed out to her.
No visit from the manager when complaint was lodged. Manager should have stepped in knowing she was overwhelmed and she was not new.

Food like any other place.
Ambiance was standard sports fare.

We arrived today and decided to stop in for the all you can drink for $20 happy hour. I'm not sure why some people have reviewed poorly but my guess is they didn't get our AMAZING server Taylor!  Not only was she super attentive but she was so personable and pleasant. I would recommend this to anyone!! Our drinks were super strong and we left a great experience overall. Drinks and hot wings...you can't go wrong!

I ended up eating here due to not having enough time to eat anywhere else.  This place is in the Miracle Mile near Planet Hollywood.  It is literally across the walkway from the The V theater.

The 25 ounce beer was great!  The Chicken Strips were almost inedible due to the batter on the chicken being too hard/crunchy.

I would say pass on this place.

First time eating here, we ordered the garlic bread balls ($7.99- it was good),spinach artichoke dip ($14.99- NO!!! it taste like the one you buy at the grocery frozen section)and rib eye steak ($26.99- Like it!! was juicy and tender).

Took quite awhile for the waitress to come to our table after we sat down, even though they weren't busy.  Service afterward was good though. We wanted to order philly sandwiches, however we found out that mushrooms, onions, peppers were 99cents EACH, which would bring a philly to $19!  We declined to order Philly's after that revelation. I had chicken tacos, they were pretty good - the spicy sauce was SPICY!  Hubby had cheeseburger sliders, which were pretty good.  French fries were delicious.

What a disappointment. Came here to watch the Yankees in the playoff games, requested the game half a hour in advance and 1/4 hour into the game they still can't find it.  You call yourself a sports bar?!? On top of that, pathetic (next to none existent) service- why would anyone come here?

Updated as I was about to send this - they FINALLY got the game on.  Raised my review from one star to two.  I feel sorry for my server - she tried hard to get the game on but the bartender looked pretty clueless on how to find the right channel.  Train your staff better!

Sat at the bar to watch the game. Wings were good. The margarita machine was terrible. Thought it tasted like a dirty machine. Tried the rocks version, worse. Stick to draft of mixed drinks and you will be fine.
Basic menu. Wings are below average. There are many other bar and grills you can go to in Vegas. I'd pass on this place.

Typical sports bar in the middle of Miracle Mile.  We visited on Thanksgiving day and had a great experience.  The guys were wanting to find a place to check out the game and the girls just wanted something good to eat. Since it was Thanksgiving two of us ordered their Thanksgiving dinner. Included was turkey, gravy, stuffing and cranberries.  The turkey was a little dry, gravy was typical, the stuffing looked like a granola bar, and the cranberries were canned: definitely not grandma's turkey dinner.  Someone ordered a Ruben which looked amazing and my husband and I ordered the corned beef sliders which were so good!

I'd definitely pick this place again when visiting the strip in Las Vegas!

This had to have been the worst service I have ever received. After 30 minutes of waiting we had to ask the front staff to send our waitress to us. Once someone finally came she took our drink order which we didn't see for another 30 minutes. Finally we ordered our food and they brought us the wrong order. After taking it back to the kitchen and waiting 15 more minutes we were brought the wrong food AGAIN. Did I mention if we wanted more drinks we had to walk up to the bar because we never did see our "real" waitress, since the only one we saw kept giving us excuses about how she was so busy (this place wasn't full AT all). After asking for the manager we kept getting a waitress telling us she was the best we were going to get. The manager finally came and again, excuses. I will never dine here again.
Decent sports bar, but overpriced, 4 beers and nachos $90.

Came here to watch a UFC fight and had several problems:

1) Bait & Switch: Advertised price was $40 cover charge to get all you can drink beer. Upon arriving found out that all you can drink special didn't start until after preliminary fights were over 2 hours later.

2) Packed: Are there fire laws in Vegas? They packed so many people into that small space. Everyone was standing shoulder to shoulder.

3) All you can drink = 2 beers: There were so many people that once the "all you can drink" special started it was almost impossible to get a beer. There was no way to get to the bar and the waitresses serving beer were mobbed by the people around the bar so people in the back could not get a drink. By the end of the night we were only able to get 2 beers each out of the "all you can drink" special. 

4) No security: As the evening progressed a group of fans became more and more rowdy. There was no security presence. At the end of the fight they began jumping on chairs, shoving and falling on other guests. Nothing was done to stop them or protect the other guests. 

This place may be nice at other times, but I do not recommend coming here to see an event.

Visiting from Canada and our first time in Vegas, we got a tip to check out the happy hour here. Turned out to be a blast! Thanks for the wonderful time Joey, easily the best service I've had at a bar before. Gave us so much advice on how to Vegas, and always made sure our glasses were full.

we came here only for wings! late! saturday night around 1am. no wait. no one was even there. i ordered the wings and wanted them mild. there were basically naked with a little sauce. but were actually good, we were too tried to order or ask for anything else. lol.

Went here for breakfast based on an article about cheap Vegas breakfasts.

OMG!!! Was so good, went back the next day.

Breakfast burrito was excellent...and so big I couldn't finish.  My only complaint was no decaf coffee. Oerwise, I highly recommend.

We walked in for the $3 breakfast special. We got seated and then I think they forgot about us. They finally came and took our order. When we got the food, it was cold. We then had to wait another 5 minutes just to get forks which were never given to us. We had to ask the hostess to bring them to us because the server never brought them out. 

When we finished, the server came to our table and asked if we needed anything else. When we said that we were fine and that we needed the check, she got an attitude problem and just walked away. We got the check 5 minutes later we paid and left. 

I work in the service industry myself so I know that we make more from tips than from our regular wage. I usually go out of my way to do things for guests because I know that I am there for them and they want to have a good experience. This was the first time that I leave a restaurant without leaving a tip. I usually over tip but with the service that poor and with the attitude that she had, she didn't deserve it.

THERE ARE BETTER SPORTS BARS!
AVOID 
I went to see the Canelo vs Cotto fight
they charged people a ridiculous amount of money. 
The owner or manager was rude to people and just took money out of their hand as they were paying without being inviting or thanking people or making eye contact with guests!!!!
During the fight the sound was lacking and would completely go away. 
The first time we were like okay whatever they will fix it.
Wrong! ... it kept going away and just ruined the fight. 
The manager should of at least showed up and could of explained what was going on but he would go away and his workers had to pretend like they were trying to "fix" the sound
Also one of the servers could not simply walk to the trashcan to throw away a cup full of ice, she rudely threw it instead and it landed on a women next to me!!!. 
They need to work on their customer service and try to be more friendly!.

There must be over a thousand people in here violating almost every fire dept code
Here at the Canelo Chavez fight

Had to add more about the little blond rude ass waitress. Asked her for more beer and I she acted like I was asking for her gross tattooed body.
Oh and the free beer tasted like crap. Went right over and purchased canned beer.

My sister and I were on our way out of Vegas and wanted to grab something to eat. We had been at the Miracle Mile Shops the day before and remembered there were many places to eat. We actually stopped at Ketchup first, but the employees had horrible attitudes and the menu was extremely limited. So off to find another place since we knew there were plenty of food places. And we ended up at Blondie's.

We walked in an the first issue was seating. There were plenty of seats in this bar, a frat boy's dream. We didn't sit outside since it's in front of one of the 2 theatres here and therefore quite loud. We went inside, but a man (we later found out was a friend of our waitress) leaning WAY back in his chair.  Then we moved all the way to the back room where the tables are made specifically to play beer pong. There was a group having fun and playing all the way in the back. That wasn't an issue until the table next to us decided (after we sat down) to move to the table behind us and start playing. So we moved again. 

Finally at a suitable table, our bubbly waitress came by and took our drink orders (don't order the iced tea, it's grossly overpriced). I ordered cheese sticks and onion rings and my sister ordered a steak quesadilla. They were both good, basic sports bar food. Nothing more, nothing less. 

It is a sports bar through and through, so remember that. Including the bathroom. Ugh (I only washed my hands). 

P.S. The Italian place next door looks lovely. I wish we had tried it.

Sensory overload!  Nothing like your eyeballs being pulled in every direction to watch wall to wall flat screens as you try to recover from the night before.  I should reiterate that, every inch of the place is practically covered in flat screens.

That's really the reason you will ever step foot in here.  The perfect spot to watch every single football game being broadcasted.

It's a pretty average sports bar.  Decent beer & food menu.  Maybe it was the booze still talking but an order of loco moco seemed like the best option at 10 am from the breakfast menu.  Honestly, it wasn't half bad and was better than I expected.

Tip - If you've got a group, do make reservations for a table during the football games, as this place will fill up during game time.

My girlfriend and I were looking for a bar to watch the Blazer game and found Blondies. We're a younger couple so for some reason we never receive great service.  We sat at the bar and received our food and drinks. Wings were awesome. I ordered a dozen and even got a bonus wing to make it thirteen. Nick was our bartender and he made sure to keep drinks in front of us. Found out later he was a member of management. By far the best service we have ever had. We'll definitely be back.

TV's are plentiful, to say the least. They have approximately 2 gazillion of them.
They crank up some sweet tunes during commercial breaks, which is a fantastic idea and really increases the enjoyment of the sporting events.
The food is mediocre at best.
The service is horrendous. Your waitress will sometimes disappear for 20-30 minutes. 
The prices are high, given the low quality and bad service.
I almost dropped them to ONE STAR, since they have a BYU flag. BYU sucks and their fans (by and large) don't drink... or tip.

Having been given a $25 coupon to the Miracle Mile Mall restaurant (located within Planet Hollywood's shopping center), my husband and I went here looking for a filling yet fun dinner. The wait staff lives up to the Blondie's logo - female only waitresses sporting XXS cheerleader outfits, snug enough to showcase their tan stomachs and a hint of their bottoms. Forcing the feminist in me to get over the use of costuming and gendered employee selections (this is Vegas, after all), we made friends with our waitress, a Brazilian woman, and ordered water and sweet potato fries for starters, only to find out that the restaurant does not supply water but does sell bottles for $1 each. Typical Vegas nickel-and-dime tactic. The sweet potato fries were served with powered sugar on top and a side of honey - absolutely and unexpectedly delicious (the unexpected part based on the college-sport theme of the restaurant the constant advertisements for $10 all you can drink buckets of Miller). My husband ordered a Philly Chicken Cheese sandwhich, which was tasty yet quite processed and dry. My spinach, raspberry, and blue cheese salad was abundant in size and delicious, with plenty left over. Our choice of dessert was fulfilling: a rich brownie with ice cream and walnuts. 
Hoping for a pleasant reprise, we returned to Blondie's the next week to redeem another restaurants.com coupon. To our dismay we saw a sign on the hostess station posting that the restaurant no longer accepts restaurant.com coupons, and when asked why, the manager gave us no reason. They offered us a 25% discount in trade, which would not even be worth it considering they charge just for water. 
Go to Blondie's if: You are dying to see your college team flag sported somewhere in Vegas; if you want some good sweet potato fries - only; if you want some cheap happy-hour beer deals; if you are more interested in foreign 20-something waitresses in skin tight, butt-cheek-revealing cheerleader uniforms. 
Don't go to Blondie's if: You want a good deal; if patriarchal marketing tactics offend you (though this IS Vegas...); you have kids with you; you want superb food at a superb price. And finally - don't go if you have a restaurant.com coupon! Jamnit!

Went there for "Happy Hour" from 3-6 that's advertised all over the Miracle Mile Shops. Unlimited Domestic drafts and Well drinks for$20. We showed up at 4:45 and ordered some Ultra drafts and Shocktop (brewed on St.louis, MO) drafts. Bill came and we got charged per drink. Evidently you had to have a wristband for $20 price which wasn't offered to us and as we were leaving I asked the hostess stand of they had wristbands and they said no. When we asked to talk to a manager and explained to him he sent for security guards. Security guard said we pay bill as presented or I will call law enforcement. False advertising at its finest.

Great sports bar!  The food is your typical bar food, but its really good and the prices aren't bad at all.  Wonderful spot to watch the game, tons of tv screens.  The frozen drinks are huge, strong and reasonably priced.  Blondie's is located in the Miracle Shops at Planet Hollywood....be sure to check it out when you're in Vegas :-)

What a scam...."resort charge" when you pay by credit card. Not that anyone tells you before you order either. 
They simply add 4% to your bill as a resort fee.  

What a ridiculous fee for a crappy restaurant.

Never again
Wings und fries sind sehr lecker. Das frÃ¼hstÃ¼ck ist horror......hab es 3 mal zurÃ¼ck gehen lassen. Das gute an der bar ist, das sie championsleauge zeigen mit deutscher beteiligung

Was there for the ufc fight on Saturday. The place was absolutely packed and the environment was crazy! I will def watch another event there. 

Our server Amber was amazing. Even though they were super busy and extremely crowded, she was an absolute rock star! Thanks!
This is the worst restaurant I've ever been to.  Sodas are 4.00 each for a soda are you kidding me.  The food and service are horrible.

Eww! This place feels gross to me. The staff is friendly but the table was sticky and the drink (yes drink not drinks because I wasn't wasting calories on a crappy cocktail) was weak. Blah all cocktail juice, no alcohol. I won't be returning.

After reading the reviews for this place, I was a bit apprehensive, but we were short on time as we were departing Planet Hollywood and Blondies was staring right at us. I suppose it was simply good timing for us because the place was virtually empty and we received prompt, friendly service. 

We started with the Garlic Bread Balls which were incredibly. Nice crunchy exterior, strong garlic flavor (which I enjoyed) and a soft interior. We polished them off in roughly five minutes. 

We decided on a large Pepperoni Pizza and we had to have them take it back initially because we forgot to ask for it well-done. Usually, I get a sense of frustration from the server and / or chef when I have to send food back but the waitress was kind about it and understood and the chef (who brought us our pizza the first time) brought it back out with a smile. 

The pizza tasted great. Perfect amount of sauce and the cheese used had a perfect sense of saltiness and it stuck to the pizza perfectly. The pepperoni tasted fresh and it was simply put, a good pizza. 

The staff was polite, prompt and our waitress kept our drinks filled. The only thing that keeps this from being a five-star review is that it's a little pricey for what you get, but I was happy to spend a little extra for an experience like this. It appears my trip to Blondies was a bit more pleasurable than some of the previous visitors who have given their reviews.

First time there...Never again. I had to look for the waitress for a menu after 20 min.  Then I had to look for her again to place an order, she then sent me with another waitress and I was told to go to the bar cause it's faster.  What kind of service is this? Had to wal and stand for my food when I already had a table.. Give it one star just cause the food was good but I'll never go again even If foods free !!

A must on our trips to Vegas. It isn't the best place, but for good service, a sports bar, it meets its mark. Easily the best Buffalo Chicken Wrap I have ever had. First time was a couple of years ago, and we still talk about it. Was there again last week, and it is still just as good. If all you do is stop for a wrap, I'd say don't miss out!

Service sucks. Wings are just ok. I don't recommend this place. We waited too long for drinks and when we got our order of wings they didn't give us the extra dip we ordered. When she brought the dip it was friggin tartar sauce and not ranch or blue cheese!! We left.

Absolutely horrible service.. didn't even bother to stay. We walked up to the door and had to ask the hostess to be seated. He response was "I have no tables," so I asked, if they had any open seats at the bar and she said "nope!" Then turned around and walked away. Won't ever be back.. if that is the service from the first person you see when you walk in, I can only imagine what the service is like inside.

Initial Greeting: Not bad, however the Host did not know where the State of Montana was? That should have been a sign.

Drink's: Yikes, over 10 minutes for any kind of greeting by our server, and another 10 minutes to get our 3 bottles of beer.

Food: I've had better, but it was not horrid. We waited another 20 minutes to order our food, but it came out in probably 8 minutes (Which makes we wonder when it was actually cooked/prepared). We had no forks/napkins, and would not get acknoledged until our meal was about done. 

Payment: I complained (we were at an hour 30 minutes now). They gave a small comp (which is better than nothing) and even was greeted by the manager (who never actually said he was a manager). After that, I just walked to the bar to pay, because, well.. I was tired of waiting.

Overall: Poor service. Medicore food. I would not ever eat here again. They need more staff, and possibly get rid of them beer pong tables. I hate people reaching for a ball under my chair when I'm eating.

I'm not sure I understand all the hate for this place.  It has everything you'd want from a sports bar.  There are tons of TVs with easy viewing from every angle.  The TVs are crisp and clear and sound is good too.  Service has been stellar and superfast.  Beer is cold and reasonably priced.   If you go in expecting food better than bar food, you'll be disappointed.  But it isn't that bad for bar food.  Overall a big thumbs up for Blondies.

Daniel (manager) wouldn't stand behind his "product / advertisement" as he denied us the bucket of "domestic beer" for $25 (Miller Lite / Coors Light), outstanding service provided by our server (Kimberly). Wings were good, drinks not so much.

Such a welcoming staff! Went the night before my Birthday and the waitresses gave a to-go coke saying "Happy Birthday". She was very on top of our group and kept coming back to make sure we were enjoying our time. Even gave us some great Vegas tips for our week stay. 

We went during the lunch happy hour and got the Fettuccini pasta bowl for $3.99. For the price there are no complaints!! However, I would not have paid $9.99 for a single serving of the pasta. The pasta sauce itself was very heavy. This is definitely the place to end your night and not start it. You will be leaving in a food coma!

Blondies has an odd picturesque view is inside of the Miracle Mile Mall. 
There's a fountain is in the courtyard area next to Blondies seating. It does all sorts of cool  lighted water effects, color changing fog, bursts of light as the water dances along with the music.  It is pretty fun to watch and attracts all sorts of weirdos (great people watching!) 

Typically I find shots of Patron to be very expensive. I was tickled to find $5 shots to be a permanent fixture on their menu. I had several of those smooth evening starters. 

Beer is Las Vegas is an absolute joke. No matter where you go it seems you find the generic Bud Lite, Heineken, Corona, etc etc etc crap. It is rare you find  quality craft beer. At Blondies I was able to get Dog Fish Head 60 Minute IPA in 32 ounce mugs for $11..... 

I returned two days in a row. The Patron and Beer lured me back.

The Food here is  2.5 stars and the Alcohol / atmosphere is 4 stars .... Overall this place gets a 3.5 and I would return without hesitation.

I think the most I've ever eaten here are the fries, because I've only, really, been here for after dinner drinks. My brother recommended the place a while back when I was in Vegas visiting and since then, I've always made a trip back to Blondie's.  

I was in Vegas last month to celebrate a friends birthday and we came here looking to drink and play some beer pong at about 1 in the morning. 

When you walk in, you can tell that Blondie's is a sports bar.  College, NBA and NFL sports Team Banners hanging from the ceiling and walls. Waitresses dressed like cheerleaders and (noticeably) no male waiters, only bartenders. 

We ended up getting a 64oz container of beer for only $35, which was perfect for beer pong, so we grabbed our cups, split up into teams (boys vs girls) and proceeded to attempt to destroy the boys. We failed, they beat us by two cups ... twice!

We stayed until 3 in the morning, a little drunk and very happy.  Good times all around!

My family was welcomed by a server named Ashely who took care of us. From entering and leaving our lunch was great & we were well taken care of,  Because of Ashelys service, we will be back the next time we visit vegas. Thank you Ashley !!
Decent food, but slow service during happy hour! Our server told us "we could go to the bar and get our own drinks".

Welp, you can't win em all. A friend of mine set up a reservation for us at Blondies to watch some of the March Madness and boy was it mediocre. Granted there were about 25 of us and they accommodated the crew but, it was an all around meh experience. 

We ordered some of their bar bites (wings, chicken strips, etc.) and it was all really bland. Is it that hard to pull off decent bar food? You could tell this place was non-stop fryer food and that was about it. Just don't eat, and you'll be fine. 

The one saving grace was the service. The servers and manager were super friendly and found us some magnums of cheap chardonnay per our request. Granted they were room temperature, it didn't really matter at that point. Oh, and don't ask me why we were drinking it...

$100 a head to watch the Mayweather vs. Mosley fight here with an open bar.  Located in The Miracle Mile Shops.

Fight was wack.  Spent about 2.5 hours here from 7PM-9:30PM when the fight ended.  Ended up paying an additional $70 for a couple servings of french fries and hot wings to go along with all the beer and alki.  The server chick we had was pretty attendant to us considering how packed this place was for the fight.  We paid $100 a head and got seats and our own server while a lot of other people paid $60 and I believe they had to go up to the bar to get their open bar drinks.  I really thought we'd all get a lot more drunk since we all threw down $100 each, but I'd say on average out of our group of 11 dudes, we probably only put down about 3 beers and a shot each.  I got a 3 beers, a shot, and 2 jack and cokes.  Could've done more, but the stomach wasn't liking me that night.  Not sure if it was the food or the previous 2 nights of drinking in Vegas.

Place is alright overall, nothing special.  Just another sports bar & grill with a bunch of TVs and server ladies dressed up like cheerleaders.
Good service and fun atmosphere. Katherine was friendly and attentive (+1 for her). We both had salads which were huge, oriental for me and Caesar for her.
The rudest bar maid EVER, $20 ALL you can drink is only good if you like rude people....
Food and beer are great, really friendly staff.  Danielle was a diamond! Really funny bar, would highly recommend for you're trip to Vegas!

If our service had been better I would have given a 3 star review, but that was by far one of the worst parts of the meal!

Drinks are overpriced and WAY under-poured! $9 for a glass of Chardonnay in a sports bar is a freaking ripoff!! 

Everyone at our table is in the food service industry, and it's why we went there as we had credit to use. 

The food is your typical Sysco spread of wraps, sandwiches, and msg coated curly fries! The only stand out was the Cobb salad but at almost $15 it was a ripoff also! 

We will not be back, and I honestly would suggest to not dine here unless you are in it for their all you can drink program! Such a let down!

We ate here and had a few drinks. The waitress was great. But here is the issue: watch the check. The first meal they charged us 2.00 for each vegetable added to the pizza when the menu said 50 cents. They did correct it but blamed the computer. This morning they charged me an extra 1.00 on an egg I had added. Again they tried to pass the buck by the floor manager. I just want people to watch as this must happen all the time.
