Amazing sports bar! This is what it is all about. Great waitresses cold beer and so many TVs you WILL find the game that you want.

This is a sports bar, so come here to relaxed and have a great time. If you want some great deals on beer then this is your place.

Great to come and relax and chill out!
We tried Blondies for the first time and the food was terrible. Spinach artichoke dip and burgers were very greasy.  The server was very friendly but we will not return.

Came here for a bite to eat before going to see Zombie Burlesque. 

Sandwiches and drinks were good, certainly there were many sports events to watch on multiple tv's throughout the restaurant.

Probably the one thing we enjoyed most was our server Elisa, who was professional and made sure we had everything we needed and responded quickly when asked. 

A nice place inside Planet Hollywood if you're hungry and want to watch a few games.
You have many eating choices while walking around the Miracle Mile. This is not a bad place to pick.  It's your typical bar food with a bunch of TV sets.  Nothing great, nothing bad.

Ok so I hate to have to say some of this. No one was really doing the job as hostess. Then when someone did she was also are server (kinda). I say Kinda because she is obviously new. She even didn't know if they had lemonade or how many slices were in a small or large pizza. Also she was unable to keep the drinks filled. Another issue was that she brought us napkins silverware and plates after we were done with the appetizer. The meals came out and 2-3 were done great unfortunately the burger that was ordered well done came out medium and was told to us that it wasn't put in as well done another issue with the server. After dealing with all of this we spoke to the manager Keith and he was really a great guy. He apologized for the issues and gave us his carb to talk to him when we come back. I would say he made me feel like he really listen and would deal with the issues later on today. I literally went from a 1 star to 3 because I feel he really cared.   I would hate to say this but the comment of Von M. Of Blondies not wanting to realize hostess are not waitresses and wanting to compare pilots and stewardess's are not the same as waitress knowing the menu. Makes me go back to 1 star. Thanks Von.

If you just want to beer pong,this is the spot.other than that,its cool.This place waaaaay in the back of miracle mile at planet hollywood.almost got lost but finally found it.the best part all you can drink from 3-6 i believe for 20$ which is cool as well

Meh.  It was ok.  Burger doesn't come with fries and was $15!  Salad was big.  Pizza took a while but they explained it would take longer because they made it on-site.  Good to know that - I'd hate to have them get it from another place.  The employees didn't really seem too interested in their job.  I know they see lot of tourists but it says a lot about the business when they are talking to you and looking somewhere else.    The guy in the back I had to ask for a bag for my leftovers was very nice.  He's probably the only reason it got 2 stars.

Bottom line up front: The food was good but the service was horrible! There are so many good restaurants and bars around that I strongly encourage you to go somewhere else.

Cynthia, our waitress took our order and somebody else brought our food. She didn't stop by our table again until we were finished eating and ready to pay. I was so anxious to leave because of the drunks yelling at each other while playing beer pong that I didn't realize that Cynthia didn't bring my debit card back when she had me sign the receipt. 

When I realized it later, I called and was put on hold forever. Nobody ever came back on the line so I finally hung up and called back. They confirmed that they had my card and that I could pick it up at the bar. After a long walk back to get my card, the bartender looked at me a couple times but ignored me, even though I was the only one there. Two young ladies came and sat down and he walked past me to take their orders. I appreciate their pointing to me and "forcing" him to acknowledge my presence. He gave my card back and immediately turned back to them with no apology for putting me out or making me walk quite a ways out of my path late at night.

To give them credit, the food was good. No complaints there, but that's the only thing they have going for them. The screaming drunks don't add pleasantly to the ambiance and if you want anything, it appears that you have to be rude about it. The attitude of the staff is astoundingly bad and this is the last time I will ever eat at a Blondies. It was so bad that I'm not interested in giving another location a chance. 

Good food, LOUSY service. Pick another place to eat and drink and thank me later.

Amber...best customer service ever.  I never wrote a review before until now.  She knew what she was talking about.  Kept honest and had nothing but positive things to say about this place and was genuine.  I've been to vegas multiple times, this is the first time I've eaten here and it was well worth it

I was in Las Vegas for three days, checked out of my hotel and had 5 hours before my flight. I bought a chargers at ABC in the miracle mile cause I lost mine and now I needed to kill time. Seen they had a breakfast special until noon  (this is 11am on the Monday I fly out) for 16 dollars I got pancakes and a side of toast. Food was good but better than the food was the customer service I got. I was here by myself because my travel person still asleep. Robyn the bartender gave me the best customer service experience I got from any server in my whole entire stay at Vegas. Lots of conversation but never too much. She knew when to ask questions and coversate and when I wanted to be left alone with my food. She never bothered me, she never rushed, and just a great ear when I wanted to talk. You only have bartenders/servers like her once in a while so today had to show my appreciate.

The absolute worst service I've ever had in Vegas. We were unfortunate to happen to walk by hungry. HUGE mistake.  Food was nothing spectacular...never got checked on by our waitress until we asked for the check. Just a waste of time and most upsetting to me.....a waste of calories. There are so many other places we could have and should have gone to for a quality meal....like GR's Burgr! At least that place in Planet Hollywood is definitely worth the wait.
Manny is awesome!!! Great customer service. Will definitely be come back ... great service and made you feel welcomed... the ladies love him
Great staff and extra large HD TVs to watch all the games with friends!!

I was very impressed with this place. My girlfriend and I went this past Saturday (6/23/12) for lunch. I got the buffalo chicken wrap...which was great. She got the chicken wings...she compared them to BJ's chicken wings. Overall I say this place is good for a quick bite. 
But let me forwarn you, they charge for water...not bottled water TAP WATER. Well, they charged me anyways.

Great for all-around sports fanatics and even for the not-so-big sports people.
Whether if you're a die hard fan or just a simple casual fan who's supporting your friends/family/significant others team, this restaurant have great atmosphere. 

One of the few drawbacks with Blondies is if you have your heart set to watch the game here, you would need to make reservations pretty far in advance. You can do that by either calling the restaurant or make a reservation through their website. With walk-ins, it's pretty much the luck of the draw. If there's an open seat available at the bar, you better take it. First seat you see, you better sit your a$$ down because we walked around the restaurant hoping to see an open table somewhere and by the time we wanted to go back to the bar area, those seats were taken. All within 30 seconds.

The food was good. Typical bar food. We ordered a buffalo chicken wrap, patty melt and we shared this BIG OL BASKET of garlic fries. Such a huge portions of fries....I'm kinda fried-out for the month. (And for those who know me, I LOVEEEEE MY FRENCH FRIES.) But ugh...no more. =/

Overall, pretty decent place to watch your Sunday football games.
Boyfriend can grab a seat at the bar, get a drink while the girlfriend goes shopping for a bit and then join the boyfriend later. =) Perfect Sunday, right folks?

So my friend and I went here to grab lunch. I had never heard of this place before. I ordered a sub and it came with seasoned fries, and a drink.

The food was filling and service was great. It is a bit of a loud place, but isn't any sports bar?!

We played beer pong after lunch, as they have long tables set up for it in the back.

It cost $21 for the first game of beer pong, and $14 every game after. They give you a pitcher of your choice beer, plastic cups, and ping ping balls.

I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a fun, up beat sports bar, with the ability to play beer pong.

I ordered a Rachel, which was very generous with the turkey! Super good, especially if you like sauce. I also got sweet potato fries... They powdered the top with powder sugar and serve it with honey.

We hit Blondie's for lunch on Saturday.  It's really a sports bar... they have a ton of TVs and some tables that can be used for beer pong and they have tables with taps in the middle and it's very loud in there.

We were seated at one of the tables with a tap, but chose not have beer on that occasion so missed that opportunity.  Our server was friendly and attentive to us.  We used an Entertainment coupon which allows for one free entree when a second is purchased.  The husband had the club sandwich and I built my own burger with cheese, mushrooms and a friend egg.  We both really enjoyed our food.  I liked that they didn't overcook the egg!

It looks like they have some great specials.  We noticed there is a happy hour special for all you can drink beer for $20 for a three hour period... wow, you could go crazy with that.

You have to understand though, that this place is very loud and while in the Miracle Mile shops, feels kind of ratty.  But, hey, it's a sports bar.

I'd eat there again.

this is one of those places you eat at cuz you're walking around and suddenly hunger creeps in... and walking anywhere else is really too far.  

the cheerleader-esque waitresses usually hover over their podium outside gossiping... and once in awhile one of them will look up and seat you.  

and if you want to order water... its bottled only (for like $1 i believe... which is cheap for bottled water here... but expensive cuz you just wanted friggen FREE water right?)  

dont order soup (fuck you diet)... it's definitely from a progresso can... you get like half a can of soup for like $5-6.  

tiny and dry chicken wings...

philly cheese steak sandwich is good... except for the bread, which is COLD?!

$10 all you can drink during happy hour... that's pretty sweet though.

We showed up on a Tuesday afternoon to watch a hockey game. The big draw being that they have so many screens, you could can ask for any game you want. Well, they did not know was hockey was much less find it on TV. The next negative sign was that the bar area literally smelled bad. It stank like...well a stinky bar rag, the whole place did. There were very few people in the place at the time yet the bartender did not even acknowledge us standing there with cash in hand to get some drinks! After 10 mins or so of nothing we left and headed to the PH sports book where we had a much better experience.
I was staying at the Elara hotel and it was conveniently connected to the miracle mile. Blondes offered a $2.99 breakfast special. I was impressed with the efficiency of the service.  Not bad.

Thank God it was a free meal because I did a survey next door. But I will never come back here the service was so horrible and the waitress was not attentive and it wasn't even busy. I didn't get a refill for my drink and the cup was empty for 20 mins. She got my order wrong. And that's just the top layer. We had to ask for everything twice. Not only that I waited for the bill for 30 mins after getting tired of waiting I asked for it again and she said she gave it to us. If she did I would have paid it and get the heck out.
That was just the service the food wasn't great either. Garlic fries were dry its just curly fries with whatever crap on it they call garlic. The pizza blah I've had better at pizza hut. The wings were decent but I can get better ones from the freezer at the grocery store.
Our bartender Mya is a sweetheart and made our dining experience very enjoyable! Great place to watch sports #Cubbies

There wasn't anything spectacular about this place at all. They had a sign  up on the wall Maxim Magazine voted them one of the best bars in the country a few years back.  Maybe it was super cool a few years ago, but as for now, I beg to differ.  The hostess asked if we would be eating, and we told her yes.  She then told us to grab a seat anywhere we'd like.  We sit, and another woman rushes over and tells us nobody is serving that section.  Strange, since the place isn't huge. But anyway.. we sit elsewhere and she comes over and asks if we would be eating.  Yes. Then she made some rude, unnecessary comment about the hostess forgetting to give us menus.  We ordered our drinks and decided to go with the appetizer sampler.  It was about $22 and came with a few different appetizers.  Honestly, all were bad.  I understand that most bar food is fried food.. but c'mon.  This stuff was literally drenched.   You could taste the oil which was so unappetizing.  My weird husband must have been starving because he said it was alright.  I deemed everything inedible and let him have the rest.  For a drink, I opted for the amaretto sour.  The sweetest, weakest $8 amaretto sour in the world.  It strangely tasted like cherry kool-aid.  What's up with that!? I never really read Maxim Magazine before, but after this.. I don't think they can be trusted.
Great place to watch sports on the strip and the food is not your regular bar food. Fernanda was my server and was very attentive.

When I tell you I have never experienced a bartender (male) stealing money from me because he thought I was too drunk to notice. The thing is I'm a big tipper in general but for a person steal money from me without giving me the option to tip you is a huge disappointment in my eyes. I even brought it to his attention and he was like "what do you want me do about it?". 

All I will say is pay the exact amount because he doesn't believe in giving you the exact change back. 


Sincerely,

WhereIsMy30dollars

You get what you pay for and although the pricing is high for where we come from, it's inline with Vegas strip costs. I had a caesar salad, and sandwich with a blondie beer(Great brew). It was accurate and on time. No arguments here. A good stop to fill the appetite and grab a drink.

My absolute favorite sports bar to watch big fights you can't beat $40 cover charge that comes with endless beers and margaritas they have beer pong tables and tournaments the food is good I love this place

Saw a breakfast plate deal advertised on 4 tv screens in front of restaurant for $2.99.  We, family of 4, got seated 11:05am & attempted to order the advertised $2.99 shown on screens.  Waitress tells us that breakfast is over at 11am.  We called her attention to the large 4 tv screens & that it did not mention any expiration times.  She tells us we had to order from the lunch menu.  We told her this was deceptive advertising.  We also asked why they still advertised the $2.99 breakfast deal after 11am (their breakfast cut off).  She told us it is posted until noon each day even when no one can order that special after 11am.  Then she wanted to know what we would like to order from their lunch menu, where the prices were much high.  Deceptive advertising to get customers in!  Bait & switch method used on customers!  Would not recommend!
Good drinks one day. Great drinks another. Watered down drinks the 3rd day. That's why it got 3 stars. Wish I could have given it more. If go back though.
The worse tasting food in Planet Hollywood!!!!  The restrooms stinsk like urine and look like a mess!  One star is being generous.

Went on a Sunday.. Only to watch football.. The service started off pretty Rocky, but got a bit better with time and with more alcohol. The food was ok, then again, I was loaded. The waitresses are barely outta diapers and run around lost half the time. Nothing to brag about.

+ Food was delicious
- 15 minutes for a waitress to get our drink order, service wasn't very good.  Restaurant was not crowded at the time.  Simply a restaurant with a gimmick like hooters

Went to dinner here May 18th before seeing Lionel Richie for my brother in laws birthday.  There were 5 of us total at the table.  Our waitress was less than attentive, but paid attention when we ordered and even read it back to confirm.  When the food showed up 2 of 5 meals were wrong but our waitress as mia to complain.  When she did show up she didn't seem to care things were wrong.   My sister had to go to the bar to get water that she'd asked for twice already.  When we asked about a discount for the wrong meals a whopping $4.50 was deducted REALLY???  When the bill came they tack on a 4% fee for using a credit card.  Unbelievable to say the least.  We will never go back to Blondies and I'd suggest others avoid it and get a better and cheaper meal somewhere else.

We had a blast here for breakfast. It's not a fancy place but during the week it's cheap breakfast and $3 mimosas! The food is good and a fun place to sit under the sky like roof. The staff was very friendly! Was the only meal in Vegas that didn't break the bank, we would have went here every morning if it were a week day!

Came here for a drink the other night and had a great experience. Great sports bar located in the Planet Hollywood hotel. The bartender that night, Belle, was amazing. She was very attentive and the drinks were made really well. Great place to watch pretty much any game going on while having a good drink and great service. Stop by if you're in town!

A seedy bar in the Miracle Mile. Very college bar like. They have beer pong tournaments every Wednesday and Thursday, and the winner(s) get a $500 bar tab. If you want a good game of pong while staring at the giant plastic stripper outside of the stripper bar, then head here. Definitely not the place to go for a classy drink with your date.

Really awful experience from the start to the end of my meal. It was as if the bar was purposely trying to turn away service. The food is overpriced and they charge for a side of fries. They have no refills with $4 sodas and you have to pay for water!! (it's actually illegal to charge for water) The tragedy is this place has a lot of potential. Being in a prime location and with good service it could be a  great place. It's clear that ownership and management has no idea what they're doing. In a tough economy you should be doing everything to better serve your customers.

Yeah, yeah.  The food ain't so hot.  But the beer is good and there are plenty of TVs.  The service is pretty and pretty good.  What are you doing a half-mile deep in a mall in Vegas looking for haute cuisine? They have beer, sports and A/C. Park your a** on a stool and wait out the rest of your party as they ooh and aah over baubles and get lost in the mall 'cuz it is shaped like a figure 8.  Cute trick to get more time to drink -- when the wife returns ask her if she saw (insert name of store)  and convince her that she missed part of the mall.

Just for fun, find a picture of their logo and check if you see the same "optical illusion" that my friends and I did.

We went by during lunch because we saw a sign for wings. Neither of us ended up getting wings. I got the big bowl of pasta for $3.75 and my husband had a grilled cheese. The spaghetti was pretty decent actually and came with two huge pieces of garlic bread. Grilled cheese left a little to be desired. Service was great though!

Blondies is a tough sell on me.  I like playing beer pong, and the crowd Blondies attracts is young and fun; mostly.  However, the beer is cheap and tastes cheap, the food is lower quality than most of the local bars, and the service is below par.  IMHO, there are plenty of better places to go on your night out, however, you should still visit Blondies and experience it first hand.

What a joke! Got seated right away, given menus and then...nothing! All the waitresses seemed to be preoccupied at the front with so.ething because no one came to ask what we wanted to drink or anything. Me and my wife walked right out, nobody even noticed, bologna!

Two stars is being generous. Slow service, average food at best, and high prices.

Ordered fish and chips and the fish was cooked using grease that had not been changed in several days. 

Beer menu is severely limited with only one or two decent beers not made by Budweiser. Ordered Alaskan Amber. Over 10 minutes later, the waitress reappeared to inform me that they were in fact out of Alaskan Amber, which they only have in bottles in the first place.

Too many other good options at Planet Hollywood. Scratch this option.

We went here yesterday to get some lunch. We were seated promptly as it wasn't real busy. After about 20 minutes of no one coming over to even get our drink orders, we got up and left. There were 3 employees standing at the hostess podium when we left! WTH?

We came here for a Monday brunch.  Nothing special.  Although the place was not crowded at 11:30 am, it took us 1/2 hour for us to get our order.  No points there, food was average.  Although we did notice 4 people playing beer pong at the backside of the restaurant.  Our waitress was friendly but seemed elsewhere.

Came here for a quick breakfast and it didn't disappoint. Food was really good for the price. Lots of TVs to watch March Madness Hoops. Our waitress, Annie, was AMAZING. Super friendly and attentive. She had a lot of tables too. Highly recommend this place.

Food was pretty good , the service was not we waited for close to 10 minutes to have our drink order taken while 4 waitresses stood at the end of the bar giggling and playing on their phones , watched 2 couples leave in that time for lack of service

Blondies is hands down the most fun and best sportsbar in Vegas!!! I am here for every big fight or sporting event and it is always a wild time.  You pay upfront at the door for all you can drink.  If you want a table, call ahead and get one booked.  Make sure to do so way in advance because the place fills up fast! The service is great, environment is always fun, food is delicious, and they make some of the best drinks in Vegas.

Disgusting food, overpriced menu, and lame service. Run, don't walk, away from here. We went around 10:30pm and ordered chips and salsa, small order of boneless wings, and 2 sodas. $37 later - gross wings, stale chips, and chunky brown salsa. Don't even bother, seriously.

I didn't know it was possible for a sports bar to have worse service than any Buffalo Wild Wings establishment, but I was proven wrong by Blondies. The waitress was a trainee, but she shouldn't expect to keep a job there long based on who her trainer was. Both could not provide decent or timely customer service. It took 10 minutes for me to get my card back after she (the trainer) took it to charge it, and we were her only table... She then tried to make small talk with me about the World Cup game that was on, hoping she could schmooze me over for a better tip. Lastly, the food and bar drinks at Blondies aren't anything special to write back home about, ether. But I will be contacting my bank and disputing the charge from this establishment. After receiving my statement, I have noticed that they overcharged me with writing in a larger tip amount than what I signed for. I will be calling management at this poor establishment as well, but from other reviews, it appears management is also well below standards.

Very nice friendly sports bar and grill. Tons of tv's awesome music playing. Very nice friendly bartender. Very helpful with finding good deals. Great food menu. I recommend coming for happy hour from 3-6.
Pretty cool spot with beer pong on Wednesdays. Expect slow service though especially for the all you can drink for $20. Even if the bar is slow

Fernanda was my server and she was great. She seemed to have a busy section and she handled it very well. She was attentive to her tables and she was very nice. We watched the football game and we had the nachos to share and a couple of pitchers of beer that she suggested. Great fun!!

Such a great sports bar in the Miracle Mile shops. My waitress Fernanda was really funny and sweet and kept the drinks coming :-)
I will be back soon!
Fabulous weekday breakfast special. Way better than the Salsa place across from it. Will eat here everyday when I go back. Kudos and don't change your prices.

What surprises me is with all of the bars and places to eat and drink around Vegas, literally 100's within a mile radius of this joint you think they would try harder.  I was unfortunate enough to stop by with my son that just turned 21 on this day and we sat at the bar.  A young lady (bartender not cheerleader waitress) asked what were we drinking, I ordered a shock top and son ordered a beer as well.  She asked if we were eating and we said no and she got a grouch look on her face and turned away.  She plopped our beers down and that was it.  She later gave us our check but during our drink we decided that we wanted to grab some food.  We asked the lady for a menu and she gave us one.  We waited 20 minutes, while the whole time we see her talking with her friends, drinking starbucks and doing nothing.  She eventually came and said oh what did you want to eat.  I was furious, I said we waited 20 minutes and that was crazy, asked to speak with a manager, she said she was the manager.  I find that hard to believe.  She said, "well you originally said you didn't want to eat"  I said, "well I thought I made it clear 20 minutes ago when I asked for menus and said we decided we wanted to eat"

She then proceeded to tell us that a girl was on break and she was swamped.  See above on my comment on what she was doing the whole time.  I said was it because the way I was dressed.  Sleeveless shirt, basketball shorts and sunglasses, she got defensive and said no.  Well trust me, I had money to spend and lots of it, but I refuse to go anywhere and beg for service.  The kicker was I paid 20 dollars for two beers!

I strongly suggest to avoid this place and try the gazillion other establisments in Las VEgas.

So my friends and I went to blondies to have a good time when one of their coworkers thought it would be ok to take a a live video with flash WITHOUT us being in the club yet. She thought it was funny to disrespect us and mock us when we weren't even in there territory. I am shocked and so disrespected. Never go in there because there workers think it is appropriate to take videos of people while they are trying to have a good time.

Can't beat the $3.99 breakfast. Two eggs bacon or sausage and hash browns. The bacon was cooked to perfection. The hash browns were crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. We also got the bloody Mary's that are also delicious. Great value for the money

Great sports bar. They have a all you can drink for $20... Well drinks and domestic beer until 6:00 pm. Lani was our waitress and she was AWESOME! Great customer service! We had steak and eggs for breakfast and it was tasty.. $5 Bloody Marys until 11:00am. .. Great place to come and kick back and have some drinks. The overall customer service here was GREAT and I would highly recommend this sports bar!

We LOVE this place!! My boyfriend & I originally went in April of 2012 because I found a deal on Living Social for Blondies. We were so impressed with it that we bought another Living Social deal and brought our friends on Sunday March 24th.

It was packed due to a pub crawl, and I wasn't expecting to get very good service simply due to the massive amount of people. I was so wrong - Silvia was our server & I can honestly say she's one of the best servers I've ever had, anywhere. We all LOVED her!! I can't recommend this place enough & if you choose to go, ask for Silvia!!

This place is over priced!

Food was ok. I mean this place is cool if you wanna watch the game, drink a few beers and eat greasy bar food. There's like a billion TVs here which is cool! 

Other than that, I probably won't be coming back when I visit Vegas. I like GOOD food! But it was fun here :)

Let me be clear, I only drank here. Husband and I came for the $20 all you can drink from 3-6. We definitely made it worth our while. Mind you, when they say domestics, they only mean bud light, budweiser and busch light. I only drank vodka so no issues with wells. 

This place is surrounded by several different restaurants, so you can easily bar hop in this small area of the mall. 

Bartender was prompt and attentive, and there were quite a few places to sit at the bartop.

We went for the breakfast special - two eggs, hash browns and bacon.  You can't beat the price and the food tasted good.  Nothing special but easy for a cheap breakfast, difficult to get a refill but other than that I would repeat.
My favorite sports bar on the strip. Love the staff! Everyone is friendly and attentive!

More like 3.5/5

$13 for cheese steak sandwich, no fries? Thats strange

Service was alright, nothing spectacular

I do like the all you can eat Pasta for 9.99

I'd eat here again

Great place to watch a game if you're only requirement is a tv, otherwise, the poor service, weak beer selection, and basic fare make this a place to steer clear from. I wasn't expecting much, just a beer and a place to watch the game, but the service was so deplorable here that I waited almost 10 minutes to even pay my bill at the bar for 1 beer, the bartender was too busy talking to a coworker. I'm nice and efficient as a patron and I appreciate when I get the same service. Unfortunately this place provides none of that. You're better off going somewhere else.

Great venue, great hard-working servers, good buffet style eats for this Super Bowl event. This place has a weak spot though. Only one urinal and one commode for the men's bathroom. Not a good combination. Guests who pre paid for booze and eats will want their money's worth and there will be consequences if they can't access a BR promptly. Otherwise this place is well run and the staff are pleasant.

We used a Groupon, and felt like it was a great deal.

Great Rockin Nachos, Melted cheese, PLUS nacho cheese. filled with beans/jalepenos/and all the toppings. Not sure if I would pay 12$ for them regularly but with the Groupon it was a good deal! 

I had a build your own burger with bleu cheese and bacon. YUM. HUGE. altho no fries, you have to pay 3$ to add fries to a meal. It was okay for use though because we had a LOT of food. My husband ordered the philly cheese steak sandwich, and he thought it was decent. He thought he probably would try something else next time.

Service was great, altho we were there at a low low time, as they weren't very busy. Lotsa TV's lotsa cute girls....

I'm unsure about my overall feeling. It might be SUPER fun on a big sports night!

We watched the Kentucky - Louisville Final Four Game.
Great Service, Great Drinks, Good Food.

Really enjoyed being here for the game. Sat with other fans - from Ohio State and Kansas.....

I will come back here....enjoyed.

God!!! This place was amazing. We had the groupon, which was amazing. But even without the groupon it was worth the price. I loved the food, some of the employees were nice. 

Would def go back again, considerin I went twice. LOL

Good:
1: Immediate seating.
2: Bathroom inside restaurant
3: Nice waitress.
4: Good food.
5: Vegas Bite Card discount.

Bad:
1: Cold in December!

If it was possible to take away stars from other reviews, I would! Seated right away. 10 minutes later, no one had even said so much as hello. I flag down hostess and let her know we haven't seen a waitress. 5 mi urea later, waitress comes by and says "I'll be with you in a minute". A couple minutes later she finally comes. Order a couple beers and some food. Can't order a glass of water (they only serve bottle) really??!!

Food was average and service remained horrible. No silverware delivered with food. Asked repeatedly for silverware and napkins. 

If you are a local, there is ZERO reason to ever come here. If you are a tourist, do yourself a favor and catch a cab to nearest PT's pub. You will more than save the cab ride in booze costs and get great service.

Places like Blondies make me feel ashamed after I leave. Like I really should have known better!

went to blondies with a group of 9 people. we were seated immediately which was impressive. the only plus of the evening. we were told by the waitress it was impossible to all have separate bills. a little annoying...then when the food arrived it was horrible. 2 entrees were sent back. it was not offered as would be typical to order something else. waitresses simply said you didnt like it? nope. and she just took it. then delivered a pizza that was ordered. the two girls splitting it started eating and realized it wasn't what they ordered. when we called the waitress back over and explained the situation her response was that she noticed it was the wrong pizza and asked the cook but he said it was the pizza for our table. she said she double checked her order to make sure she put it in right and she did. ....so she brought the wrong pizza to the table ANYWAY and never said anything.......hoping we wouldn't notice???? What?  she then offered to bring it back and just throw the toppings that were supposed to be on it on there.  we said no bc its supposed to be cooked on. didnt even offer to get a new pizza. at that point another person at the table asked for a side of ranch and were advised it would be extra!!! we asked to speak to a manager. who happily skipped to out table. seemed somewhat childish, flippant and unprofessional for someone in his position addressing a customer complaint. each person who talked to him he litterally hopped to. he then offered to remove only half of the cost of the pizza bc half was eaten before we noticed it was the wrong one. to add to it the waitress said she couldn't bring 6waters with the food bc it was too much to carry. and then asked asked we wanted a box to take the rest of that pizza home...........horrible service. overpriced food and drink (oh btw. they brought the wrong drinks too), unprofessional and d effinately dont knkw thier own menus. one of our top worst experiences.

This review only focuses on breakfast.  This place is located in the Miracle Mile shops near one of the "squares" with entertainment and other eateries.  There were at least 4 other restaurants advertising cheap breakfasts.  This place had a sign for $2.99 eggs, meat and potatoes.  When we sat down I immediately noticed that toast was extra and guess what?  It was $2.99 too!  They also charge $2,00 for coffee so they actually are more expensive than the other places.

On the positive side, the food was good and the service quick.  As a plus, it's a sports bar so all of the tv's had ESPN on which I watched while I ate.

My wife and I split an order of toast to get a sense of satisfaction.

Bad bar food, poor service and defiantly only for people who want to play beer games. I would have been ok with the "bar" atmosphere (since it is a Sports BAR) if the food wasn't gross and service wasn't bad. I wont ever go back.
Bomb Drinks! Our bartender manny was dope! Definitely the best spot the hit up for a good time. You won't regret it.

Itching to see the big game and you just gotta have your wings and beer?

Fill 'er up at Blondies!

Our medium hot buffalo wings ($15.99 for a dozen) were spot on. I had a house salad, yes, a SALAD. Who eats salads in Vegas right? ;-) for $6.99, can't really beat it for a huge bowl of fiber. Part of the whole #adulting thing. 

Don't go looking for microbreweries/small batch/craft beers stuff here. Order a cold Bud Light or Samuel Adams and enjoy the multiple, I mean, multiple TVs at the bar, on the walls and if they could've put one on the ceiling they probably would've. We've been here couple of times over the years and we always can count on catching the latest baseball/basketball/football/soccer game when my husband takes a break from shopping at the Miracle Mile. (sigh, he loves to shop)

Our young and friendly blonde server was dressed super cute in her cheerleading outfit and always had a ready smile and easy demeanor. Why we can't we get service like this in SF? 

Blondie's awesome happy hour, $20 all you can drink from 3pm - 6pm, is basically happening when y'all are hungover and basically in a stupor sleeping in your hotel room. Well, we're here taking advantage of it. 

And that's how we do Vegas.

You have to be kidding me, a "RESORT FEE" at a restaurant??? Seriously? The food is garbage, the service is maybe a tad better than the food. But, even if the food was awesome, a resort fee is a spit in the face of your customers, it is so insulting that I can't go back. 

Never ever will I step foot in here and I have actually been in here when in town on business at least 5 times with co-workers in the last 2 years. I am so insulted by the "RESORT FEE" that I will tell anyone that I talk to about it as a "can you believe this business practice?"
Just stopped for a drink waiting for the mall to open.  $1.99 Bloody Mary and free Wi-Fi...don't mind if I do.

Went with a couple of friends through my own recommendation. Had never been before but walked by and thought it seemed like a fun place. Simply put, I was wrong. We were seated quick enough and the atmosphere was nice. TV's everywhere, games, good drink specials. All of that was killed by the absolute horrible service. Our waitress took our orders and then came around twice before handing us our checks (our total bill came out to close to $100).   My beer sat empty , as well as two other drinks, for about 10 minutes before she noticed. The hardly ever smiled and didn't seem friendly at all. Then after she gave our checks and put our card she completely spaced out and came back with two copies because she split outlet our one order in two. Seriously? Anyways, it was disastrous by that alone. Food was mediocre to good. I suppose it could've been an isolated incident but since it did happen to me then it gets one star. Excel always.

Couldn't even tell you how the food was cuz no one ever came to our table after seating our group of 12 on Saturday around noon. Staff walked by a couple times ignoring us, and no one came to even acknowledge us. 15 minutes later we just got up and left. I guess they rely on their numerous TV's to keep their guests distracted to cover up their poor service. Too bad we weren't there to watch a game, right Blondies? Shame on this joint.
Went here yesterday and i must say it definitely is a cool sports bar but the food is over priced . Total rip off.
Service was great! 5 stars go to Hannah, she was so sweet and helpful. Our group was being kind of annoying and she didn't mind at all.

Absolutely love it here!! Food is AMAZING, service is great - everyone from the hostess to the servers and bartenders all seemed lively and fun, Tely was my favorite! Everything came out accordingly and was phenomenal. Highly recommend!!

Waited 40 mins when there was only 5 people in the restaurant. First my fries came out then 10 mins later my burger then another 5 mins my soup. So basically my fries were cold so I couldn't enjoy them with my burger. Their waitresses are definitely blondes
Now I know why they called this place Blondies!

We had a very goog experience , first I value customers service  it is very important , thank-you Alex!
We sat at the bar and get happy hour special $20 all you can drink from 10pm to 1am.
beer & well drinks , you can go walk around and came back for another drink during the happy hour.
if you check in with yelp get a appetizers free.
Our bar tender Alex made us feel welcome very attentive 
good job girl.

fandamntastic ... 

all tired from walking, head ready to explode ... walked into tacky sports bar

waitress said ... wait ... in a minit it's $10 for two hours of drinking

we did ... my gf ... my friend ... my friends gf ... and I

no question ... on my list to return ... had sports ... had waitresses ... had beer pong (jesuschristie!) ... had way fun (gf fine now ... had good time)
Their pizza is delish!!!! Curly fries are hot & fresh. Bartenders are pretty fast too. I liked this place - I started a bar crawl here & it was chill.
Nachos were horrible.  Bar was fun with lots of half naked women.  Beer pong was great.  Don't eat here, just have some beers.  Average at best if you want to watch the game.  Big screens not HD.

Do not spend your time and money at this joint...totally jacked up my fight weekend.  This place is a joke!

Everything on the menu is pretty much fried or really unhealthy in some other way. Large portions- get the Groupon if it's still available
Good service and ok food (definitely a brick in your tummy tho)
Adorable hostess and I felt really bad for her cause there's a lot of creepy, disgusting, skeezy guys that come here and she clearly gets sexually harassed by most of them. Great morning specials
Awesome place to watch the game because there's a million TVs

I don't know about all the negative reviews, all I've had are positive experiences here and I've been a customer a number of times.  Maybe people are used to getting their drinks for free in the casino, but as far as I'm concerned, the all-you-can-drink happy hour is the way to go.  Great place to watch a game, especially a fight, but get there early for a title bout.  Very good bar food (don't expect anything healthy... you're in Vegas), excellent service.  Love this place.
Bobbi rocks! She was Great. Even busy she made sure my drink was full!  Tge food was good. Wings wise! Thats all I tried. But deff good..  tv"s r awesome. There is like  60 of them..

We have been once in the evening for drinks. Lots of college kids playing Beer Pong...not an issue; they were having a great time. When yesterday for lunch. The service was good; server was very attentive but not bothersome. I had the Cobb Salad, it was HUGE and really good. I would recommend it but definitely for sharing. My husband had the Philly Cheesesteak; this was also large. He said it was good but he wasn't blown away. None of the sandwiches some with fries, they are $4 extra. The menu was very basic; nothing to make them stand out. But I would return for lunch as it was a quick in and out with pretty good food.

Dear PH: How in the world is this establishment  still open?
I made the mistake of not checking Yelp first and sat down here with friends from Berlin that want to try everything American, after ordering a Rib Eye Steak the disappointment set in. . . Previously frozen , water tasting, fibrous shoe sole, hunk of dead animal, for 28 dollars! Steamed broccoli was mushy and cold, really? How do they screw up steamed broccoli?  The bake potato was decent. 

Service? 

The waitress got our order wrong at first, them blamed it on me because it would come out of her paycheck. Then returned to apologize for her tone but still blamed me ! Haha! 

Well, I will never ever recommend this place to anyone. KCM needs to be removed from this business and the staff needs a wake up call.

Came for the breakfast special which was not bad. Service could be a lot better. The waitresses were more interested in talking to each other than waiting on tables. Glad I brought my own water bottle. I think they should put the guys that bring out the food up front and the waitresses in the back. That way they can talk to each other and the productive people can work. Been coming here since the special was $1.99 and it's always the same service.
Good spot for starting the day early with a boozy brunch. Our bartender was Belle and she was awesome.

We went in the morning Sunday 8/10 and it was really great! My husband and I shared a delicious burrito and loved the great enviornment and vibe. Our server Ingrid was the sweetest and was very attentive. Thank you Blondies for providing such a great place to chill and great people. :D
Poor service and warm beer make this overpriced cantina one to avoid. There are plenty of great options within walking distance. I recommend you keep walking.

Es un bar con excelente comida tÃ­pica americana en donde predominan las hamburguesas.  La porciÃ³n de la comida es grande y tiene muy buen sabor.

Meh. Greasy food served at Vegas prices. Four of us went there on Tuesday, the place was NOT busy; a dozen or so patrons in the place- plenty of seats @ the bar. The waitress (pleasant and friendly) took an inordinate amount of time to wait on us, process our order and actually get us our food & drinks ( cold curly fries are NOT tasty). Overall, we were underwhelmed. Skip it. The waitstaff wasn't taxed by a bunch of full tables, the bartender was just hanging out and the two cooks/managers/delivery guys that dropped off our food appeared unhurried and laid back......so the problem might be managements approach to motivating the staff to move faster - and prepare BETTER FOOD !! I give this place 1 Lemmon, 1 pear and an orange.

Went here for Sunday football.

We had to put 200$ down the reserve a table. No big deal because with 8 of us we spent that much and they took it off the bill. Only thing was that it made it challenging to pay the bill because everyone neede cash.

At first things weren't going well because we had to wait 20 mins for the party before us to leave. (Their game went into ot) then it took 20 for our waitress to come by. But from there we were good.

Food was ok.

Prices were ok.

Our waitress was great. (Kristen of rhs fame)

Probably would go back but was ok.

Bachelor Party, Pre party location for 10 guys.  UFC fights, all you can drink beer ($80 per person), bar food.  Its a 3 star all the way around.  Food was good (bar food) service however was slow.  Yes, place was packed due to the fights, but the fights didn't just happen.  They were planned, so should have planned more staff.  Service was my biggest complaint.  GREAT AMOUNT OF TVS.  Perfect sports bar, just needed a little more service from the staff
Best Vegas sports! I had a fantastic experience here on my honeymoon!!! Come see Manny behind the bar! FANTASTIC!!

Worse service ever! My wife and I stop by for dinner after a long drive up to LV. Since we were staying at HP we decided to eat close. We sat down at 6:50pm, the waitress never came by till I flagged her down. At around 7:40, I asked her about our food, she leaves then come back and tells us that she forgot to enter my wife's meal and says it will be right up. Tic Toc, Tic Toc, at 8:28 the food comes. The food was nice and hot, not bad, but not worth the wait. When the bill comes she leave it on the table and walks away, not a word! I open it and she over charged us for a extra drink, chips and salsa which we never had or ordered. 

The staff is a bunch of young kids, they were more busy texting than helping out the paying customer!

Stay far away!!!

$10 for a simple sandwich? That's what you get in Las Vegas. I had Philly cheese steak and Reuben sandwich. Both are just OK.
It's in front of V-theater of Miracle Mile shop connected to planet Hollywood. 
BTW, why is it called blondies? There is no single blond waitress in it. All hooters girls have big breasts, and people know what type of waitress they will get if they go to hooters. But if you go to blondies bar, you will get a black hair waitress.
The sweet habanero wings and philly fries are the absolute best things you can get!  Hella bomb!!!
If you want overpriced garbage go here I paid $45 for a pizza and 12 wings I guess they expect you to win the money in the casino so you have some to throw away at this dump

Came here while strolling thru the Miracle Mile Shops. I was pretty hungry and didn't want to wait or blow a wad of money, so burgers came up. This place looked fun with the sports bar theme and TVs playing video clips. The outside (in the mall) seating was high bar tables and regular tables in the middle. 

Our server Belle, came over quickly and got us waters. She was great. She offered us some suggestions and was always available when we had a question. I went with the burger as I was craving one. I was really expecting overpriced mediocre bar food, but was surprised by the burger I got. It was really good! Just a cheese burger with bacon, pepper jack cheese, and jalapenos - well done. It was served on a buttery brioche bun with all the usual veggies. It was greasy but that's what I wanted - wasn't looking for health food here. The burger was flavorful and a good sized patty. I did finish. Paired it with a Shocktop brew and was sittin pretty. 

Saw another table serve up a huge pitcher of beer with a spout on it. Next time..next time... haha. Food was good, filling and didn't break the bank. I have plenty of other places to do that in Vegas. Vibe was fun with the cheerleader waitresses and music playing. Definitely worh a look for your sports bar / burger spot in the mall.

This is a great college bar. If you're looking to play beer pong, flip cup, etc with friends and get tanked, this is the place you want to be. We have been here before for lunch and the food and service were lacking, so I would only go here to drink

Great hot wings and fries ! 1 dozen = $13/ fries were about $4. We also split a club Sandwich which was plenty. Everything is served in big portions. Very tasty and strong house margaritas $5 each (on the rocks).  
Very happy with this find. There was no way we would have known about it without the signs we saw throughout Planet Hollywood shopping area so thanks for that! Service was excellent!

I was on mission to find a place on the Strip that makes a decent cheesesteak.  So after doing some research I came across Blondies menu, and I was glad to see that they serve cheesesteaks with Amoroso rolls from Philly.  That was all I needed to know.  I came here late at night long after the Miracle Mile shops were closed, so I felt kinda awkward walking thru an empty mall trying to get to this place.  When I got there the place was pretty dead and the waitresses seemed very tired.  The only real noise was coming from the drunk folks playing beer pong, that was pretty entertaining to watch.  Anyways, I ordered a mushroom cheesesteak whiz witout (http://bit.ly/1LCXyXz), and after I took my first bite, I was in cheesesteak bliss.  Sure it might have been because it was 1:30am and I was having hunger pangs, but I didn't care, I was enjoying it.  So why only 2 stars??  Good cheesesteak, but that's pretty much where it ends.  Place was dead, atmosphere was cold, waitresss weren't very motivated.  I'd only suggest stopping by here if you're really hungry and need a quick lunch or late night snack.

DO NOT EAT HERE !! Service was horrible, there were a total of six tables seated in the whole place and 3 waitresses and it took 20 minutes for her to take our order. Everyone's meal was wrong! My husband even stated he was allergic to pickles. His sandwich came out sitting on a pickle. My daughter did not want tomatoes in her wrap, there were tomatoes and it was disgusting. When replaced they forgot to put cheese in it and no fries. Waitress stated the kitchen was a train wreck, she wasn't joking. The owner/manager was so very rude and escalated to calling security immediately when we disputed the 16.99 wrap. We were forced to pay but will never be back. The bar manager offered shots to fix the problem. My daughter isn't even 21 and they never asked for ID. We didn't want the shots anyways.

We love Blondies! We first discovered it through a groupon. Our waitress was awesome and helped us get the most from our deal. They have every game on and are very attentive if you need anything.

Now we watch most of our games at Blondies, especially with our out of town guests. I recommend the nachos and potato skins. But everything on the menu is delicious!

And their happy hour deals are fantastic!

If you want to go to a Sports Bar and be ignored and treated poorly then this is the bar for you.
Went there to watch the second game of the world series. We were seated right away.  We go the happy hour special.  All you can drink from 3-6pm for $20.Waitress brought us over our first 12oz draft in a plastic cup and left.  15 minutes later she came back and threw 2 wrist bands on the table and said that we needed to wear them for happy hour.  This was the last we saw of her.  The place was not busy at all. We saw her and 4 other waitresses stand up at the frt of the bar  I had to go to the bartender and get more beers.  The bartender was going to charge me for the beers because she said I should have ordered them thru our waitress.  I told her I would have but she never came back to the table.  We got one more beer and left this place.    DO NOT GO HERE!  There are MANY other sports bars in Vegas.  Go there!
Just ate a very greasy breakfast there. Neither the hostess nor the waitress had the energy to crack a smile once. Overall, a bad experience.
My choice for the grilled chicken was ok, but very small portion. my friends were suffering from their food choices. I didn't like their food, also it's overpriced.
Awesome bar tender, Bobbie.  Give her an awesome tip. Great value. Highly recommend. Great drinks.

If I could give a no stars I would. This place has the worst customer service ever. The waitress in the picture is the nastiest lil bitch ever. We came in with beers and she tried to charge us for them. She argued for no reason and even flipped us off! We called for the manager and he was a worthless piece of shit too! He did not give shit about his waitresses poor customer service. There were 15 of us and they could care less. Do not go into this s shit hole! The worst place I have ever been to. To the manager and the waitress fuck off!

I do not understand why the rating on this bar is so poor!  The service was amazing when I was there never going long without being checked on.  Our food was very tasty as well!  There was a very good selection of beer on tap to keep you from getting thirsty too.  I recommend the "shock top" beer as it is one of the more tasty American beers that I have ever tasted.  When I can find it back home I pick it up too.  
Even during US college football playoffs of some kind I was able to watch the Outdoor Classic hockey game with a bunch of other hockey fans around one of their many big screens.  I highly recommend this sports bar!  The waitress's outfits don't hurt the eyes either!

You are even able to watch the fountain show across the way as well from the seats on the outside of the bar proper and that is quite interesting as well.
They're simply amazing especially how Brianna is now manager i love her work as a bartender

Typical sports bar. Nachos were good. Boneless wings......sweet habinero was way too spicy for me, there was no sweet to it.  Wings came out on bone 1st but we got a shot on the house for the issue. It wasn't crowded at all on a friday night.

Went for their basic 2 egg special.  It comes with sausage or bacon, hash browns and eggs done the way you want.  4 pieces of crispy bacon.  Service was quick.  Good for a quick meal.  Nothing fancy.  Sit in the front to people watch.  Our server disappeared when we were ready for our check.  We had to ask another server to help us.
After days of paying stupid prices for breakfasts, w found this place on our last day here. The $2.99 breakfast special was a godsend. Wonderful find. A must do for the next visit to Sin City.

We didn't eat food at Blondies because it's a rather sub-par version of a sports bar.  We sat on the patio which looks out to the mall.  We met a group of friends there as they were finishing up their mediocre bar food.  We sat at a tall patio table but were never acknowledged by the waitress.  Instead, she walked passed us many times but never made eye contact.
I went up to the bar to order a beer and to grab waters for our table.  The bartender was friendly but he informed me that there is a minimum if you want to pay with a credit card.  Luckily I had cash to pay for my beer.
I'm giving two stars instead of one, simply because the bartender was nice.
Overall, a crappy experience.  I wouldn't go back.
If I could give this place a negative review is I would do so. Worst service ever girls like you and outfits but food wasn't good drinks were way too expensive. Skipping find another place.

We sat at bar in the back and had a GREAT time (watching my team lose) but it was fun anyway!  We ordered steak and eggs and then some wings....food was on point.  The best part was our server.  Demetrious (I hope I'm spelling it right) was AWESOME.  Really attentive and personable. We will definitely be back!

There's Low Standards and No Standards! They WIN NO STANDARDS! 

Don't be deceived this establishments looks fun and exciting, however the services is TERRIBLE! If you enjoy being treated like the dirt at the bottom of your shoe, this is the place for you.  However, if you like to receive great customer service and a delightful meal for a reasonable price this is NOT the place for you.  I went to "BLONDIES" after a late night wedding in Vegas and it was to die for or from in the literal.  
1) It took forever to get service and food (people that were seated after us were eating before us) 2) One of the individuals in my groups order was not correct 3) The one thing I order a baked potato was cold and old 3) The manager could careless and he let us know it from the response he gave my friend.  

When it was all said and done, I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt! So, I took matters into my own hands and said to myself maybe a different approached and a different manager would bring so much need light to the situation.  Nope, I will say at least the other manager attempted to listen, until the rude and disrespectful manger decided to interject with his ignorance (adding fuel to the fire).  As a result, of being completely disrespected and devalued as a customer, I decide to attempt to contact the owner (no success, however not surprised), and finally I decided to write something to caution other travelers not to waste your money at a place like this, when there are other great and fabulous venues in Vegas worth the money.
