Good Luck if you dare to Dine there!

Quite possibly the worst service I've ever experienced.

Don't get me wrong, I know this place is tailored toward guys looking for chicks with hot bodies, a cold beer and some sports, but this place is in the middle of the touristy Miracle Mile mall, and should SOMEWHAT cater to everyone. However, it certainly does not.

I went here the first time about two years ago, and the service was ok. Some scummy guys sent over some shots, and the server did a pretty good job at making a joke out of the situation, and was pretty prompt with us.

However, the second time we went, our group was sitting at the table for about 25 minutes before a server even approached us. In fact, we had to go get someone to get us a server. When she finally showed up, it was quite awkward, as she didn't apologize, and then, of course, charged us for water. Unbelievable.

The food was not good. We had to track her down, again, to get our check. Never have I not left a tip. But this time, I was fed up. It should not take 25 min to get a table, and another 25 min after you're done eating to get your bill.  If I'm paying "Vegas prices," I want better service than this.

Pretty much the only thing this place is good for, is getting a free shot after the American Storm Male Revue show.

Definitely not worth it.

Went to Blondies last night with my fiance, we got seated immediately, the place was not busy at all, seats open everyday where. We sat at our table for 15-20 minutes with no service or anyone saying anything to us. Saw a table with 4 waitresses sitting at it BSing, my fiance told me that they had looked at us a few times but did nothing. I walked over to them and as I did, 3 of the waitresses got up and walked away. I asked the one that got left behind if she knew who our server was for our table and she replied "nope, but I guess I will help you." Like it was an inconvenience. She came and took our drink order and food order. They were not busy at all, so ridiculous! I will never go there again or recommend this place to anyone. If anything, I will recommend people to avoid this place. The food was mediocre and not worth the trouble or BS. Horrible experience. Do not recommend.

I had a Groupon for Blondies that was going to expire the next day.  That figures the way I let Groupons go.  We came here Saturday to use it before we lost its value.

We were seated at a low table in the patio area.  We were brought menus immediately and our drink order was taken.  In a short time, our server--I believe Markiya was her name--came to take our order.

My wife ordered a Philly cheesesteak and I ordered the Reuben.  We were told that a basket of fries was better than two separate orders.  We got the garlic fries.

Both sandwiches were very large and very good.  The garlic fries were very good!   

Service was good.  My iced tea was refilled a couple of times and I didn't need to   ask.  I normally would give a four star rating but the noise level was awful.  It was the first day of the college football season and there were some loud viewers in the main restaurant.  Also, being located where it is along the Miravle Mile Shops walkway makes for more noise.  A plus though is the oppoprtunity to watch tourists.  That's always a lot of fun.  Prices here are also high.  I can get as good in my neighborhood for less money and less driving.

Still, it was a good meal and I'm glad I tried Blondies after walking by all these years.

On a visit to Las Vegas, with my Husband, he was craving a Good Hamburger, and he liked that Blondie's had alot of TV'S to watch Sports, so we decided to eat there!  WRONG CHOICE !!!  my husband had Sliders, that tasted good, but was way OVER priced,  and if he would of wanted french fries, they would of been, $6.00, I wasn't that hungry, which was a good thing, because all I ordered were the chips and salsa, and they were $5.95, I had a Margarita that was served in a plastic cup for $8.00, and the coke's are $3.95, oh! they only serve bottle water, and charge you $1.00, they say it is for charity?  We would never go back to this Restaurant !  Oh! they have Happy Hour!  which is $20.00, all you can drink, Domestic Beer and Well Drinks, which is really not a very good idea, when someone is young, and dumb !!!  I would say the only good thing about this Restaurant are all the TV's if you are a Sports Fan !

Not sure why this place has low ratings, maybe it's because they have a cover charge for sport games? Anyways, we walked into this place this weekend while looking for a place to eat. The servers were friendly and the food was great. I got hot wings with a basket of curly fries. We also got shots on the house...well for 8 cents haha

Great place to play beer pong. They have tournaments that are only $20 which includes drinking! Also you can show your college ID to get discounts. 

The food is ok. We got the sampler plate. Good while your drink but not high quality or anything. We usually just go for a fun place to play beer pong on the strip!

Going to Vegas tonight and was thinking about this bar.  I came here a few years ago for a Paquiao fight.  I remember the $60? entrance fee which included unlimited bud/bud light.  We had some chicken wings and the one that was the best I had in a while was the habanero flavor.  It was pretty spicy for someone like me that like spicy and it had a great crunch.  But yeah I thought those were some of the best wings I've had.

I forgot the name of this bar in the beginning so decided to find it on yelp and to see such low reviews.  I was thinking to stopby for those spicy wings again.

We decided to go and try out their unlimited pasta. We were seated right away but no one came to take our order. I had to ask one of the waitresses if she could send our waitress to our table. After that she came moments later. The pasta is $9.99 and you have the option to add meatballs or chicken for $2.99. My friend got the chicken and I got the meatballs and we both ordered the alfredo. The bowl was a good decent size and mines had two large meatballs. My friend finished his first and wanted his second bowl; but then he was told if he wanted more chicken he had to pay another $2.99. We were shocked, and so he ate his pasta without chicken. We then asked for boxes and they said they don't give boxes when the unlimited pasta is ordered. I asked to speak to the manager and he really didn't want to give us boxes. I told him you guys are only going to throw it away so what's the big deal of letting me take the food that I paid for home. One of his responses was we should already know they don't allow boxes with the unlimited pasta and he even compared it to running a red light! He said everyone knows not to run a red light. I told him that's against the law and its written in the handbook. Nowhere does it say you cannot take the pasta home. So to end it he says I'll bring one box and runs off; he didn't even give me a chance to respond to him. So, I had to stuff both of our food into one box. Even though the pasta was good I'm never going back because of that experience and on top of that their food is overpriced. We should've just went to Bubba Gump.

Not a bad place to grab a quick drink and some food.

We were brought in by the host and hostess as they told us the deal was $10 Draughts!  We bit, and came in because we also wanted food.  There were a lot of beer pong matches going on as it was a Thursday night and that seems to be the theme.  We ordered some food, and I ordered the "Build your own Burger" and it was pretty damn good.  You get your choice of THREE toppings as well as cheese - I opted for Avocado, Blue Cheese and Bacon -  and skipped the extra cheese.

It was interesting though when our bill came because they waitress told us the beer we were drinking was "not included"... even though we told her we had the bands, and wanted to "try" the best beer AND the host and hostess specifically told us come in for $10 DRAUGHT beers, and the menu said $10 DRAUGHT beers - so maybe there was small print with that but if we have bands, and we are drinking anything BUT what is included, you would think they would question it.

Anyways - They were nice enough to drop those off our bill becuase it was clearly a misunderstanding by all parties.  Because of that, they get an extra star!  The downfall of this place is the noise-  It's filled with screaming college kids playing beer pong on Thursdays, Im sure other days may be a bit more relaxed as it wouldnt have the wristbands, so when I am in town again, I will be stopping in again.

Stop by for dinner they had an all you can eat pasta special. We ordered the spaghetti with marinara sauce and the fettuccini Alfredo. We were surprised at how large a bowl of pasta they made for $9.99 per person. The spaghetti was prepared perfectly and not soggy or overcooked pasta. The marinara sauce was tasty and not watery. The sauce stayed on the spaghetti and made the pasta have taste. The fettuccini Alfredo was very good and full of flavor. The Alfredo sauce was not excessively greasy because of the over use of butter or oil. We even had enough to have left overs to take back to the condo. 
The place is a clean sports bar type of environment and decore.  Lot of different screens with all types of sports programs on. They had a full bar. They even had some tables that you can pour your own beer at you own table. If you like beer boy you can have a great time here.

Just got back from spending the weekend in Vegas. We wanted to watch the Mayweather fight somewhere, and so I did a little research before we hit the road. Called Blondies and was told that they would have the fight, and that the cover charge would be $40 a person, which would include all the beer you can drink. SCORE!! So on the way over to Blondies, I call to make sure there's still space available, and am told there is, but the cover is now $60.....hmmmm. Okay. Still not terrible since it includes drinks. Well, then we get to the front to pay our entrance, and are now told it's $80!!!!!!!!!!!! I explained that I had just called minutes ago, and was given the $60 price. They didn't give a crap. Bottom line (it's Vegas after all) is to make money. The guys working the front were fairly rude, which makes it even worse when handing your money over to them. 
Well we decided that since we were already there, we'd suck it up....and pay. I didn't want to use all my cash so I proceeded to pay with my debit card. Oh darn, they only take cash!!! So one of the rude guys tells the little waitress to show me where the ATM is located in the restaurant. She takes me right to it, and then I turn around and she's gone???!!! So I get my money, go back to the rude goons at the front and stand there FOREVER while they just ignore me. Then it hit me, Hey, I'm in this joint. You want to be rude jerks?? Okay, cool. Me, and my money (safely back in my pocket) are winning this round. I found my boyfriend inside and drank PLENTY OF FREE BEER, and watched the fight. For nada, zip, zilch!! Ha Blondies, suck it. I win. 

The money I didn't spend here, I spent the next day at the Pub at Monte Carlo. Way better place to watch sports, and have all inclusive food/drinks. No surprises on the price. When I called I was told $40 all you can drink....when we got there,$40 all you can drink!! This is on Sunday's btw. So you can post up and watch football and have a GREAT time. So save yourself the bs that is Blondies. Go elsewhere. Where they're honest about prices, and don't act like idiots when you get there.

We were looking for a good place to do happy hour where the boys could watch some sports. Lured by the $20 all you could drink 3pm-6pm, Blondie's seemed like the best choice closest to our evening shows. Well, started off rocky when it took nearly a half an hour for a waitress to come to our table. When she got there, we promptly told her we were looking for the $20 deal. Well, you go to the bar for that and when you need a refill you go back to the bar, she took care of food orders. Ok so we ordered some food and went and got our first rounds of drinks. Bartender was a little sarcastic but hey so am I. Second round of drinks? Not so quick and more attitude from the bartender. 3rd round? We had to wait in line at the bar and bartender was, dare I say it, a little ruder still. By the time we felt as though we had gotten our money's worth, we had worked pretty hard for our beers. In addition, our waitress came to our table and asked if she could give us our bill as her shift was over. We were all done eating so no problem. Well we sat there another hour and a half and our waitress was still helping other tables, giving us the impression she didnt have to leave but just didnt want to tend to our table any more. All in all, pretty lackluster experience at Blondies. 

As for the sports on the tvs for the boys? Well there was for the first hour until the infomercials came on and no one bothered to change the channels.
Manny was our server, super cool highly recommended his service. Great drinks and customer service. Ordered food and drinks both great.

The worst service in all of Las Vegas. We waited 45 minutes for our food. It was lunch and it was not busy at all. When we asked to speak to the manager, she totally avoided us. So we gave her 5 minutes to come to our table. So when she did not come, we told the waiter we were leaving. All 15 of us stood up and left. We just paid for our drinks. I would not go to this place if I were you. There are far better serviced places @ the Miracle Mile shops @ Planet Hollywood. Look up Hash-Hash a go go. Far better place.

Can I give it a zero PLEASE OH PLEASE YELP?!

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!

I asked the hostess about happy hour, she rolled her eyes at me and gave me the most attitude ever .. I was shocked! But I still wanted those damn garlic fries so I still let her snooty ass walk me to a table .. she tried walking me to some bfe table and so I told her I was going to sit at the bar for quicker service.  She stared at me like I was ridiculous, whatever. 

Bartenders were clueless with their drinks .. wanted to get drunk after a weeks hard work but no where in PH gave me the chance. :(

If you're in PH just get some Earl's and gtfo :) Cosmo across the way has much better customer service AND drinkks!

Decent food and pretty good service considering they were packed on a Friday night, but I've got one question...

Who's the genius that decided to serve poutine in a wire basket covered with a piece of paper? The second you attempt to eat these gravy covered fries and cheese curds with a fork, the paper is punctured and you are now sitting in front of a gravy covered table. Not the most well thought out plan, but hey, they saved $1.00 washing dishes last month.

I came in to have a beer and watch the game with some friends. I wasn't really expecting much but I ended up having a fantastic time . My server Ashley honestly made the whole experience . She was so friendly and kept the drinks coming ! We didn't even have to ask her for refills on our waters, which is an A++ in my book! I will defiantly be coming back and sending friends. If you decide to go in and have a drink make sure you ask for Ashley! You won't be disappointed!

Got their appetizer platter for 20 bucks. It included jalapeÃ±o poppers, wings, chicken strips and macaroni and cheese balls. Wasn't the most amazing food but it definitely got its job done and filled us up. My boyfriend got a jack and coke for 10 BUCKS! Clubs charge this much, not sports bar! Not bad but nothing special.

This was our second visit and I love this place. Yes, I am a sports bar junkie but this bar/restaurant is way above the average sports hangout. The food and drinks are a bit pricey but that's no surprise. It's the best place in Begas by far to recoup after a long night of drinking when you're in the mood for "food" you would never normally want!

The staff are super friendly-even with my left of center sense of humor. This is a must for us every time we're in town.

Could be an amazing place under proper management but when you have 1 urinal stall for 100 guys and they start pissing on the restaurant floor, that's not the kind of place you want to visit, period. AVOID for that and the little man that DJ's behind the bar who is rude, arrogant and belligerent towards customers.

Popped in this sports bar while shopping at the Miracle Mile Shops for a quick drink with my wife. Sat at the back bar and was served by Gerome who is a bartender that goes by "G". G gave us exceptional service even though it was busy. He made us both Jolly Rancher cocktails that he suggested which were awesome  just right - not too sweet, not too strong, but again - just right. 

If you're at the Miracle Mile Shops and want to get a drink, visit Blondies and see if "G" is available. Great place to check out. Lots of monitors playing all of the games so you won't miss anything especially during football season.

Great place to watch a game and amazing service!! I've been here before a few times to watch a game or just to have a bite to eat and it was always a great experience. Decided this year to watch both the AFC and NFC championship games which required a deposit and prior online reservations to reserve a specific table (deposit was good towards your check).  I was kind of expecting it to be utter chaos just because of how packed they get for football and was just expecting to be a tad disappointed . I was very pleasantly surprised that it was just the opposite. 

We arrived and were taken to our table that had our name on it and showed that it was reserved for us for both games. We were almost immediately greeted by our servers Amber and Danny (we had two servers because we were there for 7 hours) who were so delightful and extremely attentive the entire time. Despite being packed to the rim with people watching the games Amber was checking on us constantly. Got a few snacks during the game which were tasty (remember people this is not a 5-star restaurant) and even a few "on the house" shots. 

I highly recommend going to Blondies to watch any game. They have dozens of TVs so there is never an obstructed view from any table. Their prices on alcohol are extremely reasonable considering it's Las Vegas and the staff is so friendly and accommodating. Blondies definitely made both games soooooo entertaining!!!

Watch where you sit.  I told the hostess we wanted to sit where they offfered their $5 shots.   She sat us there.  Each spot says different things.  Our bill came and they charged us $7.I questioned the waitress and was told the tables are outdated.  What?

Blondies is your typical Vegas sports bar, typical meaning they have a lot of TV's and, being in Vegas, a bucket of beer is $35.  It is conveniently located in the miracle mile if you are staying at Planet Hollywood.  The food is far below par, but they do have a fun environment.  If you are at a bachelor party or similar and want to watch the game this is a good choice as it is large and they have lots of tables.

If I could give zero stars I would. This place has horrible service. Our waitress walked by us several times not even acknowledging us until we yelled and asked for water. We asked her who was our server and she said she didn't know. She said she would take our orders anyway. We waited another 30 minutes before our food came out.  We never received drink refills , but the same waitress, who said she wasn't our waitress, gave us our check. By the way, her name, who I found out from the receipt, never introduced herself was Lauren. Horrible!!!!!
Terrible terrible terrible!! Dirty place with hot beer and bad food! Stay away, far away!!!

Great food. Love the tuna sandwich. Cute waitresses, lots of tv's. I eat here everytime I go to Vegas. Perfect sandwich, burger, fries place. Love the atmosphere and there are huge portions for the price.

Waited for 40 minutes for a pizza. Still waiting for our drinks. Had to get up and ask for the water we originally asked for when we ordered the pizza. Pizza is so greasy it is literally falling apart. Awful

Staff was friendly and great service but that was about the only plus. 
For the of their frozen burger patty I could have walked down the way and ate at a gourmet burger spot for about $2 dollar more and Im sure it would have had twice the flavor. Over priced beer, over priced food. With all the options in Vegas spend your money else where. There was nothing that made this place stand out as a cut above the rest.

Where do I even start? This place sucks ass! We sat down at the table and one of us ordered the Philly Cheesesteak.  The waitress says, "If you want onions or mushrooms, it's an extra .35 each"  WTF!!!!! A Philly cheesesteak sandwich is supposed to come with onions and mushrooms!   We ordered a large pizza, okay? Not some greesy dough covered in slimy, greasy cheese.  HORRIBLE! 
Then here's the kicker.  The waitress comes out with four glasses and four BOTTLED WATERS!  "Hold up," I say, "I didn't order bottled water...regular water is fine."  She says, "Water is a dollar a bottle...it all goes to charity."  WTF????  "Well, you really should have told us that when we asked for water," I replied.  The waitress just looked at me and said, "Do you want the waters or not?!"  
Oh HELL to the F*** no, you didn't, Bimbo. 
The next time she came out to our table and asked if there was anything else she could get for us, I just said, "Just more napkins...UNLESS...you charge for those too!"
Absolutely, hands down, the WORST restaurant in the Miracle Mile!

REFRESHING

My husband was automatically attracted to this particular sports bar in the Miracle Mile shops, 1. For the huge flat screens all over 2. To the cute cheer leaders serving the tables. 

We sat on the "patio" and watched multiple waitress walk by and not address our table. As we looked over the menu one of the waitress walked by and asked if we've been taken care of yet. My husband and son quickly said no. Talia quickly apologized for not having a waitress over at the table , and took our drink order. My son (whom is mentally disabled) started asking questions regarding the menu. Talia was very patient and answered all of Roberts questions.  (thank you for that)

We decided on a cheese steak, salmon entree and a rib eye entree. 
Drinks were refilled multiple times, my husband enjoyed several draft buds and the food was exquisite for a "sports bar"

The atmosphere was great! Food was a bit over priced but welcome to Vegas 

Thank you Talia and Blondies team. See you for football season

Saw Game 5 of the NBA Finals here and let me tell you, Blondie's knows how to throw a Sports Bar Party. Their huge Sports room has huge screens to go along with it and many fans cheering along the way. Was here on a work vacation and this night made it all that more special. Our server was excellent, food was tasty especially the delicious steak fries, and my vodka tonic was perfectly made. I'll definitely be coming back here again, especially for another game.
Owners are a joke. Especially the one with the gambling and drinking problem that tries his best to have sex with the staff....fail.

I am not liking this place but to watch the game here would be cool as they have tons of TV's everywhere...and super loud! I barely could hear the group that went with me here! 

This was located in the Miracle miles shops. It's a sport bar kind of place. The ladies here wear cheerleader type outfits that show a lot of cleavage and I am sure the men that go here love that. Service was pretty good thou. ;p

The bench seats were pretty cool but the food is only ok. We ordered their traditional wings. It was deep fried but they over soaked it with the sauce that made the chicken soggy. We ordered their nachos with all the fixings but it cost over $21! Was not worth it as it was flavorless or nothing special about it. We ordered the $3.99 all you can eat pasta. There is a choice of fettuccine Alfredo or spaghetti. It came with garlic bread but it was kinda soggy thou. I think the past was pretty good for the price due to size.

Bathrooms were kinda nasty. They need to really clean it. Sorry but I won't be coming back!

I had buffalo wings and a side cesear salad.  The food was fine.  Nothing special.  Not too overpriced considering it is located on the strip.

I was told that they do not serve tap water (only bottled) so I was forced into purchasing a soda.

The service was horrible.  There were about 30 people dining and only one waitress.  The other waitresses were on break or hadn't started their shift.  I could see them sitting around texting on their phones while I got bad service.

They turned on the audio to some basketball game.  It was way too loud.  I had to scream to my friend sitting accross the table.

The food is 3 stars.  The service is 1 star.  Averages to 2 stars.
You can't beat $3.99 breakfast! You get eggs, sausage or bacon and hash browns. Also, my husband got a bud light for only $2. Great food, service and prices. Highly recommend when you're in Vegas!

Beer pong is decent, you have to wait for the whole tournament to end before starting a game, even if not competing.. Blah. Also, we paid for $20 entry fee for unlimited draft beer, and then they only give you like 3 choices of beer, which were the cheapest beer. I ended up paying more because I bought additional beer. The beer pong was the only thing that got them the 2 stars, service sucks and deal was misleading.

This place is awful. First off, I think the waitress was overbooked, which isn't necessarily her fault, but she had such a bad attitude... No one puts a gun to your head and tells you to work customer service, YOU CHOSE THIS JOB, and sometimes you're busy...DEAL WITH IT. Our waitress also griped that no one was taking her tables after her shift, in the middle of happy hour, and then she disappeared. When other members of our party wanted another drink, they went to the bar because our waitress was nowhere to be found, and the bartender was just as rude and said she had no idea who our server was, but she wouldn't make our drinks because we needed to ask our server...excuse me WHAT!? What is going on here? Worst customer service I've ever seen. And my cocktail tasted like water.

Can't tell if the food or beer are good or not because we waited 45 minutes for the waitress to come over on our table, and then another 15 waiting for our beer when we stepped out... bar was empty btw. Horrible service.

We had a large group attend the Super Bowl at Blondies. We had a great time. The draft beer selection was lacking but the bottle service was awesome. The bar drinks were even better, big pours with more on the way! The food was good. The service depended on who your server was, ours was great. 

As far as a place to go to watch a UFC event or big game? You can't beat it. Dozens of big HD TVs every where. We will be back neck year for sure. 

If I had one complaint it would be the restroom. There are not enough men's facilities and they need a cleaning during big events.

Located in the Miracle Mile Shops inside Planet Hollywood Hotel Casino on the Famous Las Vegas Strip.  A fun little sports bar that is a little "Hooters-esqu" Just so you know what you are getting into. The food is good as is the service. They have great breakfast specials, worth checking out. they have a pretty good happy hour as well. I will say the prices are not bad for the strip, so stop in have a beer or three and take a load off. Do a little people watching while young are there, what can it hurt? Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

Terrible experience.  First of all there was only one blonde waitress in the whole place, they are out of Bud and Bud Light, slow service and our waitress was not the friendliest.  I ordered the nachos and it had a nice amount of chips but only enough toppings for a quarter of the chips.  My wife asked for a lemons for her water and the waitress brought out one lemon slice.  I ordered a beer and the waitress brought the wrong one out so I had to wait for the correct one to be brought out, after waiting 10 minutes for the first one.  NOT HAPPY.

This was my first visit to Blondies. What a great spot to grab a drink and something to eat. My server Fernanda was the best! Extremely attentive, great service and always had a smile on her face. I'll definitely be back again! She pointed out the drink and food specials for the time of day I was there. Made suggestions and asked if I had any questions. Some of the best service I've had in Las Vegas. Check this place out if you are in town!

While the pizza is excellent  (supreme & chicken parmesan) the service is lousy. Cute servicers don't matter to straight women! My server watched me as I cleaned my own FILTHY table that we sat at. Argued that we didn't order a 2nd pizza & it took longer to get our plates than our 1st pizza. Don't ask for extras because you won't get them & good luck finding your server after she takes your order  (food runner brings your food) food runner had to get us our plates that we should have had before our pizza arrived.

Blondie's = underrated! Just a typical sports bar with lots of TVs and greasy bar food, BUT there are beer pong tables in the back. The bar supplies cups, balls, pitchers, etc which were relatively cheap. Since O'Shea's is gone (RIP), this will probably become our day time hang out when pool party season is over.

Another one that took a dive. We ate at Bondies many years ago. I can't remember how far back. The food was exceptional. Granted it's bar food, but I like bar food and the atmosphere is nice. We had tickets to a show at the V Theater and a Groupon came up for Blondies. So it was perfect. Eat, then walk a few steps to our show. We were seated immediately. Our waitress gave pretty piss poor service. We are not extravagant people. I don't need you to kiss my ass because you're serving me food. I just ask that you refill my water, and get me my food when it's ready. This waitress was bottom of the barrel. It took her forever to get our order...after walking past us telling us she'd be right with us. She then explained how it's been soooooooo busy and short staffed. I'm human, I get it. No worries. However, she was off doing god knows what and I see a guy in a t-shirt (a bartender, a dishwasher) I don't know who he is. But he kept running all her food. Um, ok. She's just walking around like she's got nothing better to do. Also, I'm pretty liberal. I don't care if you have tats over your damn eye lashes BUT sometimes what you wear does not go well with your "art." She was covered in really bad faded tats wearing a cheerleading costume. The hostess was gabbing with two friends who came in for applications. She would gab with them. seat someone then back to dishing about how great the job is. UGH. Unprofessional. But the food was good, when we finally got it. Nice girl, but slow service. Overall, with a groupon or a comp or desperation would bring me back. But hopefully none of that is likely. 

I have never had their alcohol I can't speak to that or happy hour specials.

I think a lot of people are going to Blondie's for the wrong reasons. The thing is you gotta walk into this place knowing what you're getting yourself into. Blondie's is basically a Hooters that hosts beer pong games. Forget about the food, forget about anything else but beer and you'll be okay. Am I saying it makes up for their poor service and prick bartenders? Nope. But I'm just making a point.

I went here last night, pretty damn late with a group of guys (a majority of whom were Marines). We went to play beer pong pretty much and that is what we did. The beer pong tables were pretty packed and everyone around us was having a good time. It was pretty loud and fun and all the people around us were nice (tossing back balls, joking, just having a good time). It was 4th of July weekend so we were all doing what Americans do... drinking beer and yelling about how much we love America.

Would I go out of my way to eat here? No. Would I go back if I weren't with a bunch of Marines playing beer pong? No. But it's a fun time for what it is.

Been here twice for two different occasions. Very laidback. Convenient location inside of PH. Quick drinks, nothing fancy. Fun place to go with a group of people to play beer pong and flip cup. The entire back of the bar is set up just for that. But be careful, it can get pretty rowdy during peak times and beer pong gets pretty competitive.

Went to Blondies on 12-28 to watch the Lions/Packers while visiting Vegas. Bad decision. Food is way over priced, service is bad and the beer prices are $$$! The Lions/Packers game was the featured game yet at the start, they had music blaring so loud and no game sound. They tuned in the game on several Tvs but they were not synced. Several of our food orders were cold. A much better option is the Mexican Cantina across the mall!

Purchased a goupon which enabled us to overindulge.  My BF and I ordered a pizza, wings.  The wings were ok....nothing special btut the pizza was excellent.  The drinks are a little expensive but our waitress was super nice and informative.  She upsold us on drinks , its a good thing we had a groupon!  It was pretty dead when we went to we were served right away and rec'd our food right away...seems like it would be a fun place with the beer pong set up and all....if there were other peole then just us.

Stopped in Blondie's for lunch the other day while playing tourist on the Strip over the weekend. The place looks pretty cool and there are lots of big TVs everywhere to watch your favorite sporting event. The hosts and waitresses were all dressed in their cute little cheerleaders outfits.

I grabbed a sandwich and fries to eat and it was quite delicious. For being in a tourist section, all in all it wasn't a bad place to try out.  Though as a local, I wouldn't find myself making a special trip there just to eat or drink or to watch a sporting event.

But if in the area, I would go there again.

Located inside the mall area of Planet Hollywood. 

Decided to give this place a try since it was right across the theater we were watching our show. 
Tons of TV so you can watch all the sports you want.

Pint of blue moon-$10.00, that is a bit much
Garlic steak fries- good amount of garlic and Parmesan 
12 wings, med.- nice crunch to it, ranch was a bit watered down 
Garlic balls-it was good, not bad. 

I would give any place a try at least once but I won't come here again.

Solid. Waitresses were great. Found my game I wanted to watch and made sure it stayed on.  

Good food.

It takes a lot for me to leave one star. However, there is a lot of room for improvement here. Servers are slow to greet tables. Two tables waited for at least 5 minutes before they were even acknowledged. The manager was holding up the end of the bar...clueless of what was going on in his place...the whole time we were in the place.

The pizza was good. A nice selection of craft beer.

Our server didn't even ask or bring any refills on our drinks (the most basic level of good service a server can give).

If I could only describe this place in one word, I would have to say:

CRACKIN'!!!!

but let me elaborate...

A handful of girlfriends and I decided to hit up Vegas. It was our first day there and we were starvin Marvins. We randomly picked Blondie's because nothing else sounded good. So what we order? CHICKEN STRIPS. And man, I tell ya.. these chicken strips were the best I ever had. WE ever had.

We come here the NEXT day, to get MORE chicken strips for lunch. And all of a sudden we hear loud music and people dancing on the bars. We didnt know Blondie's was poppin on a Tuesday afternoon!

I swear we ate chicken strips all 5 days in Vegas and we were fine with that!

SERVERS ARE EXTREMELY OBNOXIOUSLY RUDE! My husband and I were seated quickly by hostess and the place was EMPTY; and the music was way to loud. I saw a short haired young woman waitress and politely asked if we could move to a table outside to avoid the loud music and she RUDELY with such a obnoxious look says with an eye roll "ask the hostess" 
1. Never eye roll a customer 2. It's customer service how about YOU politely offer to ask for me or just say YES as the place is empty or 3. Be POLITE and say "of course just ask the hostess so she can seat you accordingly" TERRIBLE!

This place could do so much better in their food.  The food is what really brings this place down.  They shouldn't be so cheap with their servings and learn how to cook better.  We couldn't see the mushrooms in the burger.  They were non-existent!  And I had more lettuce in my BLT than anything else.  I little bit more than 1 piece of bacon in my sandwich, please.
The only good thing I can say about this place is that there are a lot of televisions.  And when we asked if we could have a tv on a certain game, they obliged.  The servers were friendly, but I swear they had to have been tweaking on something.  I'm afraid to find out since some of them were so jumpy.  I really thought their boobs might fall out of their outfits.  Another good thing about this place is the deal for beer.  The server did point out it's cheaper to get 5 beers for $25 instead of getting single beers.  She knew we were there to watch football.  Good job, Tweaker!!!  
Seriously, they need to get their food better, because it would be too easy to just drink when the food sucks.  And who needs more drunks in Vegas?

If you're in Las Vegas, you HAVE to stop by Blondies.  The place is always packed with a fun group of people.  Everyone gets really into the games, which are playing all over because they have tv screens everywhere.  

If you stop by, CHECK IN!  You get a free drink if you check in on Yelp.  They also have a ton of really great mixed drinks.

Even if you aren't a sports fan, you'll like this place.  Their menu has a lot of variety, so it's easy to find something you'll like.  (I hard a hard time picking my meal because there were so many great looking options.   Also, (especially for downtown Las Vegas), they have really reasonable prices.  

Overall, the food is great, the drinks are even better, the atmosphere is fun, and the location (on the Strip) is perfect.

This is the worst place ever! I've had better food and, certainly far way better service elsewhere. I waited for over 30 minutes to get our order taken and then have it get mixed up! I'd recommend you go spend your money elsewhere!

A poor excuse for a sports bar. Granted, we ate here purely to be able to dine "al fresco" (or as much as it can be while in a casino), but the beer selection is abysmal and my meal wasn't really even up to bar food standards. The tomato soup tastes like it came from a can and my spinach salad had unidentifiable ingredients. Plus, it was all over priced.

Also, FYI to the waitresses, when a customer order san appetizer, it should come out BEFORE the rest of the meal.

This place is pretty awesome, I don't know why there's so many haters out there. Food is priced very reasonably, particularly being on the strip. Servers are super friendly, no attitude. And they have all the sports channels you'd want. Check it out you will not be disappointed!

Stopped in Thursday afternoon, to watch the NCAA first round and have a couple beers. The waitress recommended we get the "big" 24 oz drafts for $15 ea, but wasn't really knowledgeable about the price of 12 oz versions. We ended up having 4 of the Golden Road Brown Ales (god stuff) - though in retrospect $60 seems a little steep. I'd remembered being at Blondies before and thinking the beer prices were a bargain - must have been on a happy hour. An order of a dozen wings was $18 and were nothing special in size, texture or flavor. The 3 sliders were $13 and while small, were pretty tasty. It's tough finding any place on the strip that's a bargain anymore - here we paid $119 w/ tip for 4 beers, a dozen wings and one order of sliders. From the Sports Bar persepective, there were 9 TVs visibile where we sat, but 5 had the same game on. We asked about changing the channel, but the waitress must have spaced it off. We probably would have been happier hitting the Buffalo Wild Wings we bypassed a block earlier to get to Blondies.

We were in a rush to grab dinner before a show and stopped in at Blondie's because there was no wait and it fit our budget. They were out of most of their beers (probably thanks to it being New Year's week). Out of our group of six, none of us were overly impressed with the food. My turkey wrap was okay at best and the pizza was disgusting.

Service was slow and almost dismissive, despite the fact that they weren't overly busy.

There was a very loud group taking up the entire back half of the restaurant. I of all people totally understand others wanting to have a good time, but the guys who came over and insisted on "starting up a conversation" with our group of girls (a.k.a. making a poor attempt to hit on us) disturbed the end of a below average meal and also got in the way of us trying to pay our checks. I would have had a more pleasant experience eating fast food. Perhaps if we wanted to just stop in for cheap light beer and beer pong (ugh) we would have enjoyed ourselves more.

Gotta agree with the others on here in that the service sucks! Although they did provide water with our food. Good thing cause I needed it to choke down the gross turkey, bacon and avocado wrap I ordered. The free appetizers they had out were even worse and they didn't even bother to put plates out so people were just eating with their hands. This seems to be a bar that thinks it's cool but it's not.

0 stars would be Blondies.  This place is horrible.  The waitress was a bitch and even when we complained to the manager about her, the manager simply brought us over free shots to try to appease us. (For those of you who don't already know-- "free shots" in Vegas means they don't even have alcohol in them.) We finally walked out after our appetizer when we found out they won't even serve you iced water.  They try to make you pay for bottled water telling you it's for a "non profit or a charity."  I'm pretty sure it should be illegal for bars not to serve water when they are located in the middle of the Mohave desert.
A great place for good grille food.  Sit on the patio to peoplewatch.  The service is good.  We had a group of 10 and the staff was very accommodating.

Yeah don't go here. Every time I'm in Vegas I pass this place at some point and think that place looks fun. It's not. The food is mediocre and overpriced. The service is bleh. I mean you might get better service if you're a guy. The place is dated. It felt like a horrible cheap tinder date gone wrong. With all the great offering in Vegas why would you go here? Please for the love of the Vegas God's go elsewhere.
Awful service... waitresses make you feel like you need to beg for service. Save yourself the trouble... unless you're a 21 year old flirty male in heat...then you might get better treatment.

Blondies is my number one stop in Vegas! Tons of TVs and drink specials to suit everyone's needs. Not to mention I've been coming here mainly to see the fabulous Chelsea Maidman, she has worked her for years and has always taken care of us and is always in a great mood.
Watched the UFC fight there a few days ago, great bartender, fun atmosphere, good food & reasonable prices. We will definitely go back.

So I came here the first time I ever came to Vegas and I must admit I rather enjoyed it ALOT ! My husband became a fan he loved the Buffalo wings and so did I, beer was pretty cheap too, the food was pretty good but the service was terrible it takes like 10 to 15 mins just for them to get your drink order and food order and maybe just maybe if your lucky you'll get your order in 30 mins or less. So food was great service not so great that's my review ENJOY !

Only reason I'm even giving it 2 stars is because the food was decent.. Service not so much. And when you go to pay they tell you it's a "minimum" 25 dollars if your using multiple credit cards when that little fact is clearly not stated ANYWHERE. She tried to say it charges the house if it's under 25 dollars. Either management is completely stupid or the owners a penny pincher, either way I've never had that happen before and def won't be back again.

Unfortunately, I will never go back to eat here again.  The food is good, but the SERVICE and management is horrible.  I was in a party of 3 (2 adults & a teen) in the middle of the afternoon and had a bill of $75+ dollars.  20% of that was gratuity.  The server never came back to our table once!  Once we received our food, we never got refills of drink nor did we get the condiments that we asked for.  

So in my opinion these servers add the gratuity at their discretion because they know that their service was poor.  Gratuity is not a guarantee, it is not for them to decide.  

Never again!

My husband and I liked this place. We would definitely return. Fast and friendly service. Some of the patrons were a little loud but it is a sports bar. It's a nice spot to bring a large group of people who like to watch games on TV. Food was really good and well prepared. Nicely located inside the Miracle Mile shops.

Went here late at night for some food. There is not too much to say about this place. It was pretty empty for a Sunday night, probably because it is nestled deep in the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood that are mostly closed that late. We ordered Mozzarella sticks and each got a wrap and a drink. The Mozz sticks were good, and the wraps were fine, but both were pretty expensive. The bill was almost $70 which I felt was a bit excessive for the amount of food we got. The wraps did not even come with fries. I'm sure this place is more fun with more people, when it's more of a bar than a late night restaurant. This is just my experience.

The waitresses wear Cheerleader uniforms, and were pretty attentive, though the bartender was slow with our drinks.

Ate at Blondies on Friday of our Vegas trip. The server was nice, but wasn't very attentive. As others have noted, there is no free tap water, but they did give the first round of bottled waters free. They gave 3 bottles for 5 people. Food was mediocre bar food at best, not worth anything near the price we paid for it!

They had everything but pepper  on the table, wanted to ask for pepper but our waitress was in the kitchen talking. I was surprised when we got the check and a 20% gratuity was included. We left what we thought was fair considering the service we received  (15%) and the waitress followed us outside to let us know we had short changed her. When informed of that we didn't think she deserved that amount she told us "It is called a tip, and it is mandatory!" We ended up just walking away.

My least favorite part was about 2 hours later when the stomach problems started for 4 out of 5 of us. All 4 of us ate the hot wings (which were probably the best part of the meal) and ended up with stomach issues for the rest of the trip!

I don't think I'll ever eat here again!

I don't usually write many reviews but after my terrible experience here I was quite compelled.

So I went to Blondies in Las Vegas for the first time this last Saturday night.  It seemed like an "off" night (because there were only a handful of other people there besides my fiance, me and the other couple we were with). I can see why there weren't many people there on a Saturday night NOW.

The expensive food didn't bother me, as it is kind of expected when on the Strip.  The fact that they only had bottled water (as far as water goes) that they charged for didn't bother me, because I don't like tap water anyhow.

What bothered me was my encounter with the bleach-blonde, curly 'fro-ish haired, Irish (so he mentioned) bartender.  He was quite the d--che bag. 

So my group and I were seated and served our drinks and food, all was going well until the bartender started his shift and cranked up his (terrible) music. Now I understand that in a public establishment, I'm not always going to hear my music of choice. But he had turned up his music REALLY LOUD. Like louder than in a club loud. When we were all having trouble hearing each other and the waitress, the waitress mentioned that "he always does this" and that she hated it because she couldn't speak with the guests. This music was pounding in all of our heads and killing our buzz. If I wanted to dance at a club I'd be at one, but we wanted to eat so we went to a d^mn restaurant. So I decided to speak with the bartender himself.

I asked him if he could please turn it down because I couldn't hear anyone and it was just too loud. To my suprise, he told me that we could get our food and sit OUTSIDE where there were no speakers. This really pissed me off, but I maintained composure.  I told him that we weren't going to move tables and asked him again if he could just turn it down, so he copped a childish attitude and turned the music all the way down. I told him, "Look, you don't have to turn the music off. I'm not being unreasonable, I just wanted you to turn it down a little." We continued to bicker and he turned his music back up, so I went back to my table, asked for the check and couldn't get out of there fast enough. My fiance had to hold me back from more words with the bartender on the way out. I was PISSED. I've never been treated that badly at a restaurant before, as I consider myself very reasonable and polite. Don't eat here, unless the d--che bag is gone. Maybe then it won't be hell.

One of my worst experiences ever at a bar. Usually people go to a bar to socialise and have fun and be happy.  Wellll we just got done with a show near this bar and walked in right after to get some drinks and chat for a bit before leaving.  Christina at the front helped up well and was super sweet.  HOWEVERRRR let me tell you about the rudest most unprofessional bartender with this very ugly mean attitude. So we walk up to the bar and the girl (according to Christine her name is Daniela) I kindly asked her how much would the drinks were and if there was a drink menu so her response was "it's 5 dollars shots and 7 dollars for the drinks" but the problem here was her tone and her loud shouting.  Very extremely rude. So obviously we did not order anything and we asked the hostess what the bartenders name was. We told the hostess Christine also that we were leaving and we sat by the fountain to decide Where we were heading . This bartender comes storming yelling AGAIN!!! Saying the hostess said you're asking for me what do you guys want ? Her tone of voice irritated me so much I said we had told her we were leaving so we are not ordering anything.  She goes again shouting "I have a bar full of people what do you guys want" like what the heck!!!!  We left we are not inside your bar could you be polite and watch your tone!!! Very disappointed. Buzz killer
One of my favorite breakfast spots in addition to being a sports bar.  Opens at 7 am, and the breakfast is great and cheap!  The food is great and coffee is good too!

Worst food ever and over priced. Spaghetti sauce tasted like it came straight from a can. Meat balls like a card board that had been soaked and formed into a ball. Patty melt is bland. My sister liked the nachos because that was the first time she had one.  French fries is pretty much the only food I like.  Service is too slow. Waste of money.  I paid $67 for crappy spaghetti, nachos and bland patty melt. We ate here after the show and it was a big mistake.

$10 for a mug of beer, with the amount equivalent to 1 1/2 bottles. Not worth it. I chose a Cherry Bomb...thing, next where I was able to keep the glass, so that made me feel less cheated.

The idea of this place is great, and I wish we had Blondie's over in Miami, because those tables were wonderfully huge. But it's obvious you're paying extra money for where you're at, and there weren't even any drink specials. We were there from around 4:30 until 6:30 or 7ish, when you'd figure there would be a happy hour.

I was pleasantly surprised last night at Blondies. I was strolling through Planet Hollywood shops & playing a little at the Casino. Wanted to have a quick bite, nothing to big & decided to stop by. It was during the week so the crowd was light. I really liked the sports bar. There was flat screens everywhere of course. The appetizers were awesome full of flavor, I ordered a chicken Cobb salad & that was delicious. They give you your monies worth. The waitress was attentive, although they did seem short of staff (but that could of been because it was a weekday). I also had a great Frozen Strawberry Margarita or 2 haha! I usually don't like margaritas but the waitress recommended it & I was impressed. You can actually taste the liquor. It didn't take like a Slurpee from 7Eleven w/cheap liquor. The bill was decent, nevertheless the waitress got a nice tip &  I will definitely be going back when I'm at Planet Hollywood.

Cool place, within the Miracle Mile Shops, to grab a drink (or food). Lots of decorations to help the wondering eye, many tv screens-showing all types of sporting events/news, and a killer bar. 
We had some cold ones, as we pondered what to do the rest of the day, in Vegas. A staff member came around to snap a "voluntary" postcard photo of you. The postcard is cute, but if you love who you're with and the photo is adorbs, you'll likely shell out $20, like we did, for the larger, Vegas-themed backdrop with it. It resembles what you'd find at an amusement park. The staff was nice, but a tad slow behind the bar. Aka busy.
Great place to catch the games! Ashley P took great care of us both times we were in! Definitely coming back!

I now understand the few stars Blondie's has. The service was absolutely terrible. Our server could not tell us what specials were available during a sports game, came back twice to tell us the beers we ordered were sold out and our food arrived before she ever thought to bring us silverware (leaving me to have to track some down from the bar). The food was decent but the atrocious service would keep us from ever coming back.

After catching a show at the nearby V Theater, wandered over to Blondies when it was still located in the Aladdin Resort & Casino name.  It was probably a Tuesday, and that meant all you can drink beer and well drinks for $10.  

Walking into the back, tables of beer pong were in full action and it reminded me of fraternities gone wild.  There were even girls making out for the mere sake of making out in Vegas and having guys gawk at you.  (It wasn't even that late yet and the girls were far from drunk!)  

Bartenders were less than friendly, probably because they aren't making any tips during all you can drink beer nights.  And with that crappy attitude, what's the point?  

It's a bit of pain, they won't even let you in to eat or watch the games on the television without paying the $10 up front.  So, that part sucks alone.  They make you wear one of those bracelets anyway saying that you paid for all you can drink, so why not let other people in to eat?  

I personally wouldn't bother returning. I'm not interested in revisiting college frat life.  But if that' what you're looking for or am missing, swing on by!  You'll fit right in with your Greek letters.

They apparently have a happy hour here too.

SO AWFUL. My pasta had a nicw big clump  of hair in it. Did it get to tell my server?! No! She never came back! She charged us for chicken and when i finally saw her and told her none of is got chicken....she argued with me! I know what i ordered. The bar is a sports bar so it is LOUD. These waitrreses are so rude. Dont eat  here

Went here and had the chicken tacos which were really good. There happy hour is awesome and my server Bri couldn't have been any cooler she gave great service. Good food, great service, fun environment I will definitely be back to watch a game here!

The wife and I totally enjoyed the beer buckets even though they were advertised for $25.00 & we were charged $30.00 plus tax. My concern is nearly twenty-seven dollars for Nachos. They were tasty but we probably should have been advised about the cost. The review we read was from $3.00 didn't expect twenty-three more! Did enjoy the game though.
Horrible place. Service was below poor and the food was horrible. Never ever going here

Stopped here for breakfast after a long night, $3.99 breakfast? Sure! 

I had two eggs over medium, hash browns and bacon with a side of wheat toast.  We were the first ones in the restaurant and seated immediately, drinks and order taken.  We were kind of in a hurry because of an early flight and our food was prepared fast and accurate.  

Great stop - recommend if your in the Miracle Mile shops.
How can you beat all you can drink fir 20 bucks. Also their chocolate brownie Sunday was Amazing. Crowed a tad young fir my taste but it is a cool chill spot to get your drink on in Vegas...

Me and my wife stopped in yesterday to check out the games and am beyond happy we did so. Christen was our waitress and was by far the most fun and amazing server we've had our entire vacation! Obvious she loves her job and it shows. Wings were excellent! Beer was ice cold. We come to Vegas every year and will definitely make Blondies our go to place.
This was a waste......... over priced!!!! my burger was burnt the service was worse don't go here no manager around no one checking to see if everything is ok. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Ok the only reason they get one star is because I had to give them one to write a review!  This is the worst place for drinks I have ever been to! Do not get all you can drink deal unless you like cheap beer! They say well drinks are included but they taste like absolute crap! Well water that had fermented would be better then the drink. I actually tried to return it and was told I would have to pay 10 for it, when it was u drinkable! The place had only about 10 people in it but the waitstaff is so slow you would think the ace was packed! Horrible derive and drinks. You are better off going and playing the slots and getting free drinks!

This place is inside the shopping area in Planet Hollywood. Ended up here after walking around and looking for something to do!

They have a bunch of beer pong tables in the back. You can purchase one of their "beer pong" packages which consists of 22 cups and 2 balls for $5, and a pitcher of your favorite beer for anywhere between 15 and 25 bucks.

It's pretty fun for a change of pace from the clubs if you're chilling with a couple of friends :)

We went here at 12:15 last night for a drink. Sat down and waited 30 minutes while "bartenders" walked by and noticeably saw us sitting there but continued to ignore the fact that we were waiting. Walk up to the bar to order a drink and she says "oh this bar is closing go to the other one." So she goes and gets someone to come to our table. That chick says "oh it's last call because the bartender is having a bad night, and the kitchen is closed so we can't do much for you." Mind you their hours say open till 3:00 AM and it wasn't even 1:00 yet. So we left and took our money elsewhere realizing how big of a joke this place is. They will be shut down within the next 3 months I would bet on it.

DO NOT COME HERE. The bartender that was working on July 8th evening was COMPLETELY inappropriate. He was screaming at all the male guest. There was a bar crawl event that was led here who also filled the whole bar with business and when people were asking for their complimentary drink. Very aggressive to the point where I thought police needed to be contacted. I will also contacting the district manager and or higher up management. The waitress with long blonde hair refused to serve us or help us because we were with a group. Thankfully a very nice waitress who was training another your woman helped me. SPEND YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE.

Why do people get so offended by this place? Did you not go to college? This is essentially a college bar on the strip. Who goes to a college bar to be blown away by the food? 
If you go here do the following

Go during happy hour, its all you can drink

Go on college night, its all you can drink.

Go to play beer pong

Go to drink on the CHEAP on the strip

Go to watch some sports

Outside that DONT GO, it is not a place for date night or to have a 5 star meal. I mean this reminds me exactly of where I drank in college.

A bit expensive but super great food and you pay for what you get and then some.  The service was amazing! The garlic balls I highly recommend! (And it's free if you use this app) 
Definitely be back for more!

I had the nacho burger here and it was good. I was hoping for a bit more flavor though. It basically has all the nacho condiments stacked within including some bacon. A bit too much going on in the burger. I chose it though hoping for more flavor. My wife had the sliders and enjoyed them. They were good. It's a sport bar and it is great in that. Plenty of tvs for all kinds of events and they'll change it to your preference. Our server was friendly and we didn't wait too long either. I could've have ate twice as good at burgr, the ramsey place in the same bldg for about the same price. Just saying. We chose it because we were going to the zombie burlesque show after right next door. Would probably come back to watch a game.
Food wasn't that bad, I got the philly cheese steak burger with curly fries. Little messy but it was ok, service was ok, it wasn't too packed. Pretty pricey for what I got.

I hate to say it, but this time really sucked. Our waitress was very friendly, but she was so stretched that we barely seen her and had to wait 5 mins to ask for mayo and wait ten minutes after we were done eating to ask for a box. Managements fault...not hers. Probably maxing out tables per server to increase bottom line and food cost bonus.

Atmosphere was 4 stars. A lot of action and a fun place. Patrons were upbeat. 

Mixed reviews on the food. Built my own burger and the burger patty was flavorless and bland. Curly fries were great. Cobb Salad was large and fresh, and I thought was quite tasty...but girlfriend didn't care for it.

Even with a groupon, there are better options than eating here.

Terrible gross food, slow service. Came here on a Wednesday morning for lunch, got the turkey avocado wrap, I was only able to take 2 bites out of it cause it tasted disgusting, the turkey ham was warm, while the rest of the stuff in the wrap was cold, my husband ordered a blt and he couldn't eat it either, it had a bunch of bacon that felt stale and seemed as if it had been reheated from an old batch. The only good thing we got were bloody Mary's. We had initially tried to cancel the food order when we noticed they were short staffed, but our server said that she had put the order in already , we didn't complain about our food since we don't like to make a big deal out of things, but yea. Please don't come here, unless you like shitty food. I only gave 2 stars because our server was at least nice, not her fault this place is short staffed, and not her fault for the shitty food.
We were seated quickly, but we sat there for 45 minutes without a server. We left and wandered over to Cantinas.
I ordered the French dip! It was pretty big and tasted great. Me and the fam would definitely go back!

This place wasn't all that bad. My boyfriend and I were really hungry and thought this place sounded good.

I ordered a Bloody Mary and l o v e d it. For my meal, I ordered one of the wraps which was okay. I wasn't overly thrilled about it. You have to pay for fries or any other side, the meals don't come with it.

My boyfriend ordered the all you can eat pasta for $9.99 but he could only make it through one bowl of Fettuccini (which was DELICIOUS by the way). 

Our server was nice and attentive. 

Overall, it was probably about a B-.

Do you enjoy being served excuses instead of food and drink? How about iced tea that looks like it was made with powdered milk? Are you a fan of waiting 45 minutes for a round of drinks in barely crowded sports bars? 

If you answered yes to any of the above, you should go to Blondies and get the hell away from me. 

Our party of seven had an hour plus to kill before flying the F out of Sin City and (poorly) decided on Blondies for some much needed snacks and okay, fine, a drink/pitcher. Stop judging. 

We sat down and after 15 minutes or so, not one server had come by. How do you miss a group of 7 when your restaurant is the exact opposite of busy? Were we wearing One Rings? I walked up to the group (yes, GROUP) of servers and one of them explained, "Sorry, we're slammed." Girl, do you need a dictionary? Slammed is not the word you need - there are maybe 25 people in this piece. 

I'm going to cut this short because I'm getting all insanity wolf thinking about this place, but avoid Blondies at all costs unless you feel like you need to punish yourself for your poor life decisions during your trip. It's the kind of place where you wouldn't be that surprised if you bit into a deep fried rat. And if you look at all the other reviews that are over one star, assume it's because these people were blackout drunk because there is no way in actual hell this place is "CRACKIN'" or "pretty fun." It is "fucking terrible" and "should not exist."

We stopped here because we had a cool voucher deal. If you want to watch a game this place has flat screens everywhere! So that's the awesome part. Waitress cheerleaders are cool, but the food is so so. Although the seating set up can be kind of squishy so make sure wherever you are sitting you're not in an area where you'll feel like a freeway lane. You want to come here more for some drinks and finger foods because you're pretty much watching the game!

To be honest, it is Vegas after all, so i can't say I was expecting much. That said the bar is nice. Nice large TVs and a cool atmosphere, but the staff ruins the whole experience. We came here to watch the Charger game and they weren't even showing it. Still we pressed on and walked up to the Hostess booth. We were flat out ignored for 3 plays before I got annoyed and tried to grab the attention of the Hostess, who had been standing there the whole time with her finger in the air telling us to wait. I was told to "Hold on." And so I did, much to my dismay. When she finally looked up she said nothing, just stared. We asked for a table and asked how long the wait was. Honestly the place was packed and so I expected to wait, but the girl said "I don't know there's a list." We had to ask to be put on it and she said "What's your number?" and then turned around and walked off. I wasn't even sure she had actually written it down. We went in to try and grab a beer at the bar, but the bartenders were rude and didn't care. One of the hostesses ran into me and then rolled her eyes and walked away. Mind blown.... 

We found ourselves wandering into a seedy looking little bar across the way called The Stripper Bar. I thought we were about to go in for round two, but the service was amazing, the food was good, they were playing our game, they had better deals on drinks and our waitress did a pretty good dance on the pole at half time. I don't care if there is a 50 foot stripper right outside of the place. And aside from that, Blondies' TVs are so freaking huge we were able to watch their screens from our seats in the bar, we just turned around. I'll pick this place over Blondies any day.

Places that will not give me a glass of water when I am eating there are so lame.  If I am a paying customer you shouldn't require me to order a bottle of water as well.  Food was okay.. I frequent Vegas about 5-7 times a year, and sometimes stay at the PH.  But won't ever be eating here again on principle.  Provide your paying customers with water people, really.

The Buck Stops Here" meaning the CEO of this organization should be shown the door for allowing such an incompetent person that hired these totally incompetent wait persons. Sorry sir, had to stack everyone's toast on your plate as I was unable to find a clean plate. Coffee cream arrives 10 minutes after coffee is served. Breakfast was lousy and with out a doubt,  the most worthless wait persons I have ever encountered This place is a joke and goes to show...The Clowns Are Running The Circus.

We came here during a football game.  They had great music going during the commercials and a great vibe going on.  

When we walked up, we told the girl we needed a table for two.  She said, sorry, we don't have any tables.  Okay, then can we get on a list?  She says, "I guess so!  With the game on, I just don't know if anyone is going to leave soon."  (She didn't really seem to want us there).  Another girl walks up and says, "oh, there is a table right here."  Another girl says, "No, that's for another party."  So we give them our name and walk towards the bar.  Before we make it to the bar, a waitress comes back and says that we can have that table because the other party doesn't want it.  Geesh people, make up your mind!

We ordered two frozen drinks that were a special.  Something black cherry.  They came from a machine on the wall.  They were SUPER frozen.  After letting it thaw out, we finally gave it a taste and YUCK!!!  It tasted like cough syrup.  I guess maybe we should have sent it back but they were only $3, so we sucked it up and each drank about 1/2 of our little glass in the hour that we were there.

I ordered the roast beef sandwich and fries.  My friend got the grilled chicken wrap.  They were both okay.  Nothing special.  The fries were just average.  The waitress we got was actually really nice, so we can't knock her.  She initially charged us $5 each for our drinks but then changed it when asked.

As L and I wandered around the Miracle Mile looking for something good to eat we decided to stop by Blondie's and figure out where we were in relation to the front of the hotel.  We were actually attempting to get to the Hawaiian Tropic restaurant.  The girl in front literally looked at me and was like, "Um, you're in the Miracle Mile... in the Planet Hollywood."  HELLO, DUH!   I said nothing.  So, tired of wandering and having food smells lure us in, we decided to eat at Blondies.

The waitress seemed fine until she started talking.  L was feeling like a beer but the selection sucked- at a sports bar- wtf.  When she asked the waitress if there were cocktails or a wine list she told us that there was ONLY wine and that it was limited to the house red or white.  Too bad there was a full bar inside that I only noticed after ordering!!!!!!!!!!   Strike ONE.

Strike two- she neglected to ask me what kind of cheese I wanted on my chicken sandwich so I got NONE!  I was so disappointed as I am a total cheese freak.  After bringing these matters to her attention she said she would have the manager give us a discount.

Strike three?  The discount was maybe 2% (like a dollar and some change) of the entire bill.  I guess the gesture was nice and all but if it was such a silly amount it was pretty much pointless.

They put powdered sugar on their sweet potato fries which sounds ok in theory but doesn't work when they're a side to a burger.  It's also quite pricey for average food and terrible service.  Yeah... no.

Great place to go to watch games while having some greasy bar food and a bucket of beer. Service is good too, the girls are spunky and efficient. you can make reservations a day in advance to reserve your seat for popular game days.
Happy hour sucked. $8 rail drinks. We went to watch a specific game they were rude about changing the channel.  No one seemed to know what the heck was going on. Terrible place. Never again!

$5 pitcher of beer was awesome but only if you have a college id, lol. They have beer pong tables and waitresses (not blondes) dressed in cheerleader outfits, quite interesting...

The food was not great through. I had the Philly cheese steak (which had one of the Blondie's specialties icon next to it) and the bread to steak and cheese sucked. There was a lot more bread then steak, wth? It was quite expensive, for simple American food. Also for water you got to get the bottled water, lol unbelievable. There's a lot of TV's for the sport lovers out there but I won't be coming back anytime soon.

Food mediocre. Actually, it was less than mediocre.  I wish we'd have gone somewhere else.  The garlic bread bites which were rated and recommended were like chewy balls of butter and dough... bbq chicken pizza was just okay. Service was average, but the waitress didn't come back to refill our drinks until the very end of the meal. After paying and leaving, we discovered my friend's phone 'went missing', and after looking everywhere,  they finally checked security tapes, went to the kitchen and found the phone and said it was 'stuck to a plate'... when does that happen??? I'd skip this place as the food, service and safety of personal belongings has got to be better elsewhere. Stuck to a plate... seriously.

We went here for the Cotto vs. Martinez fight, got here an hour early and the place was packed. The man at the front entrance stated the fight was going to be displayed on the outside entrance of the bar, we waited on the outside for awhile, we were lucky enough to grab two seats, the two male bartenders were un-attentive, couldn't get a drink.

The black male at the front entrance later made an announcement the fight was going to be displayed on the inside of the bar, and since the demand to watch the fight was so high they were going to start charging everyone there to watch the fight, complete bullshit, they advertised online that the fight was free, we called in to double-check the fight was free, when we got there we informed the man at the front entrance we were there to watch the fight, he let us in then 30 minutes later tried to charge us? After we argued he said we were fine, that we were grandfathered in since we were there before they decided to start charging people.

Now we were upset because we wasted 30 minutes outside of the bar to find a seat, when we could have been inside waiting for a seat. When we called earlier they said they didn't take reservations, when we proceeded to the inside of the bar there were 3 tables reserved, no one sitting at them to watch the fight.

Once again we were lucky enough to find seats on the inside at a table of 4 with only 2 guys sitting there, they were nice enough to let us share the table.

Our waitress is the only reason there is 2 stars, I'm not sure of her name, but she was very nice, very understanding, and decently attentive for how packed the place was.

The food, we got a Chicken Caesar Wrap and a side of fries, the wrap was full of lettuce and very little chicken, I got 2 quarter sized pieces on my half, we assumed the chicken would be grilled as most are and instead it was deep fried. The fries were very soggy and greasy, they weren't bad though. The price on the menu for the wrap was $13 and some change, we got billed $16 alone for it and some change plus tax. Menu error? Waitress error? 2 Touch Pos system error? Who knows.

Now right before the main fight starts, a waitress comes to our table and places a reserve sign on our table without saying a thing and walks away. We yelled to get her attention, she came back and said our table will be reserved for the fight, we said we were watching the fight, she told us we would have to pay for the table PLUS have to pay to watch the fight. COMPLETE BULLSHIT, I don't know who manages this place but you don't advertise a free fight on the internet, you don't tell people over the phone the fight at your bar is free and that you aren't taking reservations and then decide to change your mind, to charge people for the fight, to charge people for tables, and start taking reservations because the demand is high  to watch the fight, unbelievable. 

After arguing with the lady and telling her who we talked to and what they said, she went to confirm with him, came back and said we were fine. Not one person in this bar knew what the hell was going on, completely disorganized and chaotic. 

While watching the fight a man that was very intoxicated fell and hit his head on my barstool, he could have injured himself very badly, I'm not sure who his waitress was, but it was her job to cut him off long before he got to that point, after he fell and hit his head, he couldn't stand up on his own a friend had to help him, even after that, he still didn't get cutoff.
