The only reason I would come back here is because our waitress was so nice, other then that management needs to get their sh*t together, that's not how you run a sports bar.

We ended up here to avoid the $60/seat minimum at the casino sports bar. Sandwiches were about $15, service was friendly and good, it wasn't too crowded on college football game day. Would def recommend if you just need a basic, not too pricey, place to watch the game.

So we sit down and wait 5min to even have anyone ask if we want anything. Reason why the female bartender was to busy talking to her friends and doing shots with them. Then I say Budweiser draft she says only bottle. Ok that's fine then less than 5 min later the male bartender pours a beer from the Budweiser tap! WTF?!?!? Horrible service! I'm a local and this is the second time I've came here in less than two weeks with this kind of service. Don't stop here just keep walking!

My first night in Vegas ever!!!  Got drunk at Blondies!  It was a fabulous experience.  Didn't eat anything, just drank a lot and can't count the amounts of chilled stoli shots we did.  Woke up with my to-go cup on my night stand in my room at Bally's.  The bartender knew our local bartender from Sleepy Hollow NY, hooked us up, and made us feel right at home!

My husband and I decided to stop at Blondies to spend our last few hours in Las Vegas and I'm glad we did. We ended up spending about 2-3 hours at the bar while we waited to go to the airport to catch our flight home. The Sweet Habanero wings and Parmesan Truffle fries were a hit! I also highly recommend the Fuzzy Mule (their spin on a Moscow Mule) it was delicious. Huge shout out to Daniela on the bar staff and Keith the manager who sat and chatted with my husband and I for a while and made us feel so at home. 

From Philly to Vegas...we'll def be back!!!

2 1/2 stars?? 

Everyone musta missed the 20$ open bar happy hour. the wings aren't bad either. of course the bartender lags upon flashing your wristband. get everyone to kick in some cash and throw the bartender a decent tip, like anywhere in vegas,  they'll definitely keep the rounds coming. they also have beer pong tables, if you're into that kinda thing.

definitely a good place to kick off friday night in sin city.

I came here on St. Patty's Day in 2008 and it was so much fun!!!

We paid $30 (or was it $25) for all you can drink... and boy did we have our fill of green beer!!!! 

They have beer pong tables... which was A LOT of fun... it's a very casual and kick-back atmosphere and the people there are really down to earth and cool.

It seemed like everyone there was there to have fun.. no drama, no frills.. just plain old fun!!!

1) they do not serve tap water.  I had to pay for a bottle of water!  I tend to drink a lot of water and can easily go through 2 or 3 of those bottles of water in a meal so rationing out my one bottle of water to last through the meal was not the easiest task.  Especially since I was already a little dehydrated and tend to rely on restaurant tap water for hydration when I'm in vegas anyway...

2) The food is kinda bland.  You must pay extra for a lot of condiments/extras that typically come with your meal.  However, I do tend to like food a little on the plain side so I really enjoyed my sandwich.  The turkey in it was really fresh, as was the lettuce and tomato in it.  Not having any mustard/mayo/etc. added to it was a little odd to me though.  It felt like something was missing the entire time I was eating.

3) Loved the steak fries here..

4) a little overpriced, but that is to be expected in this type of vegas dining.

We stopped in here to get a burger but never ate. The hostess was not there to seat us and waited awhile to be seated and after being seated we sat there for almost ten minutes before someone finally came to wait on us. After the 10 minutes of waiting we realized the menu sucked as well. So we just opted for the bucket of beers. And guess what it says 5 for 25 and then we were told that was the wrong price too and it cost more and they are aluminum bottles fyi. I can't say much about this place. Also another FYI make note that they have a hidden charge for using your card and not cash. It is on an itsy bitsy little sign on the front of the hostess table.

My review is based strictly on their mozzarella sticks.

They are amazing!

Other than that, all I can say is that they apparently have a really good happy hour and it is located in the shops at Planet Hollywood. For a quick  bite and a drink though, I would definitely recommend it.
Really cool place. Good looking waitresses, beer pong tournaments too

This place is awful. Chips and salsa: chips were stale. Waitress: slow, totally oblivious to her customers and cared more about gossiping with her fellow waitresses. Music: crappy club music no one in their right mind wants to hear the day after in Vegas. 

I highly suggest going to Lombardi's restaurant next door.

The atmosphere isn't bad for a sports bar, but since there weren't any games on it kind of made it unbearable. 
I got a chicken quesadilla, which was acutely pretty good. If you're looking for a cheaper bite to eat, I would tell you to go somewhere else.

This place used to be a fun place to go to back in 2010 for birthdays, or a good place to watch some Sunday Night FB. 

Unsure of what happened six years later...

I guess what had a red flag was when the hostess sat us literally next to the tv, and asked to be moved she walked away with no customer service. Second, was when a friend of mine asked where the bathroom was, the hostesses conversation was more important ( & I understand when deep convos are made you want to get your point in but the restaurant was slow enough for them to stop what they were doing). Lastly, they kept messing up on our order. If you're going to hire new bartenders the best thing you can do is cater to the patrons needs instead of making your own creation esp when the drinks you are making are bartender themselves. 

Our serve was really chill which is why I gave a star but if she wasn't our server we would've walked out. 

If I knew this was going to be a horrible experience, I would convinced my friends to eat at Cabo for a better dining.

Do not go here place sucks.  2 hundred thumbs down!!!!!!!   We reserved a table to watch a UFC fight on line for 200 plus dollars about a month ahead of the event. Decided to pick this place because it had advertised free beers an supposedly no. 1 sports bar in Vegas.   Yeah right self proclaimed don't be fooled. Got there when the show starts at 7 PM.  Place was jam packed. Went to the front of the line to get in an show host our reservations.  Lady took us in to our table.  Could barely walk because so much people shoulder to shoulder.  It must be a fire hazard.  Finally got to our table only to find that our table had NOT been reserved.  There was about 10 people  occupying the space that we had paid money for.  No   reserved sign at all. An there was fresh food that just had been brought out for some scrubs in my space so then I knew that they did not reserve the table.  We decided to leave an take the loss.  Do not go there very dissapointed.  This was supposed to be one of the highlights of our trip because it was my girlfriends birthday.  We did not watch the fight, missed the whole show.   Definitely not recommended!!!!!!!!!!

Hmm, well it's relatively affordable as far as Vegas goes. And they have a lot of TV's. There was room to sit here as opposed to PH's sports-book bar that was packed to the brim. The 'famous' chicken wings were anything but. I feel bad for the midget chickens that these came from. The chili fries were okay. I'd go back in a pinch, but it wouldn't be my first choice.
This place I happening!!  Good drinks, food and a place to watch sports n UFC

Blondie's target patron is the sports fanatic that is willing to belly up to the bar for an extended time to watch their multiple screens, drink, play beer pong on non sporting event days, and have a good time. Thank you Blondie's, I'll gladly accept the invitation. They are a sports bar and they make no bones about it. I would not recommend this place if you're expecting a quiet, peaceful meal with gourmet food. Blondie's hits the sweet spot for NFL Sundays and March Madness.

We clocked in just before noon on the first Thursday of March Madness and clocked out around 9 PM. Definitely reserve a table online for busy days like this. We didn't reserve a table and started out at the standing room by the back bar. By around 3 or 4 we had four seats across on the back bar with Daniel taking care of us. The minimum spending amount per customer that day was $45, which we had no problem meeting.

We had an unobstructed view of about ten screens all day with just a wave of the hand to Daniel for another round of drinks any time. The specials that day were a bucket of 5 beers for $25 and $6 shooters of Jameson, fireballs, or Patron. We had 7 buckets of beer, multiple rounds of shots, and plenty of action on the games. We did order a large pizza, a chicken quesadilla, and curly fries at some point, but honestly, I don't recall how any of it tasted at all.

The only snags we ran into all day was the restroom situation and the distance of the sports book. The restroom had one stall and one urinal only. With hundreds in the bar drinking, it often created a line out the door. Also, the sports book is about a ten minute walk to the front of Planet Hollywood. With long lines in the book, this leads to about a half hour trip to the sports book if needed. So place your bets early or have a mobile sports app.

Yes, we were gouged on beer prices (we basically paid $175 for a case and a half of bud light), but I had a great time with my buddies and our neighbors and we were paying for the entertainment value. We had better views of the games compared to a sports book. And we had plenty of action all day and won a little scratch. It was a memorable experience and I would do it again in a second.

I had absolutely the worst experience I have ever had at a bar on the strip at blondies today. 11/4/14. The bar was busy and the restaurant was too and there was only one bartender. Being in a hurry to get the Britney Spears concert it made it impossible to get a drink before. Completely unacceptable for Vegas standards.

I don't mind paying high prices in Vegas for good food, but this is a let down.  Terrible bar food, using no fresh ingredients.  After trying 3 different items there (Ruben, sliders, and cheese steak) it's time to throw in the towel.  I won't go back.  Service was average, but not what you expect in Las Vegas, a city that operates on service.

If this place depended on repeat business they wouldn't make it long.

So, my husband and I were hungry and just wanted something close by where we were staying, so we decided to try Blondies. 

We ordered the regular size pepperoni pizza. I asked for a water and they waitress stated they only have bottled water!  I will never pay more than $1 for bottled water, so I ordered a soda. 

The pizza was good. Our waitress sucked. My husband never got a refill on his drink and the cup sat there empty.

When the receipt came I was so angry to see a soda cost $4!!! Really?! So $30 was the total for a pizza for two and two sodas! 

I would never come back here.
Do not expect good service. We finally left cause no waitress came to our table and none of the other waitresses cared when we asked.

The trip to Blondies made my trip to Vegas even better. My friends and I went to Blondies during there 7 yr anniversary, they has a 20$ all you can drink beer, which was awesome because we played an enormous rounds of beer pong. But when you first step into the bar the first thing you'll notice is the vast number of big screens they have. Second is the two bars they have in stock. Third the 8 beer pong tables they have ready for people to play. And to save the best for last the beautiful hostesses in their cheerleader uniforms. 

This is a great place to watch sporting event, have a great time with friends, meet new people, and play beer pong. They have great hospitality, great vibes, great music mix, and a good price for a pitcher of beer for pong. 

So I would like to thank Blondies for the great times they have given me and my friends when we were there. Special thanks to my bartender katie. She will always and will be my number one bartender for life. Much love and much respect to that girl.

I came here after a long work day with a friend and decided to do the all-you-can-drink deal. Our bartender was great! She suggested certain drinks and told us the rules of the the whole drinking thing. Although, she did something that I appreciated but won't say what because this isn't a tattle-tale review and she needs to keep working there. Five drinks in and we were done! I recommend this place if you're just trying to hang out and drink a bunch. Cant beat $20 bucks.

I'm just as bad at beer pong now as I was in my late teens (if not worse) but it's still fun.

Nice sports Bar nice service everything  mucho Bueno

I was on a quick get away to Las Vegas and came across a Blondies in the mall connected to my hotel. I had a fun and lively ambiance... Elisa was our server and she was great! This is the kind of place that you can watch a game have a few beers and be reminded of your dorm days.....

I got a hair in my burger, lost my appetite, this place needs to get its hygiene up to par. I will never eat here again since I dont want to eat hair.

Who knows.

It was the middle of the afternoon and the basketball game was about to begin. There was going to be a cover charge to enter Blondies after 3p. Luckily we got there earlier because I would have been very disappointed if we had to pay a cover. Sure, us girls were not in the mood to watch sports but still.

EHHH...

My friends came to Vegas and wanted to try this place out because they had coupons for it. I expected it to be blah, since I checked the reviews of the place before hand. I ordered their chicken sandwich, which was grilled (and BURNT AND REALLY TOUGH/HARD ON THE ENDS OF THE BREASTS!) Oh my gosh! It made me full though, since I didn't eat anything that morning and afternoon. The only thing I ate good here was the curly fries (and the honey mustard...and definitely the dill pickle....and my unsweetened ice tea)

Oh btw.......you have to buy a small water bottle here...which is a $1...and they give you a cup with ice....

There is a happy hour from 4-6pm...$10 all you can drink Bud, I believe....They also have this HUGE pitcher of beer which is great for a group of friends...(forgot the price, but it's very affordable!) You can also play beer pong here too!

The waitresses were dressed in skimpy cheerleading outfits, which many were not very tasteful in. Don't eat outside unless you want to hear a load of noise during your meals, since it's right across from that performing arts stage with acrobats! It's a bit quieter inside, even if the sports games are on. It could get very LOUD though when there's a big game!

No. Just no. 

We were informed to come here after TAP at MGM said they were one of the few places showing the McGregor/Diaz and Holm/Tate fight.

Got there and there was a bit of a line that moved quickly. The bouncer told us it would be $60 a person cover but "all you can drink" once you're inside. Two of my friends immediately left because they didn't want to pay that much for cover. My other friend and I wanted to check other places first (Twin peaks & Cabo Wabo). Other places were at least $75 with nothing included so Blondies seemed like a better deal. 

We came back, paid the $60 and were shocked when we got inside. (you can't see the inside of the bar on fight night as there as black curtains draped everywhere). It was PACKED. When I say packed I mean they should have a maximum capacity limit which they clearly ignored. Every table was taken, and they had chairs set up in every other open floor area which were also all taken. People were literally eating pizza off of the floor due to lack of seating and tables. 

They also didn't tell us that "all you can drink" meant ONLY bud light. My friend doesn't even drink beer (gluten intolerance) so it was a total rip off for her. Bud light is not my drink of choice, I would have rather had a cheap well vodka with soda. This was so deceiving and should have been told to us at the door upon taking our money. 

It was just pure chaos. We paid $60 to stand and be pushed by rushed waitresses telling us "excuse me" and "please move" for FOUR HOURS!!! 

I would NEVER come back here. Staff is dishonest and only wants your money. I've never been more uncomfortable in a bar in my life. Never again. STAY AWAY!

This place was amazing from the beginning !!
Beer pong tables!?
Beer pong competitions!?
Need to say more..?
The waitresses are wearing mini cheerleading outfits and are super upbeat and talkative!
When you check into Yelp you get a free appetizer! 
The food was amazing even though it's bar food! 
Order the deep fried pickles they're to die for.

This place is ok.

While touring Planet Hollywood an overwhelming sensation for a nice refreshing lemon drop came upon me so, not really knowing where to satisfy my craving, we just happened to walk by this place and decided to check them out.

The place (Interior wise) is nothing really special, just your typical sports bar.

Our bartender was extremely nice and went well out of his way to make some decent lemon drops, especially considering the fact that its a sports bar where lemon drops are not usually a specialty of there's.

Overall, the drinks were ok, the bartender was extremely friendly and the place supposedly gets pretty packed when the games are playing which is when they have some special prices on beers and so forth, but in all honesty, it definitely is not  a place I would look forward to stopping in again.

Blondies! Looking for a sports bar with tons of TV's, the usual bar food, beer on tap? Blondies at the Miracle Mile will deliver. Gotta love the $20 all-you-can-drink offer too.

Perfect place to grab a beer, watch some sport, and get serviced by the blonde waitresses. I'm in.

So sad the food is not the same as it used to be. I came back here several times for the awesome greek salad now it sucks. And the garlic fries are horrible too. Basically it's just now overpriced bar food.

There is a eaten chicken wing at the table I was seated at. Um? I assume the staff didnt care about the cleaning of this table before seating us. With that being said, have a nice day lol. Never coming here again. Adios.
Food was alright and pricey. Service wasn't that great either. The sports environment is fun but service is just too slow.

We were in need of some mid morning beers while walking through the miracle mile shops and stopped in at Blondies - the place was pretty empty so we snagged a table outside for some ample people watching. They have $20 all you can drink beer but we just settled for pitchers. Their beer selection was pretty disappointing for a sports place but luckily they had preseason NFL games to keep us occupied. Inside of the restaurant reminds you of a dirty 'ol college bar so I'd recommend sitting outside, unless you like the whole frat house beer stains everywhere thing.

Time after time I visit Blondies when I'm visiting Las Vegas and it will continue to be a tradition.  I've enjoyed many different sporting events here with friends as they have, if I have to guess, over 40 large TVs with great viewing angles.  The service is great, and the staff is beautiful.  There are awesome drink specials as well.  For example, $20 gets you all-you-can-drink draft beers and well drinks.  You can't beat it.  Finally...the food.  Hands down, best bar kitchen!  From pizza to steak and  potatoes...I haven't come across an item that I've had to second guess or doctor up.  All-in-all, check this place out if you get the chance.  You won't regret it.

We went to Blondies in the Miracle Mile Shops to watch UFC fights which of all the tv screens they have none was on prelims. Our waitress took 10-15 min to even acknowledge us and another 5 for just water. The food was alright. Still no prelims on tv and we asked and she said yeah sure.....NOTTTTT.

maybe a 1.5 stars for me, maybe.

so my friends and i stroll in here while our trek through miracle mile shops at planet hollywood. the only reason why i walked in here was for the beer pong. another beer pong joint on the strip besides oshea's?! awesome! of course i compare the two: oshea's wins hands down. cheaper and better service.

so my friends and i get a table here, get our beer and set up. round one, i lost, that's cool, there really are no losers in this game anyways (that's what i tell myself when i'm stuck with more beer than i can handle). then again, i already had a 1/2 yard of some sort of vegas juice in my system, so i wasn't feeling like chugging more down. a friend gets more beer and we are setting up for a next game. next thing we know, we are all being told to finish up our games b.c they are setting up for a ufc fight. they start taking down tables and take cups to re-fill our pitchers. excuse me, wtf?!?! why would your guys at the bar sell us beer for beer pong if they know you're gonna set up for a fight in a bit. that's some shady ass shit!!! so i ask where can we sit to finish our beer. "honey?! who you callin' honey?!?!" then i start on some rant, yellin' and throwing punches in the air, one of them actually punching one of the bartenders out! as the rest of my fellow beer pong patrons cheer me on and join in on the ass kicking fun!!

yeah, that never really happened, but all i gotta say is that you got a place with bartenders sportin' mohawks, seriously, every single one of them had one! i dunno if it's a requirement, but that should've given me the clue to stay away. douchebags might as well have been wearing ed hardy shirts.

we ended up getting a seat b.c we just sat down at a table and a waitress came by with a menu. the food was your typical bar food. but i was inebriated so my mini corn dogs and fries with honey mustard sauce was poifect fro my drunchies.

the only reason for 1.5 stars is the beer pong, i will always have a place in my heart for beer pong.

I came here last year 2011 around April during a softball tourney with some co-workers. I was sold on this place because it was EMPTY. It allowed a gang of us to play beer pong in peace, and get drinks and food without an issue.

I will admit getting the waitresses attention was sometimes difficult, even with there being less than 15 people in the entire place. This may have been due to the fact I was not sober.

We did order the big tall beer thingy. From what I recall it was a decent deal split among friends. But who's looking at deals when you're with a gang of cool buds, eating bar food, and playing some beer pong?!

I'd recommend dropping in with a group if its not too crowded, as there is plenty of seating/TV's. I can only imagine it gets packed here during March Madness or regular football season.

Side note: waitresses are indeed dressed to only what Vegas can offer.

Overall I was pleased with the place and will drop by to see if it was the same as it was a year ago. March madness, here we go!

The food was bad and over priced.  The waitress was slow and not helpful.  She couldn't even think of anything to suggest we get when asked.  Also, she served me a beer that was only 3/4 full and charged me $5 bucks for those 6ozs of bud light.  
The bartender single handily ruined the night for the group with rude comments and D bag behavior.  At one point he called out some people in our group over the PA system to stop cheering about the beer pong tournament because they were annoying. This caused a few of them to be insulted.  They were not out of control or anything... just gave a woot to our friends who were playing.  
But hey no worries, Mr. Bartender,  I'll never suggest to any of my out of town guests, who are looking for some fun, to spend any of their money at Blondies.

I came ,I ate at 1/2 price,still felt a little reamed ..Their  grill has uneven heat 1/2 of my rib-eye was overcooked 1/2 too rare.$10 bucks for a watered down Manhattan? I shall not return ,even at 1/2 price :( That The "help" was very cute and seemed genuinely concerned .Does not make up for the total fail out of the kitchen.

Overpriced mediocre food. DO NOT go here. The service was awful! We had to ask our waitress three times for napkins and silverware! Super slow service and to top it off the waitress charged us for an item we didn't even order. Never coming to this place again!!
The burger was pretty much the only thing that was good here. Beer selection was pretty limited and service was mediocre at best. It's a bummer that the buffalo wild wings isn't open yet.

Four stars because the tip guide on the receipt is with tax. Gratuity is always before the taxed amount, so disregard their guide. Had the $3.99 breakfast. Added toast and coffee. Very good. Excellent service.

Came for the all you can drink $20 domestic beers / well drinks happy hours from 3-6pm. 
Well they REUSE your solo cups. Pours of flat beer. Only choice of beers were bud light and Budweiser. Also got the buffalo fries basket. No blue cheese just straight buffalo. Bar seemed under staffed. Waitress was nowhere to be found and only Came by as needed. 
I wouldn't recommend coming back or taking advantage of their misleading "domestic draft beer" promo.

We stopped here for  wrist bands special for drinking like all you can drink I think it was for like a couple of hours per person who had it on and only certain drinks.
We went with a couple of our friends. The drinks we had you can tell it was the cheapest liquor they could use in the well drinks and the mixes they use are very sweet for pre made drinks they use.
The place is usually loud it is hard to hear anyone talking unless you are right next to who you are talking to. You can tell the bartender is not too happy when doing the wrist bands, so he acts really busy so when you do need another one it takes a bit for him to come and make it.
We would not just stop here to have a drink, and if it wasn't for having friends in town who was staying at PH we probably would have not gone here.

We did eat here once for dinner just me and my husband. Prices for dinner are higher than some places, I guess cause it is in the miracle mile shop area.
We thought the food was ok, Service was not the best, they were busy when the waitress would leave it was a bit before she came back.
Over all this is not a locals place it is touristy for sure! I would definitely read the reviews before coming here.

4 stars for their all- you- can- drink beer pong deal from 3-6pm for $20 per person.

It was my second appearance at Blondies for dinner, and this time to start I opted for a bowl of Spicy Chili, which was excellent in flavor, and true to its name but not overly spicy--yet could have been heated hotter.  Then I followed up with an excellent Build Your Own Burger.  Mine was a half-pound medium-rare burger festooned with lettuce, tomato, pickles, American Cheese, mushrooms, bacon, and fresh avocado slices, which was indeed a mouthful.  And Diane and I split a generous order of very fine and flexible elongated French Fries.  My party was seated in the patio area along the Miracle Mile directly facing a lively, overactive water fountain and the V Theater.  The mood was festive.  Service by cheerleader-clad waitresses was friendly, swift, and accurate.  And only some paper scraps on the floor detracted from the sports bar ambiance.

But, as many have said, food is king.  And, here the food is very good indeed!
